Revision 1.2 2004/12/02 23:29:11 packel added key attributes to compound verb entries
Revision 1.1 2004/11/22 17:07:40 packel converted to P4/XML
Revision 1.20 2004/10/18 18:17:47 packel added div0s; changed orth ʼa)da/mas,ʼ to a)da/mas
Revision 1.19 2004/10/07 14:18:11 packel removed *s in entry keys

Revision 1.17 2004/09/08 15:49:42 packel Changed doctype to TEI P4
Revision 1.16 2004/09/01 15:44:25 packel Fixed thirty-odd words that had multiple entries but no number afterward to differentiate the entries (e.g., si=gma, si=gma is now si=gma1, si=gma2).
Revision 1.15 2004/06/15 19:31:34 lcerrato changed nothwithstanding to notwithstanding
Revision 1.14 2003/02/04 21:21:51 lcerrato fixed typo kuma entry swoln to swollen
Revision 1.13 2001/12/05 15:15:58 gcrane shifted the lemma for "pa/nth" to be "pa/nth|"
Revision 1.12 2001/04/20 21:58:57 dasmith Added funder.

Revision 1.9 2000/10/06 21:44:13 dasmith Added author and ISBN to head. Use new DTD subset. Explicitly tag lemmata and cross references as Greek.
Revision 1.8 2000/03/04 20:25:11 dasmith Standardized language IDs. Added key attribute to entry.
Revision 1.7 1998/08/24 19:15:31 jrydberg finished trans tags and added new prep. defs.

Revision 1.5 1998/08/19 20:50:08 jrydberg Replaced all "(trans) or (/trans)" with " or "
Revision 1.4 1998/08/19 18:23:58 jrydberg Corrected trans tagging for short defs. through a)mfote/rwqen.

div0.head: Μ

div1.head: μάγαδις
div1.sense: acc. μάγαδιν:— the magadis, a kind of harp, with twenty strings, Com.

div1.head: μαγάς
div1.sense: the bridge of the cithara, Lat. pons.

div1.head: μαγγάνευμα
div1.sense: a piece of jugglery; in pl. juggleries, deceptions, Plat.

div1.head: μαγγανεύω
div1.sense: to use charms or philtres, of Circe, Ar.:— to play tricks, Dem.

sense.trans: any means for charming or bewitching, a philtre.

div1.head: μαγεία
div1.sense: the theology of the Magians, Plat.

div1.head: μαγειρεῖον
div1.sense: a cook-shop, Lat. popina, Arist., Babr.
the place where the public cooks lived, the cooksʼ quarter, Theophr.

div1.head: μαγειρεύω
div1.sense: to be a cook, to cook meat, Theophr.
to be a butcher, Babr.

div1.head: μαγειρικός
div1.sense: fit for a cook or cookery, Ar., etc.:— ἡ μαγειρικὴ τέχνη cookery, Plat.:—adv. -κῶς, in a cook-like way, like a true "artist, " Ar.

div1.head: μάγειρος
div1.sense: a cook, Hdt., Attic
a butcher, Eur. (From !μαγ, Root of μάσσω ( q. v.), because baking bread was the business of the ancient cook.)

div1.head: μάγευμα
div1.sense: a piece of magic art; in pl. charms, spells, Eur.

div1.head: μαγεύς
div1.sense: one who wipes, Anth.

div1.head: μαγεύω
div1.sense: to be a Magus, use magic arts, Plut.: c. acc. cogn., μέλη μ. to sing incantations, Eur.
trans. to call forth by magic arts, Anth.

div1.head: μαγικός
div1.sense: fit for the Magians, Magian, Plut.

div1.head: Μάγνης
div1.sense: a Magnesian, a dweller in Magnesia in Thessaly, Il., etc.; or Magnesia in Lydia, Hdt., etc.: fem. Μάγνησσα, Theocr.:—adj. Μαγνητικός, ή, όν Magnesian, Aesch.; fem. Μαγνῆτις, ιδος, Pind.
Μαγνῆτις λίθος, the magnet, Plat.

div1.head: Μάγος
div1.sense: a Magus, Magian, one of a Median tribe, Hdt.
one of the wise men in Persia who interpreted dreams, Hdt.
any enchanter or wizard, and in bad sense, a juggler, impostor, Soph., Eur., etc.;—fem., Anth.

div1.head: μαγοφόνια
div1.sense: the slaughter of the Magians, a Persian festival, Hdt.

div1.head: μαδαρός
div1.sense: wet, flaccid: bald, Anth.

div1.head: μαδάω
div1.sense: to be flaccid: to be bald, Ar.

div1.head: μᾶζα
div1.sense: a barley-cake, Hdt., Hes., Attic

div1.head: μαζίσκη
div1.sense: a barley-scone, Ar.

div1.head: μαζονόμος
div1.sense: a trencher for serving barley cakes on, Hor.

div1.head: μάθημα
div1.sense: that which is learnt, a lesson, Hdt., Soph., etc.
learning, knowledge, science, oft. in pl., Ar., Thuc., etc.: esp. the mathematical sciences, Plat., etc.

div1.head: μαθηματικός
div1.sense: disposed to learn, Plat.
mathematical:— μαθηματικός, οῦ, a mathematician, Arist.; τὰ μαθηματικά mathematics, Arist.
astronomical, mathematici = Chaldaei, Juven.

div1.head: μάθησις
div1.sense: learning, the getting of knowledge, Soph., Thuc., etc.
desire of learning, Soph.
education, instruction, Plat., Xen.

div1.head: μαθητέος
div1.sense: to be learnt, Hdt.
μαθητέον, one must learn, Ar., Xen.

div1.head: μαθητεύω
div1.sense: to be pupil, τινί to one, Plut.
trans. to make a disciple of, instruct, NTest.

div1.head: μαθητής
div1.sense: a learner, pupil, Lat. discipulus, Hdt., Plat., etc.

div1.head: μαθητιάω
div1.sense: Desiderat. of μανθάνω, to wish to become a disciple, Ar.
= μαθητεύω, Anth.

div1.head: μαθητικός
div1.sense: disposed to learn, τινος Plat.

div1.head: μαθητός
div1.sense: learnt, that may be learnt, Xen., Plat.

div1.head: Μαίανδρος
div1.sense: Maeander, a river of Caria, Il., Hdt.
metaph. a winding pattern, Strab.

div1.head: μαῖα
div1.sense: good mother, dame, Od.
a fostermother, nurse, Eur.:—also a true mother, Aesch., Eur.
a midwife, Plat.

div1.head: Μαῖα
div1.sense: Maia, daughter of Atlas, mother of Hermes, Hhymn., Hes.

div1.head: μαίευμα
div1.sense: the product of a midwifeʼs art, a delivery, σὸν μὲν παιδίον, ἐμὸν δὲ μαίευμα Plat.

div1.head: μαιεύομαι
div1.sense: fut. σομαι, Dep. to serve as a midwife, Luc.
c. acc. pers. to deliver a woman, Plat.

div1.head: μαίευσις
div1.sense: delivery of a woman in childbirth, Plat.

div1.head: μαιευτικός
div1.sense: of or for midwifery, obstetric, Plat.: —ἡ μαιευτική τέχνη or ἡ -κή alone, midwifery, — the name given by Socrates to his art of eliciting from others what was in their minds, Plat.

div1.head: Μαιμακτηριών
div1.sense: the fifth Attic month, the end of November and beginning of December, Dem.

div1.head: Μαιμάκτης
div1.sense: epith. of Zeus, the boisterous, stormy, in whose honour a festival was held at Athens in the month Μαιμακτηριών, Plut.

div1.head: μαιμάω
div1.sense: to be very eager, pant or quiver with eagerness, Il.; c. gen., χεῖρα μαιμῶσαν φόνου a hand eager for murder, Soph.

div1.head: Μαίναλον
div1.sense: Mount Maenalus in Arcadia, sacred to Pan, Theocr.:—adj. Μαινάλιος, η, ον, Pind.; ἡ Μαιναλία ( sc. χώρα) Thuc.

div1.head: μαινάς
div1.sense: raving, frantic, Eur.
as Subst. a mad woman, Il.: esp. a Bacchante, Bacchanal, Maenad, Soph.; of the Furies, Aesch.; of Cassandra, Eur.
act. causing madness, Pind.

div1.head: μαίνη
div1.sense: maena, a small sea-fish, which, like our herring, was salted, Anth.

div1.head: μαινίς
div1.sense: a sprat, Ar., etc.

div1.head: μαινόλης
div1.sense: raving, frenzied, Sapph..

div1.head: μαίνομαι
div1.sense: to rage, be furious, Hom.; ὁ μανείς the madman, Soph.: to be mad with wine, Od.:—of Bacchic frenzy, Il., Soph.; ὑπὸ τοῦ θεοῦ μ. to be driven mad by the god, Hdt.; τὸ μαίνεσθαι madness, Soph.; πλεῖν ἢ μαίνομαι more than madness, Ar.:—c. acc. cogn., μεμηνὼς οὐ σμικρὰν νόσον mad with no slight disease, Aesch.
of fire, to rage, riot, Il.; so, μαινομένη ἐλπίς Orac. ap. Hdt.; ἔρις Aesch., etc.
the aor1 act. ἔμηνα, in Causal sense, to madden, enrage, Eur., Xen.

div1.head: μαίομαι
div1.sense: to seek:
absol. to endeavour, strive, Od., Pind., Aesch.
c. acc. to search, examine, Od.
to seek after, seek for, τι Pind.: c. inf. to seek to do, Pind., Soph.

div1.head: μαιόομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to deliver a woman, Luc., Anth.

div1.head: Μάϊος
div1.sense: (with or without μήν), the Lat. Maius, May, Plut., etc.:—as adj., Μάϊαι Καλάνδαι the Calends of May, Plut.

div1.head: Μαῖρα
div1.sense: the sparkler, i. e. the dog-star, Anth.

div1.head: Μαιώτης
div1.sense: the Maeotians, a Scythian tribe to the North of the Black Sea, Hdt., Xen.
as adj.
div1.head: Μαιώτης
div1.sense: Maeotian, ποταμὸς M. the Tanais, Hdt.:— Μαιῶτις, λίμνη the Palus Maeotis, Sea of Azof, Aesch., etc.; ἡ λίμνη ἡ Μαιῆτις (Ionic) Hdt.
Μαιωτικός, ή, όν, αὐλὼν M., i. e. the Cimmerian Bosporus, Aesch.

div1.head: Μαιωτιστί
div1.sense: in Scythian fashion, Theocr.

div1.head: μαίωτρα
div1.sense: a midwifeʼs wages, Luc.

div1.head: μακαρία
div1.sense: happiness, bliss, κενὴ μ. Luc.:—euphem. for ἐς κόρακας, ἄπαγʼ ἐς μακαρίαν Ar.

div1.head: μακαρίζω
div1.sense: to bless, to deem or pronounce happy, Lat. gratulari, Od., Hdt., Attic; ironically, μακαρίσαντες ὑμῶν τὸ ἀπειρόκακον while we bless your simplicity, Thuc.

div1.head: μακάριος
div1.sense: of men, blessed, happy, Pind., Eur., etc.:—in addresses, ὦ μακάριε, like ὦ θαυμάσιε, my good sir, my dear sir, Plat.:—c. gen., ὦ μ. τῆς τύχης happy you for your good fortune! Ar.
οἱ μακάριοι, like οἱ ὄλβιοι, the rich and better educated, Plat., Arist.
adv. -ίως, Eur., Ar.

div1.head: μακαριότης
div1.sense: happiness, bliss, Plat., Arist.;

div1.head: μακαρισμός
div1.sense: a pronouncing happy, blessing, Plat., Arist.

div1.head: μακαριστός
div1.sense: deemed or to be deemed happy, enviable, Hdt., Attic

div1.head: μακαρίτης
div1.sense: like μάκαρ III, one blessed, i. e. dead, Aesch., etc.
as adj., μ. βίος, with a double meaning, Ar.

div1.head: μάκαρ
div1.sense: blessed, happy, of the gods, as opp. to mortal men, Il.; absol., μάκαρες the blessed ones, Od., Hes., Pind., Trag.
of men, blest, fortunate, ὦ μάκαρ Ἀτρείδη Il.; so, μάκαιρα ἑστία, etc., Pind.:— esp. wealthy, ἀνδρὸς μάκαρος κατʼ ἄρουραν Il.

μάκαρες also meant the dead, as secure from the ills of life, Hes.:— μακάρων νῆσοι the Islands of the Blest (in the ocean at the extreme West) where heroes and demi-gods enjoyed rest for ever, Hes., Pind.
comp. μακάρτερος, Sup. μακάρτατος Od.

div1.head: μακεδνός
div1.sense: tall, taper, Od.

div1.head: Μακεδονίζω
div1.sense: to be on the Macedonian side, Plut.
to speak Macedonian, Plut.

div1.head: Μακεδονιστί
div1.sense: in Macedonian, Plut.

div1.head: Μακεδών
div1.sense: a Macedonian, οἱ Μακεδόνες, the Macedonians, Hdt.:—adj. Μακεδόνιος, η, ον, and -ονικός, ή, όν, Hdt., etc.; ἡ Μακεδονία Macedon, Hdt.; so, ἡ Μακεδονὶς, γῆ Hdt.; γῆ Μακεδών Anth.

div1.head: μάκελλα
div1.etym: μία, κέλλω, as δίκελλα from δίς, κέλλω.
div1.sense: a pick-axe with one point, Il., Aesch.

div1.head: μάκελλον
div1.sense: the meat-market, shambles, NTest.

div1.head: μακιστήρ
div1.sense: long and tedious, Aesch.

div1.head: μακκοάω
div1.sense: to be stupid, Ar.; part. perf. μεμακκοηκώς sitting mooning, Ar.

div1.head: μακραίων
div1.sense: lasting long, Soph.
of persons, long-lived, aged, Soph.; οἱ μακραίωνες the immortals, Soph.

div1.head: μακράν
div1.etym: acc. fem. of μακρός used as adv.
div1.sense: a long way, far, far away, Aesch., Soph., etc.; τοὖργον οὐ μ. λέγεις the business you speak of is not far to seek, Soph.:—c. gen. far from, Eur.:—comp., μακροτέραν to a greater distance, Thuc., Xen.; Sup., ὅτι μακροτάτην as far as possible, c. gen. loci, Xen.
μακρὰν λέγειν to speak at length, Aesch., Soph.
of Time, long, μ. ζῆν, ἀναμένειν Soph.; οὐ μ. Lat. brevi, Eur.; so, οὐκ ἐς μακρήν Hdt., etc.

div1.head: μακραύχην
div1.sense: long-necked, long, Eur.

div1.head: μακρηγορέω
div1.sense: to speak at great length, Aesch., Eur., etc.

div1.head: μακρηγορία
div1.sense: tediousness, Pind.

div1.head: μακρημερία
div1.sense: the season of long days, Hdt.

div1.head: μακρόβιος
div1.sense: long-lived, Arist.; μακροβιώτατος Hdt.: — οἱ M., an Ethiopian people, Hdt.

div1.head: μακροβιότης
div1.sense: longevity, Arist.

div1.head: μακροβίοτος
div1.sense: long, Aesch.

div1.head: μακρόγηρως
div1.sense: very old, Anth.

div1.head: μακροδρόμος
div1.sense: running long or far, Xen.

div1.head: μακρόθεν
div1.sense: from afar, Strab.; of Time, from long since, Polyb.

div1.head: μακροθυμέω
div1.sense: to be long-suffering, NTest.; and μακροθῡμία, long-suffering, forbearance, NTest.

div1.head: μακρόθυμος
div1.sense: longsuffering, patient, Anth.: adv. -μως, NTest.

div1.head: μακροκέφαλος
div1.sense: long-headed, of the Scythians, Strab.

div1.head: μακροκομέω
div1.sense: to have long hair, Strab.

div1.head: μακρόκωλος
div1.sense: long-limbed: ἡ μ. a kind of sling, Strab.
of sentences, with long clauses, Arist.

div1.head: μακρολογέω
div1.sense: to speak at length, use many words, Plat.; c. acc. rei, to speak long on a subject, Xen.

div1.head: μακρολογία
div1.sense: length of speech, Plat.

div1.head: μακρολόγος
div1.sense: speaking at length, Plat.

div1.head: μακρόμαλλος
div1.sense: with long wool, Strab.

div1.head: μακρόπνοος
div1.sense: long-breathed, long-protracted, wearisome, Eur.

div1.head: μακροπορέω
div1.sense: to go or travel far, Strab.

div1.head: μακροπορία
div1.sense: a long way or journey, Strab.

div1.head: μακροπώγων
div1.sense: long-bearded, Strab.

div1.head: μακρός
div1.sense: of Space,
in point of length, long, Hom., etc.; ἐπὶ τὰ μακρότερα towards the longer sides, i. e. lengthwise, Hdt.
in point of height, tall, Hom., e. g. μακρὸς Ὄλυμπος, μ. δένδρεα, τείχεα, etc.:—also reversely, like Lat. altus, deep, Il.

in point of distance, long, far, far distant, Il., Hdt.; τὰ μακρότατα the remotest parts, Hdt.:—often in neut. pl. as adv., μακρὰ βιβάς far-striding, Il.; also, μακρὸν ἀϋτεῖν, βοᾶν to shout so as to be heard afar, Hom.; so, μακρότερον σφενδονᾶν to sling to a greater distance, Xen.
generally, large in size or in degree, large, great, Aesch., Soph.
dat. μακρῷ is used to strengthen the comp. and Sup. by far, Lat. longe, μακρῷ πρῶτος, μ. μάλιστα Hdt.; ἀσθενεστέρα μ. Aesch., etc.
of Time, long, long-lasting, long, Od., Hdt., etc.; οὐ μακροῦ χρόνου for no long time, Soph.; τὸν μ. βίον Aesch.; μακρότερος μηνί by a month, Hdt.:—so, μακρὸν ἐέλδωρ a long-cherished wish, Od.
long, tedious, Pind., Soph.

neut. with Preps. in adverb. sense, διὰ μακροῦ (sc. χρόνου) after a long time, long delayed, Eur.; οὐ διὰ μακροῦ not long after, Thuc.:—but, διὰ μακρῶν at great length, Plat.: —οὐκ ἐς μακρόν for no long time, Pind.: —ἐπὶ μακρόν far, a long way, Xen.; ὅσον ἐπὶ μακρότατον or ὅσον μ. as far as possible, Hdt.; ἐπὶ μακρότερον yet more, Thuc.
regul. comp. μακρότερος Od., Hdt., etc.; Sup. μακρότατος Il., etc.:—irreg. comp. μάσσων, Sup. μήκιστος, v. sub vocc.
adv. μακρῶς, at great length, slowly, Polyb.

div1.head: μάκρος
div1.sense: length, Ar.

div1.head: μακροτένων
div1.sense: far-stretching, Anth.

div1.head: μακροτέρως
div1.sense: beyond, further, Plat., etc.

div1.head: μακρότονος
div1.sense: far-stretching, long drawn out, σχοῖνοι Anth.

div1.head: μακροτράχηλος
div1.sense: long-necked, Anth.

div1.head: μακροφάρυγξ
div1.sense: long-necked, of a bottle, Anth.

div1.head: μακροφλυαρήτης
div1.sense: a tedious prater, Anth.

div1.head: μακρόχειρ
div1.sense: long-armed, Lat. longimanus, name of Artaxerxes I. Strab., Plut.

div1.head: μακρόχηλος
div1.sense: with long hoofs, Strab.

div1.head: μάκρων
div1.sense: a longhead; Μάκρωνες, οἱ, a people of Pontus, Hdt.

div1.head: μάκτρα
div1.sense: a kneading-trough, Ar., Xen.

div1.head: μαλακαίπους
div1.sense: soft-footed, treading softly, Theocr.

div1.head: μαλακία
div1.sense: softness, delicacy, effeminacy, Hdt., Thuc.
want of patience, weakness, Arist.
calmness of the sea, Caesar.

div1.head: μαλακίζομαι
div1.sense: to be softened or made effeminate, shew weakness or cowardice, Thuc., Xen.
to be softened or appeased, Thuc.

div1.head: μαλακόγειος
div1.sense: with or of soft soil, Strab.

div1.head: μαλακογνώμων
div1.sense: mild of mood, Aesch.

div1.head: μαλακός
div1.sense: Lat. mollis, soft, Hom., etc.; μ. νειός a fresh-ploughed fallow, Il.; μ. λειμών a soft grassy meadow, Od.; μ. παρειαί Soph.; σώματα Xen.: —adv., καθίζου μαλακῶς sit softly, i. e. on a cushion, Ar.

of things not subject to touch, soft, gentle, θάνατος, ὕπνος Hom.; μαλακῶς εὕδειν to sleep softly, Od.; μαλακὰ ἔπεα, μ. λόγοι soft, fair words, Hom.; μ. βλέμμα tender, youthful looks, Ar.; light, mild, ζημία Thuc.

in bad sense, of persons, soft, yielding, remiss, Thuc., Xen.:—adv., μαλακωτέρως ἀνθήπτετο attacked him somewhat feebly, Thuc.: —also faint-hearted, effeminate, cowardly, Thuc., Xen.; μαλακὸν οὐδὲν ἐνδιδόναι not to give in from want of spirit, not to flag a whit, Hdt., Ar.

div1.head: μαλακότης
div1.sense: softness, Plat., etc.
weakness, effeminacy, Plut.

div1.head: μαλακόχειρ
div1.sense: soft-handed, Pind.

div1.head: μαλακτήρ
div1.sense: one that melts and moulds, Plut.

div1.head: μαλακύνω
div1.sense: Mid., like μαλακίζομαι, to flag, Xen.

div1.head: μάλα
div1.sense: very, very much, exceedingly, Hom., etc.

strengthening the word with which it stands, μάλα πολλά very many, Hom.; μάλα πάντες, μ. πᾶσαι, μ. πάντα, all together, every one, Hom.; μάλʼ ἀσκηθής all unhurt, Od.; ἀβληχρὸς μάλα τοῖος so very weak, Od.:—so in Attic, μάλα δὴ πρεσβύτης very old, Xen.; μ. γέ τινες ὀλίγοι Plat.:—so with Advs., πάγχυ μάλα and μάλα πάγχυ quite utterly, Il.; εὖ μάλα right well, Od.; μάλʼ αἰεί for ever and aye, Il.; ἄχρι μάλα κνέφαος until quite dark, Od.; μάλα διαμπερές right through, Il.:—so in Attic, to express repeated action, μάλʼ αὖθις, μάλʼ αὖ Aesch., etc.:— with Verbs, μή με μάλʼ αἴνεε praise me not greatly, Il.; ἡ δὲ μάλʼ ἡνιόχευεν she drove carefully, Od., etc.
strengthening an assertion, εἰ μάλα μιν χόλος ἵκοι if wrath come on him ever so much, Hom.; so μάλα περ with a partic., μάλα περ μεμαώς though desiring never so much, Il.
in Attic in answers, yes, certainly, exactly so, μάλα γε Plat., etc.; μ. τοι Xen., etc.; καὶ μ. δή Xen.
comp. μᾶλλον, more, Hom.; μᾶλλον τοῦ δέοντος more than is right, Plat., Xen., etc.; παντὸς μᾶλλον more than anything, i. e. most certainly, Plat.
denoting increase, more and more, still more, Od.; μᾶλλον μᾶλλον, Lat. magis magisque, Eur., Ar.
sometimes joined to a second comp., ῥηίτεροι μᾶλλον Il.; μᾶλλον ἆσσον Soph., etc.
μᾶλλον δέ, much more, but rather, πολλοί, μᾶλλον δὲ πάντες Dem.

in μᾶλλον ἢ οὐ, οὐ seems redundant, ἥκει ὁ Πέρσης οὐδὲν μᾶλλον ἐπʼ ἡμέας ἢ οὐ ἐπʼ ὑμέας the Persians have come not more against us, than against you, Hdt.; in this case μᾶλλον ἢ οὐ is preceded by another negat.
τὸ μ. καὶ ἧττον, a form of argument, which we call a fortiori, Arist.

Sup. μάλιστα, most, most of all, Hom., etc.; μάλιστα μέν . . , ἔπειτα δέ . . , first and above all . . , next . . , Soph.:— τί μάλιστα; what is the precise thing that you want? Plat.; ὡς or ὅτι μ., Lat. quam maxime, Plat.; ὅσον μ. Aesch.; ὡς μ. certainly, in answers, Plat.; ὡς δύναμαι μ. Plat.; μακρῷ μ. Hdt.
ἐς τὰ μάλιστα for the most part, mostly, Hdt.; so, τὰ μάλιστα Thuc., etc.; also, ἀνὴρ δόκιμος ὁμοῖα τῷ μ. as famous as he that is most [famous], Hdt.
ἐν τοῖς μ. especially, as much as any, Thuc., Plat.
μάλιστα may be added to a Sup., ἔχθιστος μάλιστα, μάλιστα φίλτατος Il.; μ. φίλτατος Eur.
with numbers, μάλιστα means about, Thuc., Xen., etc.; so, ἐς μέσον μάλιστα about the middle, Hdt.; ἥμισυ μ. Thuc., etc.
καὶ μάλιστα is used in answers, most certainly, Lat. vel maxime, Ar.; so, μ γε Soph.; μ. πάντων Ar.

div1.head: μαλάσσω
div1.sense: to make soft, of dressing leather, to make it soft and supple;— hence, with reference to Cleonʼs trade of tanner, μαλ. τινά to give one a dressing, hide him, Ar.: Pass., ἐν παγκρατίῳ μαλαχθείς worsted in it, Pind.
to soften metal or other material for working, Plat.
metaph. to soften, appease, make to relent, Eur.:—Pass. to be softened, to relent, Soph., Ar.; μ. νόσου to be relieved from disease, Soph.

div1.head: μαλάχη
div1.sense: mallow, Lat. malva, Hes., Ar., etc.

div1.head: μαλερός
div1.sense: mighty, fierce, devouring, ravening, of fire, Il., etc.
metaph. fiery, glowing, vehement, furious, Pind., Trag.

div1.head: μάλη
div1.sense: the arm-pit, Lat. ala, only in phrase ὑπὸ μάλης, under the arm, as the place for carrying concealed weapons, Xen., Plat.:—hence ὑπὸ μάλης underhand, secretly, Lat. furtim, Dem.

div1.head: μαλθακίζομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be softened, of persons, Aesch., Eur.:— to relax, give in, Plat.

div1.head: μαλθακιστέος
div1.sense: one must be remiss, Plat.:—so μαλθακιστέα, Ar.

div1.head: μαλθακός
div1.sense: soft, Pind., Attic:—adv., μαλθακῶς κατακεῖσθαι to recline on soft cushions, Ar.
metaph. faint-hearted, remiss, cowardly, Il., Attic:—also weak, feeble, Ar.
in good sense, soft, gentle, mild, Theogn., Attic:—adv. gently, Aesch., Soph.; neut. as adv., Aesch.

div1.head: μαλθακόφωνος
div1.sense: soft-voiced, Pind.

div1.head: μάλθα
div1.sense: a mixture of wax and pitch for laying over writing-tablets, Dem.

div1.head: μαλθάσσω
div1.sense: to soften, soothe, Trag.:—Pass., μαλθαχθεῖσʼ ὕπνῳ unnerved by sleep, Aesch.

div1.head: μάλιον
div1.sense: a lock of hair, Anth.

div1.head: μάλιστα
div1.etym: Sup. of μάλα, v. μάλα III.

div1.head: μαλκίω
div1.sense: to become numb with cold, to be torpid, Hes., Xen., Dem.

div1.head: μᾶλλον
div1.etym: comp. of μάλα; v. μάλα II.

div1.head: μαλλός
div1.sense: a lock of wool, wool, Hes., Aesch., etc.: — a lock of hair, Eur.

div1.head: μαλός
div1.sense: white, Theocr.

div1.head: Μαμμάκυθος
div1.sense: Comic word for a blockhead, simpleton, Ar.

div1.head: μαμμᾶν
div1.sense: μαμμᾶν αἰτεῖν, to cry for the breast, to suck the breast, of babies, Ar.

div1.head: μάμμη
div1.sense: mamma, mammy, a childʼs attempt to articulate mother, Anth.:—so ἄττα, πάππας, τάτα, τέττα, papa, for father.
a grandmother, Plut.

div1.head: Μαμμωνᾶ
div1.sense: a Syrian deity, god of riches; Hence riches, wealth, NTest.

div1.head: μανδραγόρας
div1.sense: mandrake, a narcotic plant, Xen., Dem.

div1.head: μάνδρα
div1.sense: an inclosed space:
for cattle, a fold, byre, stable, Theocr., etc.
the setting of a ring, Anth.

div1.head: Μανέρως
div1.sense: Maneros, only son of the first king of Egypt: a national dirge named after him, Hdt.

div1.head: μανθάνω
div1.sense: to learn, esp. by inquiry; and in aor. to have learnt, i. e. to understand, know, Od., Attic; ἀεὶ γὰρ ἡβᾶι τοῖς γέρουσιν εὖ μαθεῖν Aesch.; οἱ μανθάνοντες, learners, pupils, Xen.: —c. inf. to learn to do, learn how to do, Il., Aesch., etc.
to perceive by the senses, remark, notice, Hdt., Xen.:—with a part., μάνθανε ὤν, like ἴσθι ὤν, know that you are, Soph., etc.
to understand, comprehend, Aesch., etc.:—often in Dialogue, μανθάνεις; Lat. tenes? dʼye see?— Answ., πάνυ μανθάνω, perfectly! Ar.
in Attic, τί μαθών; often begins a question, having learnt what? for what new reason? wherefore? Ar., etc.

div1.head: μανιάκης
div1.sense: an armlet, worn of gold used by Persians and Gauls, Polyb.

div1.head: μανία
div1.sense: madness, frenzy, Hdt., Trag., etc.
enthusiasm, inspired frenzy, Eur., Plat.
mad passion, fury, Trag.

div1.head: μανιάς
div1.sense: raging, frantic, mad, Soph.; with a neut. Subst., μανιάσιν λυσσήμασι with mad ravings, Eur.

div1.head: μανικός
div1.sense: of or for madness, mad, Ar.; μανικόν τι βλέπειν to look mad, Ar.
of persons, frenzied, frantic, Plat.:— mad, extravagant, Xen.: —adv., μανικῶς διακεῖσθαι Plat.

div1.head: μανιώδης
div1.sense: like madness, mad, Xen.
like a madman, crazy, Thuc.; τὸ μ. madness, Eur.

div1.head: μάννα
div1.sense: a Hebr. word, manna, a morsel, grain, the gum of the tamarisk; generally, food, NTest.

div1.head: μάννος
div1.sense: Lat. monile, a collar,

div1.head: μαννοφόρος
div1.sense: wearing a collar, Theocr.

div1.head: μανός
div1.sense: Lat. rarus, loose in texture, porous, Plat., etc.
few, scanty, Xen., etc.:—adv. -νῶς, τοσούτῳ μανότερον so much the less often, Xen.

div1.head: μανότης
div1.sense: looseness of texture, porousness, Arist.
fewness, scantiness, Plat.

div1.head: μαντεία
div1.sense: prophesying, prophetic power, Hhymn.: mode of divination, Hdt.; αἴνιγμα μαντείας ἔδει the riddle stood in need of divination, Soph.
= μαντεῖον II, Tyrtae., Soph.

div1.head: μαντεῖον
div1.note: μαντεῖον, Ionic and Epic -ήιον, ου, τό,
div1.sense: an oracle, i. e.,
an oracular response, Od., Hdt., Attic
the seat of an oracle, Hdt., Aesch., etc.

div1.head: μαντεῖος
div1.sense: oracular, prophetic, Pind., Aesch., etc.; μ. ἄναξ, i. e. Apollo, Eur.

div1.head: μάντευμα
div1.sense: an oracle, Pind., Trag.

div1.head: μαντεύομαι
div1.sense: to divine, prophesy, presage, Hom., etc.; c. acc. cogn., μαντεῖα μ. Aesch.
generally, to divine, presage, augur, forbode, surmise, of any presentiment, Plat., etc.; c. gen., μαντευσόμεσθα τἀνδρὸς ὡς ὀλωλότος Aesch.
of animals, to get scent of a thing, Theocr.
to consult an oracle, seek divinations, Hdt., Attic; ταῦτα καὶ μ. this is the question I ask the oracle, Eur.
aor1 and perf. pass. in pass. sense, ἐμαντεύθη an oracle was given, Hdt.; τὰ μεμαντευμένα the words of the oracles, Hdt.

div1.head: μαντευτέος
div1.sense: one must divine, Eur.

div1.head: μαντευτός
div1.sense: foretold by an oracle, Eur.: prescribed by an oracle, Xen.

div1.head: μαντικός
div1.sense: of or for a soothsayer or his art, prophetic, oracular, Trag.
ἡ μαντικὴ τέχνη, μαντεία, the faculty of divination, prophecy, Soph.; so, ἡ μαντική alone, Hdt., Plat.
of persons, like a prophet, oracular, Plat.:—adv. -κῶς, Ar.

div1.head: μαντιπολέω
div1.sense: to prophesy, Aesch.

div1.head: μαντιπόλος
div1.sense: frenzied, inspired, Eur.

div1.head: μάντις
div1.sense: one who divines, a seer, prophet, Hom., etc.:—as fem. a prophetess, Trag., Thuc.
metaph. a diviner, foreboder, Soph.
a kind of grasshopper, Theocr.

div1.head: μαντοσύνη
div1.sense: the art of divination, Il., Pind.

div1.head: μαντόσυνος
div1.sense: oracular, Eur.

div1.head: μά
div1.sense: a Particle used in strong protestations and oaths, followed by acc. of the deity or thing appealed to; in itself neither affirmative nor negative, but made so by prefixing ναί or οὐ, or by the context:—thus,
ναὶ μὰ . . , in affirmation, ναὶ μὰ τόδε σκῆπτρον yea by this sceptre, Il.; ναὶ μὰ Δία, ναὶ μὰ τὸν Δία Ar., Plat.
οὐ μὰ . . , in negation, οὐ μὰ Ζῆνα, nay, by . . , Il.; οὔ τοι μὰ τοὺς δώδεκα θεούς Ar.
in Attic μά is often used alone, mostly in negat. sense μὰ τὸν Ποσειδῶ Eur.:— in answers, when the negation is expressed in the question, οὐκ αὖ μʼ ἐάσεις; Answ. μὰ Δί’ (sc. οὐκ ἐάσω) Ar.
the name of the deity was often suppressed, ναὶ μὰ τόν, οὐ μὰ τόν Plat.

div1.head: μᾶ
div1.sense: shortd. Doric form for μάτηρ, μᾶ γᾶ for μῆτερ γῆ, Aesch.; μᾶ, πόθεν ἅνθρωπος; Theocr.

div1.head: μάραγνα
div1.sense: a whip, scourge, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: μάραθον
div1.sense: fennel, Lat. marathrum, Dem.

div1.head: Μαραθωνομάχης
div1.sense: a Marathon fighter, a Marathon-man, proverb. of a brave veteran, Ar.

div1.head: Μαραθών
div1.sense: Marathon, a deme on the East of Attica, prob. so called from its being overgrown with fennel, Od., Hdt., etc.

div1.head: μαραίνω
div1.sense: to put out or quench fire, Hhymn.:—Pass. to die away, go slowly out, of fire, Il.

metaph., ὄψεις μ. to quench the orbs of sight, Soph.; νόσος μαραίνει με makes me waste away, wears me out, Aesch.; of time, πάντα χρόνος μαραίνει Soph.: —Pass. to die away, waste away, decay, wither, Eur., Thuc.; αἷμα μαραίνεται χερός blood dies away from my hand, Aesch.; of a river, to dry up, Hdt.

div1.head: μαράν
div1.sense: μαρὰν ἀθά, Syriac phrase, = ὁ Κύριος ἥκει, NTest.

div1.head: μαργαίνω
div1.sense: to rage furiously, Il.

div1.head: μαργαρίτης
div1.sense: a pearl, Theophr., etc.

div1.head: μαργάω
div1.sense: raging, Aesch.; c. inf., μαργῶν ἱέναι madly eager to go, Eur.

div1.head: Μαργίτης
div1.sense: Margites, i. e. a mad fellow, hero of a mock-heroic poem ascribed to Homer.

div1.head: μάργος
div1.sense: raging mad, Lat. furiosus, μάργε, madman! Od.; then in Pind., Aesch., etc.
of appetite, greedy, gluttonous, Od., Eur.
lewd, lustful, Theogn., Eur.

div1.head: μαργότης
div1.sense: raging passion, Soph.
gluttony, Plat.
lust, Eur.

div1.head: Μαρέη
div1.sense: Marea, a town in Lower Egypt, Hdt., Thuc.
a lake near it, Strab.; more commonly called ἡ Μαρεῶτις, ( sc. λίμνη ) Strab.:—also ὁ Μαρεώτης, ( sc. οἶνος) Strab.

div1.head: μάρη
div1.sense: a hand, Pind.

div1.head: Μαριανδυνός
div1.sense: Μαριανδῡνοί, οἱ, a people of Bithynia, Hdt., etc.:— Μαριανδυνὸς θρηνητήρ one who utters a wild, barbaric lament, Aesch.; cf. Κίσσιος.

div1.head: Μαριλάδης
div1.sense: ὦ Μαρῑλάδη O son of coal-dust! comic name of an Acharnian collier, Ar.

div1.head: μαρίλη
div1.sense: the embers of charcoal, Ar.

div1.head: μαριλοπότης
div1.etym: !πο, Root of some tenses of πίνω
div1.sense: coal-dust-gulper, of a blacksmith, Anth.

div1.head: μαρμαίρω
div1.sense: to flash, sparkle, of arms, Il.; ὄμματα μαρμαίροντα the sparkling eyes of Aphrodite, Il.; νύκτα ἄστροισι μαρμαίρουσαν Aesch.

div1.head: μαρμάρεος
div1.sense: flashing, sparkling, glistening, gleaming, of metals, Il., Hes.; also, ἃλς μαρμαρέη the many-twinkling sea, Il.
of marble, Anth.

div1.head: μαρμάρινος
div1.sense: of marble, Theocr.

div1.head: μαρμαρογλυφία
div1.sense: sculpture in marble, Strab.

div1.head: μάρμαρος
div1.sense: any stone or rock of crystalline structure, which sparkles (μαρμαίρει) in the light, Hom., etc.; also, πέτρος μάρμαρος Il.
marble, Strab.: — a marble tombstone, Theocr.

div1.head: μαρμαρυγή
div1.sense: a flashing, sparkling, of light, Plat.: of any quick motion, μαρμαρυγαὶ ποδῶν the quick twinkling of dancersʼ feet, Od.

div1.head: μαρμαρωπός
div1.sense: with sparkling eyes, Eur.

div1.head: μάρναμαι
div1.etym: Dep., only in pres. and imperf.
div1.sense: to fight, do battle, τινί with or against another, Il.; ἐπί τινι Il.; πρός τινα Eur.
to quarrel, wrangle with words, Il.
in Pind. to contend, struggle, strive to oneʼs uttermost, Pind.

div1.head: μάρπτω
div1.sense: to catch, lay hold of, seize, τινά Hom., etc.: c. gen. partis, μ. τινὰ ποδός to catch one by the foot, Soph., Il.; ποσὶ μ. τινά to overtake, catch a fugitive, Il.: but, χθόνα μάρπτε ποδοῖιν reached ground with his feet, Il.: metaph., τὸν ὕπνος ἔμαρψε him sleep overtook, Il.; γῆρας ἔμαρψε old age got hold of him, Od.; εἴ σε μάρψει ψῆφος if the votes shall convict thee, Aesch.; ἄσκοποι πλάκες ἔμαρψαν the unseen land engulphed him, Soph.

div1.head: μάρσιππος
div1.sense: a bag, pouch, Lat. marsupium, Xen.

div1.head: Μάρτιος
div1.sense: sc. μήν, Lat. Martius, the month of March, Plut.

div1.head: μαρτυρέω
div1.sense: to be a witness, to bear witness, give evidence, bear testimony, Simon., etc.: c. dat. pers. to bear witness to or in favour of another, Hdt., Attic; μαρτυρέει μοι τῆι γνώμηι bears witness to my opinion, Hdt.
c. acc. rei, to bear witness to a thing, testify it, Soph., etc.
c. inf. to testify that a thing is, Soph.; τίς σοι μαρτυρήσει κλύειν; who will bear thee witness that he heard..? Soph.
c. acc. cogn., μ. ἀκοήν to give hearsay evidence, Dem.:—so in Pass., μαρτυρίαι μαρτυρηθεῖσαι Soph.
Pass. also impers., μαρτυρεῖται testimony is borne, Plat.; οἶδα μαρτυρήσεσθαι I know that testimony will be given, Xen.

div1.head: μαρτύρημα
div1.sense: testimony, Eur.

div1.head: μαρτυρία
div1.sense: witness, testimony, evidence, often in pl., Od.; μαρτυριῶν ἀπέχεσθαι to refuse to give evidence, Ar.

div1.head: μαρτύριον
div1.sense: a testimony, proof, Hdt., etc.; μαρτύρια παρέχεσθαι to bring forward evidence, Hdt.: —μαρτύριον δέ . . , followed by γάρ, here is a proof, namely . . , Hdt., Thuc., etc.

div1.head: μαρτύρομαι
div1.sense: Mid to call to witness, attest, invoke, Soph., Eur., etc.; c. part., μαρτύρομαι τυπτόμενος I call you to witness that I am being beaten, Ar.
c. acc. rei, to call one to witness a thing, Hdt., Ar.
to protest, asseverate, μ. ὅτι . . Ar., etc.; absol., μαρτύρομαι I protest, Ar., Thuc.

div1.head: μάρτυρος
div1.etym: old Ep. form for μαρτυς, Hom.

div1.head: μάρτυς
div1.sense: a witness, Hes., Theogn.; μάρτυρα θέσθαι τινά Eur.; μ. θεοὺς ποιεῖσθαι Thuc.; μάρτυρι χρῆσθαί τινι Arist.; μάρτυρας παρέχεσθαι to produce witnesses, Plat., etc.; so, μ. παριστάναι Xen.

div1.head: μασάομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to chew, Ar.

div1.head: μάσθλης
div1.sense: a leather strap, thong, Soph.:—metaph. a supple knave, Ar.

div1.head: Μασσαλία
div1.sense: Lat. Massilia, Marseilles, Thuc., etc.: the Marseillais were Μασσαλιῶται, or -ῆται, ῶν, οἱ, Dem., etc.

div1.head: μάσσων
div1.etym: irreg. comp. of μακρός or μέγας
div1.sense: longer, greater, Od.; μάσσονʼ ἢ ὡς ἰδέμεν greater than one could see, Pind.; τὰ μάσσω anything more, Aesch.

div1.head: μάσσω
div1.sense: to handle, touch, in Mid., Anth.: cf. ἐπιμαίομαι.
to work with the hands, to knead dough, Lat. pinso, Ar.; also in Mid., Hdt., Ar.; metaph., μάττειν ἐπινοίας Ar.:—Pass., μᾶζα ὑπʼ ἐμοῦ μεμαγμένη Ar.; σῖτος μεμαγμένος dough ready kneaded, Thuc.

div1.head: μάσταξ
div1.sense: that with which one chews, the mouth, Od.
that which is chewed, a mouthful, morsel, Il., Theocr.

div1.head: μασταρύζω
div1.sense: only in pres., to mumble, of an old man, Ar.

div1.head: μαστεύω
div1.sense: to seek, search, Eur.
c. acc. to seek or search after:—to crave, need, Pind., Aesch., Xen.
c. inf. to seek or strive to do, Pind., Eur., Xen.

div1.head: μαστήρ
div1.sense: a seeker, searcher, one who looks for, τινος Soph., Eur.

div1.head: μαστιγίας
div1.sense: one that always wants whipping, a worthless slave, a sorry knave, Lat. verbero, Ar., Plat.

div1.head: μαστιγοφόρος
div1.sense: a scourge-bearer, a sort of policeman, Thuc.

div1.head: μαστιγόω
div1.etym: Mid. fut. μαστιγώσομαι in Pass. sense
div1.sense: to whip, flog, Hdt., Plat.

div1.head: μαστιγώσιμος
div1.sense: that deserves whipping, Luc.

div1.head: μαστιγωτέος
div1.sense: deserving a whipping, Ar.

div1.head: μαστίζω
div1.sense: to whip, flog, Il., Theocr.: c. inf., μάστιξεν δʼ ἐλάαν (v. ἐλαύνω I. 2), Hom.

div1.head: μαστίκτωρ
div1.sense: a scourger, Aesch.

div1.head: μάστιξ
div1.etym: from same Root as ἱμάς, μάσθλης
div1.sense: a whip, scourge, Hom., Hdt., etc.; ἵππου μ. a horsewhip, Hdt.; ὑπὸ μαστίγων βαίνειν to advance under the lash, of soldiers flogged on, Hdt.; so, τοξεύειν ὑπὸ μ. Xen.
metaph. a scourge, plague, Il., Aesch.; διπλῇ μ., τὴν Ἄρης φιλεῖ, i. e. fire and sword, Aesch.; μ. Θεοῦ of sickness, NTest.

div1.head: μαστιχάω
div1.sense: to gnash the teeth, Epic part. μαστιχόων, Hes.

div1.head: μαστίω
div1.sense: to whip, scourge, Il.:—Mid., οὐρῇ πλευρὰς μαστίεται [the lion] lashing his sides with his tail, Il.

div1.head: μαστόδετον
div1.sense: a breast-band, Anth.

div1.head: μαστός
div1.sense: one of the breasts, δεξιτερὸν παρὰ μαζόν Il.; βάλε στέρνον ὑπὲρ μαζοῖο struck his chest above the breast, Il.; βάλε στῆθος παρὰ μαζόν Il.
esp. a womanʼs breast, μαζὸν ἀνέσχε, of Hecuba mourning over Hector, Il.; παῒς δέ οἱ ἦν ἐπὶ μαζῷ Od.; προσέσχε μαστόν, of the mother, Aesch.; of animals, the udder, Eur.
metaph. a round hill, knoll (French mamelon), Pind., Xen.
a piece of wool fastened to the edge of nets, Xen.

div1.head: μαστροπεία
div1.sense: a pandaring, Xen.

div1.head: μαστροπεύω
div1.sense: to play the pandar, Xen.; μ. τινὰ πρὸς τὴν πόλιν to seduce one into public life, Xen.

div1.head: μαστροπός
div1.sense: a pandar, Lat. leno, lena, Ar.; metaph., Xen.

div1.head: μασχάλη
div1.sense: the armpit, Lat. ala, axilla, Ar., etc.
a bay, Strab.

div1.head: μασχαλίζω
div1.sense: to put under the arm-pits: hence, to mutilate a corpse, since murderers had a fancy, that by cutting off the extremities and placing them under the arm-pits, they would avert vengeance, Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: μασχαλιστήρ
div1.sense: a broad strap passing round the horse and fastened to the yoke by the λέπαδνον: generally, a girth, girdle, band, Hdt., Aesch.

div1.head: ματᾴζω
div1.sense: to speak or work folly, Soph.; σπλάγχνα δʼ οὐ ματᾴζει my heart is not deceived, Aesch.

div1.head: ματαιολογέω
div1.sense: to talk idly, at random, Strab.

div1.head: ματαιολόγος
div1.sense: talking idly, at random, NTest.

div1.head: ματαιοπονία
div1.sense: labour in vain, Strab., Luc.

div1.head: ματαιοπόνος
div1.sense: labouring in vain, Philo.

div1.head: μάταιος
div1.sense: vain, empty, idle, trifling, frivolous, Theogn., Hdt., Attic
thoughtless, rash, irreverent, profane, impious, Aesch.; τὸ μὴ μάταιον seriousness, gravity, Aesch.
adv. -ως, idly, without ground, Soph.

div1.head: ματάω
div1.sense: to be idle, to dally, loiter, linger, Il.; οὐ ματᾷ τοὖργον the work lags not, Aesch.; ματᾶν ὁδῷ to loiter by the way, Aesch.; φροίμιον ματᾷ is in vain, Aesch.

div1.head: ματεύω
div1.sense: to seek, search, Il., Soph.
c. acc. pers. to seek after, seek for, search after, properly of hounds casting for the scent, Aesch.; then generally, Aesch., Soph., etc.
c. inf. to seek or strive to do, Pind., Soph.
c. acc. loci, to search, explore, Theocr.

div1.head: μάτην
div1.sense: in vain, idly, fruitlessly, Lat. frustra, Hhymn., Pind., Attic; μ. ὁ μόχθος in vain the labour, Aesch.; with a Noun, τὸ μ. ἄχθος the fruitless burthen, Aesch.
at random, without reason, Lat. temere, Theogn., Hdt., Attic; ὁ νοσῶν μ., of a madman, Soph.
idly, falsely, Lat. falso, Soph.; μ. βέβακεν, of a dream, Aesch.

div1.head: μάτη
div1.sense: a folly, a fault, Aesch.

div1.head: ματία
div1.sense: a vain attempt, Od.

div1.head: ματιολοιχός
div1.sense: a devourer of meal, Ar. (A dubious word, said to be derived from μάτιον a measure of meal. Others read ματτυό-λοιχος, a licker up of dainties.)

div1.head: ματτύη
div1.sense: a dainty dish, Menand.: v. ματιολοιχός.

div1.head: μαυρόω
div1.sense: to darken, to blind, make powerless, Pind., Aesch.
metaph. to make dim or obscure, or forgotten, Hes.:—Pass. to become dim or obscure, Theogn., Aesch.

div1.head: Μαυσώλειον
div1.sense: tomb of Mausolus at Halicarnassus, and, as appellat. a mausoleum, Strab.

div1.head: Μαύσωλος
div1.sense: a king of Halicarnassus, husband of Artemisia, Hdt.

div1.head: μάχαιρα
div1.sense: a large knife or dirk, worn by the heroes of the Iliad next the sword-sheath, Il.: generally, a knife for cutting up meat, Hdt., Attic
as a weapon, a short sword or dagger, Hdt., etc.: a sabre or bent sword, opp. to the straight sword (ξίφος) , Xen.
a kind of rasor, μιᾷ μαχαίρᾳ with the rasorʼs single blade, opp. to διπλῆ μ. scissars, Ar.

div1.head: μαχαιρίς
div1.sense: a rasor, Ar., Luc.

div1.head: μαχαιροποιεῖον
div1.sense: a cutlerʼs factory, Dem.

div1.head: μαχαιροποιός
div1.sense: a cutler, Ar., Dem.

div1.head: μαχαιροπώλιον
div1.sense: a cutlerʼs shop, Plut.

div1.head: μαχαιροφόρος
div1.sense: wearing a sabre, Hdt., Aesch., etc.

div1.head: Μαχάων
div1.sense: Machaon, son of Aesculapius, the first surgeon that we hear of, Il.

div1.head: μαχετέος
div1.sense: one must fight, Arist.

div1.head: μαχήμων
div1.sense: warlike, Il., Anth.

div1.head: μάχη
div1.sense: battle, fight, combat, Hom., etc.; μάχαι ναῶν sea fights, Pind.:—with Verbs, μάχην μάχεσθαι to fight a battle, Il., Attic; μάχην ἀρτύνειν, ἐγείρειν, ὀρνύμεν, ὀτρύνειν Il.; μάχην συνάπτειν or συμβάλλειν τινί to engage battle with one, Aesch., Eur.; also, διὰ μάχης τινὶ ἀπικέσθαι, ἔρχεσθαι, ἥκειν, μολεῖν Hdt., Attic; μάχην νικᾶν to win a battle, Xen.:— μάχη τινός battle with an enemy, Il., etc.
in pl. quarrels, strifes, wranglings, Il., Plat.
= ἀγών, a contest for a prize in the games, Pind.: generally a struggle, Xen.
a mode of fighting, way of battle, Hdt., Xen.
a field of battle, Xen.

div1.head: μαχητής
div1.sense: a fighter, warrior, Hom.: Doric adj., μαχᾱτάς, warlike, Pind.

div1.head: μαχητικός
div1.sense: inclined to battle or war, quarrelsome, Arist.:— μ. ἵπποι restive horses, Plat.

div1.head: μαχητός
div1.sense: to be fought with, Od.

div1.head: μάχιμος
div1.sense: fit for battle, warlike, Hdt., Attic; οἱ μ. the fighting men, soldiery, and in Egypt the warrior-caste, Hdt.; τὸ μ. the effective force, Thuc.

div1.head: μαχιμώδης
div1.sense: warlike, quarrelsome, Anth.

div1.head: μάχλος
div1.sense: lewd, lustful, Hes., Luc.
metaph. wanton, luxuriant, insolent, Aesch.

div1.head: μαχλοσύνη
div1.sense: lewdness, lust, wantonness, Il., Hdt.

div1.head: μάχομαι
div1.sense: to fight, Hom., etc.; c. dat. pers. to fight with, i. e. against, one, Hom., etc.; μ. ἀντία and ἐναντίον τινός Il.; ἐπί τινι, πρός τινα Il.; but, μ. σύν τινι with the sanction, under the auspices of a deity, Od., Xen.; κατὰ σφέας μαχέονται will fight by themselves, Il.; καθʼ ἕνα μ. to fight one against one, in single combat, Hdt.:— τὸ μήπω μεμαχημένον the force that had not yet come into action, Thuc.
generally, to quarrel, wrangle, dispute with one, to oppose, gainsay, τινι Il., Plat.
to contend for the mastery in games, πὺξ μάχεσθαι Il.; παγκράτιον μ. Ar.

div1.head: μαχομένως
div1.sense: pugnaciously, Strab.

div1.head: μαψαῦραι
div1.sense: random breezes, squalls, gusts or flaws of wind, Hes.

div1.head: μαψίδιος
div1.sense: vain, false, Eur., Theocr.: useless, worthless, Anth.:—adv. μαψιδίως, μάψ, Hom.

div1.head: μαψιλόγος
div1.sense: idly talking, μ. οἰωνοί birds whose cries convey no sure omen, Hhymn.

div1.head: μαψιτόκος
div1.sense: bringing forth in vain, Anth.

div1.head: μάψ
div1.sense: in vain, idly, fruitlessly, Il.; μὰψ ὀμόσαι to swear lightly, i. e. without meaning to perform, Il.
vainly, idly, foolishly, thoughtlessly, μὰψ αὔτως Hom.; μάψ, ἀτὰρ οὐ κατὰ κόσμον Hom.

div1.head: μαψυλάκας
div1.sense: idly barking, i. e. repeating a thing again and again, Pind.

div1.head: μεγαθαρσής
div1.sense: very bold, Hes.

div1.head: μεγάθυμος
div1.sense: high-minded, Hom., Hes.

div1.head: μεγαίρω
div1.sense: to look on a thing as too great, to grudge one a thing as too great for him, Il.; so c. inf., μηδὲ μεγήρῃς ἡμῖν τελευτῆσαι τάδε ἔργα grudge us not the accomplishment of these works, Od.; c. acc. et inf., μνηστῆρας οὔτι μεγαίρω ἔρδειν I complain not that the suitors should do, Od.
c. dat. pers. to feel a grudge towards, Il.
absol., ἢ πύξ, ἠὲ πάλῃ, ἢ καὶ ποσίν, οὔτι μεγαίρω I care not (which), Od.
c. gen. rei, βιότοιο μεγήρας grudging him the life [of Antilochus], Il.; οὐ μ. τοῦδέ σοι δωρήματος Aesch.
Pass. to be envied, Anth.

div1.head: μεγακήτης
div1.sense: with great hollows, cavernous, of the sea, Od. (cf. βαθυκήτης) : of a ship, with large hull, Il.; of a dolphin, with huge maw, Il.

div1.head: μεγακλεής
div1.sense: very famous, declined (as if from μεγακλής) μεγακλέος, έϊ, έα, έες, έα, Anth.

div1.head: μεγαλάδικος
div1.sense: unjust in great matters, Arist.

div1.head: μεγαλαλκής
div1.sense: of great strength, ap. Plut.

div1.head: μεγαλαυχέω
div1.sense: to boast highly, talk big, Aesch.: —Mid. to boast oneself, Plat.

div1.head: μεγαλαυχία
div1.sense: great boasting, arrogance, Plat.

div1.head: μεγάλαυχος
div1.sense: greatly boasting, very glorious, Pind., Aesch., etc.

div1.head: μεγαλεῖος
div1.sense: magnificent, splendid, Xen.: τὰ μεγαλεῖα mighty works, NTest.:—adv. -ως, splendidly, Xen.
of persons, stately, haughty, Xen.

div1.head: μεγαλειότης
div1.sense: majesty, NTest.

div1.head: μεγαληγορέω
div1.sense: to talk big, boast, Xen.

div1.head: μεγαληγορία
div1.sense: big talking, Eur., Xen.

div1.head: μεγαλήγορος
div1.sense: talking big, vaunting, boastful, Aesch., Xen.

div1.head: μεγαληνορία
div1.sense: great manliness, proud self-confidence, haughtiness, Pind., Eur.

div1.head: μεγαλήνωρ
div1.sense: very manly, heroic: self-confident, haughty, Pind.

div1.head: μεγαλήτωρ
div1.sense: great-hearted, heroic, Hom.

div1.head: μεγαλίζομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be exalted, to bear oneself proudly, Hom.

div1.head: μεγαλογνωμοσύνη
div1.sense: high-mindedness, Xen.

div1.head: μεγαλογνώμων
div1.sense: high-minded, Xen.

div1.head: μεγαλόδενδρος
div1.sense: full of large trees, Strab.

div1.head: μεγαλόδοξος
div1.sense: very glorious, Pind., Plut.

div1.head: μεγαλοδωρία
div1.sense: munificence, Luc.

div1.head: μεγαλόδωρος
div1.sense: making great presents, munificent, Ar.

div1.head: μεγαλοεργής
div1.sense: performing great deeds, magnificent, Luc.

div1.head: μεγαλοεργία
div1.sense: magnificence, Luc.

div1.head: μεγάλοιτος
div1.sense: very wretched, Theocr.

div1.head: μεγαλοκευθής
div1.sense: concealing much: capacious, Pind.

div1.head: μεγαλοκίνδυνος
div1.sense: braving great dangers, Arist.

div1.head: μεγαλοκόρυφος
div1.sense: with lofty summits, ap. Arist.

div1.head: μεγαλοκρατής
div1.sense: far-ruling, Anth.

div1.head: μεγαλόμητις
div1.sense: of high design, ambitious, Aesch.

div1.head: μεγαλόμισθος
div1.sense: receiving high pay, Luc.

div1.head: μεγαλόνοια
div1.sense: greatness of intellect, Plat., Luc.

div1.head: μεγαλόνοος
div1.sense: great-minded, Luc.

div1.head: μεγαλόπολις
div1.sense: epith. of great cities, αἱ μεγαλοπτόλιες Ἀθᾶναι Athens that mighty city, Pind.; ἁ μ. Τροία Eur.

div1.head: μεγαλοπραγμοσύνη
div1.sense: the disposition to do great things, magnificence, Plut.

div1.head: μεγαλοπράγμων
div1.sense: disposed to do great deeds, forming great designs, Xen.

div1.head: μεγαλοπρέπεια
div1.sense: the character of a μεγαλοπρεπής, magnificence, Hdt., Plat.

div1.head: μεγαλοπρεπής
div1.sense: befitting a great man, magnificent, Hdt., Attic:— τὸ μεγαλοπρεπές, μεγαλοπρέπεια, Xen.
adv. -ῶς, Ionic -έως, Hdt., Xen.: comp. -έστερον Plat., Sup. -έστατα Hdt.

div1.head: μεγαλοσθενής
div1.sense: exceeding strong, Pind.

div1.head: μεγαλόσπλαγχνος
div1.sense: with large heart: high-spirited, Eur.

div1.head: μεγαλόστονος
div1.sense: very lamentable, most piteous, Aesch.

div1.head: μεγαλοσχήμων
div1.sense: magnificent, Aesch.

div1.head: μεγαλότολμος
div1.sense: greatly adventurous, Luc.

div1.head: μεγαλοφρονέω
div1.sense: to be high-minded, μ. ἐφʼ ἑαυτῷ to be confident in oneself, Xen.:—Mid., in bad sense, to be arrogant, Plat.

div1.head: μεγαλοφροσύνη
div1.sense: greatness of mind, Plat.; ὑπὸ μεγαλοφροσύνης magnanimously, Hdt.
in bad sense, pride, arrogance, Hdt.

div1.head: μεγαλόφρων
div1.sense: high-minded, noble, generous, Xen.
in bad sense, arrogant: adv. -όνως, Plat., Xen.

div1.head: μεγαλοφωνία
div1.sense: grandiloquence, Luc.

div1.head: μεγαλόφωνος
div1.sense: loud-voiced, Dem.

div1.head: μεγαλοψυχία
div1.sense: greatness of soul, magnanimity, Arist.:—in bad sense, arrogance, Dem.
of things, magnificence, Dem.

div1.head: μεγαλόψυχος
div1.sense: high-souled, magnanimous, Dem.:—adv. -χως, Dem.

div1.head: μεγαλύνω
div1.sense: to make great or powerful, to exalt, strengthen, Thuc.:— Pass., μεγαλύνεσθαι ἔκ τινος to gain great glory from . . , Xen.
to make great by word, to extol, magnify, Eur., Thuc., etc.:—Mid. to boast oneself, Aesch., Xen.
to aggravate a crime, Thuc.

div1.head: μεγαλώνυμος
div1.sense: with a great name, giving glory, Soph., Ar.

div1.head: μεγάλως
div1.etym: adverb of μέγας, v. μέγας B.

div1.head: μεγαλωστί
div1.etym: Epic and Ionic adv. of μέγας,
div1.sense: far and wide, over a vast space, Hom.
= μεγάλως, Hdt. 2. also = μεγαλοπρεπῶς, Hdt.

div1.head: μεγαλωσύνη
div1.sense: greatness, majesty, NTest.

div1.head: μεγάνωρ
div1.sense: man-exalting, Pind.

div1.head: Μέγαράδε
div1.sense: to Megara, Ar.

div1.head: Μέγαρα
div1.sense: Megara, Hdt., etc.

div1.head: Μεγαρεύς
div1.sense: a citizen of Megara, pl. Μεγαρεῖς or -ῆς, Hdt., etc.

div1.head: Μεγαρίζω
div1.sense: fut. ιῶ, to side with the Megarians or speak their dialect, Ar.

div1.head: Μεγαρικός
div1.sense: Megarian, Ar., etc.:—fem. Μεγαρίς (sc. γῆ) , the Megarian territory, Megarid, Thuc.

div1.head: Μεγαρόθεν
div1.sense: from Megara, Ar.

div1.head: Μεγαροῖ
div1.sense: at Megara, Ar.

div1.head: μέγαρόνδε
div1.sense: homewards, home, Od.

div1.head: μέγαρον
div1.sense: a large room or chamber, esp. the hall, Od.
the womenʼs apartment, Od.
in pl. a house, palace, like Lat. aedes, because the house consisted of many rooms, Hom.; ἐν μεγάροις at home, Hom.
the oracular chamber in the temple, the sanctuary, shrine, Hdt.; in this sense always, like Lat. aedes, in sg.

div1.head: μέγας
div1.sense: Radic. sense, opp. to μικρός, σμικρός, big, great, of menʼs stature, tall, Hom.; of women, καλή τε μεγάλη τε Od.:—also, great, full-grown, of age as shewn by stature, Od., Aesch.
vast, high, οὐρανός, ὄρος, πύργος Hom.
vast, spacious, wide, πέλαγός, αἰγιαλός, etc., Hom.

of Degree, great, strong, mighty, of gods, Hom., etc.; μεγάλα θεά, of Demeter and Proserpine, Soph.; μέγας ηὐξήθη rose to greatness, Dem.; βασιλεὺς ὁ μέγας, i. e. the King of Persia, le grand monarque, Hdt.; βασιλεὺς μέγας Aesch.; ὁ μ. ἐπικληθεὶς Ἀντίοχος the Great, Polyb.
great, strong, violent, etc., ἄνεμος, λαῖλαψ Hom.; of properties, passions, etc., Hom., etc.
of sounds, great, loud, Hom., etc.; μὴ φώνει μέγα Soph.;—but, μέγας λόγος a prevailing rumour, Aesch.
great, mighty, weighty, important, μέγα ἔργον Od.; μέγα ποιεῖσθαί τι to esteem of great importance, Hdt.; καὶ τὸ μέγιστον and what is most important, Thuc.
in bad sense, over-great, μέγα εἰπεῖν to speak big, λίην μέγα εἰπεῖν Od.; μέγα, μεγάλα φρονεῖν to have high thoughts, be presumptuous, Soph., Eur.; μεγάλα πνεῖν Eur.
adv. μεγάλως [ᾰ], greatly, mightily, exceedingly, Lat. magnopere, Hom., Aesch.
neut. sg. and pl. μέγα and μεγάλα as adv., very much, exceedingly, Hom.; with verbs of sound, aloud, loudly, Hom.; so in Attic
of Space, far, μέγα ἄνευθε far away, Il., etc.:—with comp. and Sup. by far, μέγʼ ἀμείνων, ἄριστος, φέρτατος Hom.
degrees of Comparison:

comp. μείζων (for μεγyων) , -on, gen. -ονος, Hom., Attic; Ionic μέζων, ον, Hdt.; later also μειζότερος, NTest.:— greater, Hom., etc.; also, too great, too much, more than enough, Plat.:—adv. μειζόνως Eur.; Ionic μεζόνως Hdt., etc.; also neut. as adv., μεῖζον σθένειν Soph., etc.
Sup. μέγιστος, η, ον, Hom.:—neut. as adv., μέγιστον ἰσχύειν Soph.; with another Sup. μέγιστον ἔχθιστος Eur.:—also in pl., χαῖρʼ ὡς μέγιστα Soph.

div1.head: μέγεθος
div1.sense: greatness, magnitude, size, height, stature, Hom., Hdt., etc.:—of sound, loudness, βοῆς μ. Thuc.:—dat. and acc. are used adverbially, μεγάθεϊ μέγας great in size, Hdt.; μεγάθεϊ μικρός Hdt.; so, ποταμοὶ οὐ κατὰ τὸν Νεῖλον ἐόντες μεγάθεα rivers not bearing any proportion to the Nile in size, Hdt.
of Degree, greatness, magnitude, Eur., Thuc., etc.
greatness, i. e. might, power, Eur., Xen.
greatness, magnanimity, Plut.

div1.head: μεγήρατος
div1.sense: passing lovely, Hes.

div1.head: μεγιστᾶνες
div1.sense: great men, grandees, NTest.

div1.head: μεγιστόπολις
div1.sense: making cities greatest, Pind.

div1.head: μεδέων
div1.sense: a guardian, Ζεὺς Ἴδηθεν μεδέων guardian of Ida, Il.; δελφίνων μ., of Poseidon, Ar.
fem. μεδέουσα, of Aphrodite, Hhymn.; of Mnemosyne, Hes., etc.

div1.head: μέδιμνος
div1.sense: the medimnus, an Attic corn-measure, containing 6 ἑκτεῖς, 48 χοίνικες, 192 κοτύλαι 6 Roman modii, i. e. very nearly 12 gallons, Hes., Attic

div1.head: μέδομαι
div1.sense: to provide for, think on, be mindful of, bethink one of, c. gen., πολέμοιο μεδέσθω Il.; ὡς δείπνοιο μέδηται Od., etc.
to plan, contrive, devise something for one, κακὰ Τρώεσσι μέδεσθαι Il.

div1.head: μέδω
div1.etym: only in pres., and mostly in participial Subst. μέδων, οντος, ὁ, like μεδέων, μεδέουσα
div1.sense: a guardian, lord, Ἀργείων ἡγήτορες ἠδὲ μέδοντες leaders and guardians of the Argives, Hom.; μέδων ἁλός lord of the sea, Od.; of Bacchus, ὃ μέδεις Δηοῦς ἐν κόλποις Soph.

div1.head: μεθαιρέω
div1.sense: to catch in turn, of a game at ball, Od.

div1.head: μεθάλλομαι
div1.sense: to leap or rush upon, c. dat., Il.
to rush after, in a race, Il.

div1.head: μεθαρμόζω
div1.sense: to dispose differently, to correct, Soph.:—Mid., aor1 μεθηρμοσάμην, with perf. pass. -ήρμοσμαι, to dispose for oneself, μεθάρμοσαι νέους τρόπους adopt new habits, Aesch.; μεθηρμόσμεσθα βελτίω βίον Eur.

div1.head: μεθεκτέος
div1.sense: one must have a share of, τινός Thuc.

div1.head: μεθέλκω
div1.sense: to draw to the other side, ἡνίας Anth.

div1.head: μέθεξις
div1.sense: participation, Plat.

div1.head: μεθέπω
div1.sense: to follow after, follow closely, Hom.; so in Mid., μετασπόμενος Il.; c. dat., μεθέψομαί σοι Soph.
c. acc. to follow with the eyes, to seek after, Il.
to visit, νέον μεθέπεις; dost thou come but now to visit us? Od.
metaph. to pursue, attend to, Pind.; ἄχθος μεθέπων carrying a burden, Pind.
Causal, c. dupl. acc., Τυδείδην μέθεπε ἵππους he turned the horses in pursuit of Tydeides, Il.

div1.head: μεθημερινός
div1.sense: happening by day, in open day, Xen., Dem.

div1.head: μεθημοσύνη
div1.sense: remissness, carelessness, Il.

div1.head: μεθήμων
div1.sense: remiss, careless, Hom.

div1.head: μέθη
div1.sense: strong drink, καλῶς ἔχειν μέθης to be pretty well drunk, Hdt.; ὑπερπλησθεὶς μέθης Soph.; μέθῃ βρεχθείς Eur.
drunkenness, Plat.

div1.head: μεθήκω
div1.sense: to be come in quest of, τινά Eur., Ar.

div1.head: μέθημαι
div1.sense: Pass. to sit among, c. dat., Od.

div1.head: μεθίδρυσις
div1.sense: migration, Strab.

div1.head: μεθιδρύω
div1.sense: to place differently, transpose, Plat.: —Pass. to keep moving, Plut.

div1.head: μεθίημι
div1.etym: 2 and 3 pers. μεθιεῖς, μεθιεῖ as if from μεθιέω
div1.sense: trans. to let go, let loose, release a prisoner, Il., etc.: to let a visitor depart, Od.: to dismiss a wife, Hdt.:—c. inf. to let one free to do as he will, allow one to do, Hdt.; so, ἐλεύθερον μ. τινά Eur.:—Pass. to be let go, dismissed, Hdt.
to give up, abandon, Il.:—metaph., εἴ με μεθείη ῥῖγος if the cold would but leave me, Od.

c. acc. rei, to let a thing go, let it fall, throw, τι ἐς ποταμόν Od., etc.:— also, μ. χόλον to let go, give up oneʼs wrath, Hom.; so, Ἀχιλῆι μεθέμεν χόλον to put away anger in favour of Achilles, Il.; so, μ. καρδίας χόλον to put away anger from oneʼs heart, Eur.; μ. ψυχήν to give up the ghost, Eur.:—of liquids, to let flow, let drop, Hdt., Attic:—so, γλῶσσαν Περσίδα μ. to let drop, i. e. utter, Persian words, Hdt.:— μ. βλαστόν to let it shoot forth, Hdt.:— μ. βέλος to let it fly, discharge it, Soph.; μ. ξίφος ἐς γυναῖκα to plunge it into her, Eur. ; ναῒ μεθεῖναι (sc. ἱστία) to give the ship her way, Soph.
to relieve, κῆρ ἄχεος the heart from grief, Il.
to give up, resign, throw aside, Il., Attic
to forgive one a fault, remit a debt, Hdt.; τόνδε κίνδυνον μεθείς excusing thee this peril, Eur.
intr. to relax oneʼs energies (where ἑαυτόν may be supplied), to be slack, remiss, lukewarm, dally, Hom.: c. inf. to neglect to do, Il., Hdt., Attic
to let, permit, μεθεῖσά μοι λέγειν having left it for me to speak, having allowed me, Soph.
c. gen. rei, to relax or cease from, πολέμοιο, μάχης Il., etc.; μέθιεν χόλοιο Τηλεμάχῳ [the suitors] ceased from wrath in deference to Telemachus, Od.
c. gen. pers. to abandon, neglect, Il.
c. part., κλαύσας μεθέηκε having wept he left off, Il.
the Mid. agrees in construction with the intr. Act., to free oneself from, let go oneʼs hold of, c. gen., παιδὸς οὐ μεθήσομαι Eur., etc.;—the act. would be παῖδα οὐ μεθήσω.

div1.head: μεθίστημι
div1.sense: Causal, in pres. and imperf., fut. and aor1, to place in another way, to change, μεταστήσω τοι ταῦτα I will give thee another present instead of this, Od.; μ. τὰ νόμιμα πάντα Hdt.; ὄνομα etc., Eur.
c. gen. partit., οὐ μεθίστησι τοῦ χρώματος he changes nothing of his colour, Ar.
of persons, to set free, νόσου from disease, Soph.; κακῶν, ὕπνου Eur.
to remove, Eur., Thuc.:—so in aor1 mid., μεταστήσασθαι to remove from oneself or from oneʼs presence, Hdt., Thuc., etc.
Pass., aor1 μετεστάθην [ᾰ], with aor2, perf., and plup. act.:
to stand among or in the midst of, ἑτάροισι μεθίστατο Il.
to change oneʼs position, remove, depart, Hdt., Attic; μ. τυράννοις ἐκποδών to make way for them, Eur.
c. gen. rei, to change or cease from, κότου Aesch.; λύπης, κακῶν Eur.; μ. βίου to die, Eur.; μ. φρενῶν to go mad, Eur.
to go over to another party, to revolt, Thuc.
of things, to change, alter, sometimes for the better, τῆς τύχης εὖ μετεστεώσης Hdt.; or for the worse, δαίμων μεθέστηκε στρατῷ fortune hath changed for the army, Aesch.

div1.head: μεθοδεία
div1.sense: craft, wiliness, NTest.

div1.head: μεθοδεύω
div1.sense: to treat by method: to use cunning devices, employ craft, Lxx.

div1.head: μεθοδηγέω
div1.sense: to lead another way, Anth.

div1.head: μέθοδος
div1.sense: a following after, pursuit: esp. pursuit of knowledge, scientific inquiry, investigation, method of inquiry, method, Plat., etc.

div1.head: μεθομιλέω
div1.sense: to hold converse with, τινί Il.

div1.head: μεθό
div1.sense: for μεθʼ ὅ after that.

div1.head: μεθόριος
div1.sense: lying between as a boundary, γῆ μεθορία τῆς Ἀργείας καὶ Λακωνικῆς the border country between Argolis and Laconia, Thuc.: in pl. the borders, marches, frontier, Thuc., Xen., etc.:—also, ἡ μεθορία (sub. χώρα) Plut.

div1.head: μεθορμάομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to rush in pursuit of, make a dash at, Hom.

div1.head: μεθορμίζω
div1.sense: to remove from one anchorage to another, intr. (sub. νέας) , μ. εἰς Σηστόν Xen.: metaph., τοῦ νῦν σκυθρωποῦ μεθορμιεῖ σε will unmoor, i. e. will remove, thee from thy sternness, Eur.:— Mid., μεθορμίσασθαι to seek a refuge, Eur.:—Pass. to sail from one place to another, put out from, Hdt.

div1.head: μεθυδριάς
div1.sense: a water-nymph, Anth.

div1.head: Μεθύδριον
div1.sense: between-waters, a place in Arcadia, whence the waters ran some north some south (cf. Ital. Inter-amnia), Thuc.

div1.head: μεθυδώτης
div1.sense: giver of wine, Anth.

div1.head: μέθυ
div1.sense: wine, mead, Hom.

div1.head: μεθυπῖδαξ
div1.sense: gushing with wine, Anth.

div1.head: μεθυπλήξ
div1.sense: wine-stricken, Anth.

div1.head: μέθυσις
div1.sense: drunkenness, Theogn.

div1.head: μεθύσκω
div1.sense: to make drunk, intoxicate, inebriate, Plat., Luc., etc.
to give to drink: to water, moisten, Anth.
Pass. = μεθύω, to drink freely, to get drunk, Hdt., Xen.; aor1 ἐμεθύσθην, to be drunk, Eur., Dem.; νέκταρος with nectar, Plat.

div1.head: μεθυσοκότταβος
div1.sense: drunk with cottabus-playing, Ar.

div1.head: μέθυσος
div1.sense: drunken, Ar., etc.

div1.head: μεθύστερος
div1.sense: living after, μεθύστεροι posterity, Aesch.
neut. as adv. afterwards, hereafter, Hhymn., Soph.; so long after, so late, Aesch.; οὐ μ. in a moment, Aesch.: too late, Soph.

div1.head: μεθυστικός
div1.sense: intoxicating, Arist.
of men, given to wine, Plat.

div1.head: μεθυσφαλής
div1.sense: reeling-drunk, Anth.

div1.head: μεθύω
div1.etym: only in pres. and imperf.; the fut. and aor. act. belong to μεθύσκω
div1.sense: to be drunken with wine, Od., etc.; μ. ὑπὸ τοῦ οἴνου Xen.
metaph. of things, βοείη μεθύουσα ἀλοιφῆι an ox-hide soaked in oil, Il.
of persons, to be drunken or intoxicated with passion, pride, etc., Xen., Plat.

div1.head: μειαγωγέω
div1.sense: to bring the lamb to the scale, and metaph., μ. τὴν τραγῳδίαν to weigh tragedy as you would a lamb, Ar.

div1.head: μειαγωγός
div1.sense: bringing the sacrificial lamb (μεῖον) to be weighed, Eupol.

div1.head: μειδάω
div1.etym: only used in Epic 3rd sg. aor1 μείδησε, part. μειδήσας, -σασα
div1.sense: to smile, Hom.: to grin, v. σαρδάνιος. Cf. μειδιάω.

div1.head: μείδημα
div1.sense: a smile, smiling, Hes.

div1.head: μειδίαμα
div1.sense: a smile, Plut., Luc.

div1.head: μείλια
div1.sense: soothing things, pleasing gifts, Il.
in sg., a charm, Anth.

div1.head: μείλιγμα
div1.sense: anything that serves to soothe, μειλίγματα θυμοῦ scraps to appease the hunger of dogs, Od.:—metaph., γλώσσης μείλιγμα Aesch.
in pl. propitiations, atonements made to the dead, Lat. inferiae, Aesch.
of a person, a fondling, darling, Aesch.
a soothing song, Theocr.

div1.head: μειλικτήριος
div1.sense: able to soothe: μειλικτήρια (sc. ἱερά), τά, propitiations, Aesch.

div1.head: μειλίσσω
div1.sense: to make mild, to appease, propitiate, πυρὸς μειλισσέμεν to appease [the dead] by fire, i. e. by funeral rites, Il.; ὀργὰς μ. Eur.:—Mid. to use soothing words, μηδέ τί μʼ αἰδόμενος μειλίσσεο μηδʼ ἐλεαίρων extenuate not aught from respect or pity to me, Od.

div1.head: μειλιχία
div1.sense: gentleness, softness, μειλιχίη πολέμοιο lukewarmness in battle, Il.

div1.head: μειλίχιος
div1.sense: gentle, mild, soothing, μειλιχίοις ἐπέεσσι, μ. μύθοις Hom.; and without Subst., προσαυδᾶν μειλιχίοισι to address with gentle words, Il.; αἰδοῖ μειλιχίῃ Od., Hes.; neut. as adv., gently, Mosch.
gracious, Ζεὺς Μειλίχιος the protector of those who invoked him with propitiatory offerings, Thuc., Xen.
μειλίχια ποτά propitiatory drink-offerings, or (as others) honied drinks, honey being mixed in the drink-offerings, Soph.

div1.head: μειλιχόγηρυς
div1.sense: soft-voiced, Tyrtae.

div1.head: μείλιχος
div1.sense: gentle, kind, like μειλίχιος, Hom., etc.; c. gen., Ἄρτεμις μ. ὠδίνων soother of pangs, Anth.; τὸ μείλιχον gentleness, Theogn.; τὰ μείλιχα joys, Pind.

div1.head: μειονεκτέω
div1.sense: to have too little, to be poor, Xen.: to be worse off, come short, Xen.; c. gen. rei, to be short of a thing, Xen.

div1.head: μειονεξία
div1.sense: disadvantage, Xen.

div1.head: μεῖον
div1.sense: μεῖον, ου, τό the lamb which was offered at the Apaturia, when a boy was enrolled in his φρατρία. It was to be of a certain weight; and the φράτερες, whose perquisite it was, used to cry out μεῖον, μεῖον, too light! cf. μειαγωγέω.
[neut. of μείων, less]

div1.head: μειόω
div1.sense: to make smaller, to lessen, moderate, Xen.
to lessen in honour, degrade, Xen.
to lessen by word, extenuate, disparage, Xen.
Pass. to become worse or weaker, Xen.: c. gen. to fall short of, Xen.

div1.head: μειρακιεξαπάτης
div1.sense: a boy-cheater, Anth.

div1.head: μειρακιεύομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to play the boy, Plut., Luc.

div1.head: μειράκιον
div1.sense: a boy, lad, stripling, Plat.

div1.head: μειρακίσκη
div1.sense: a little girl, Ar.

div1.head: μειρακίσκος
div1.sense: a lad, stripling, Plat.

div1.head: μειρακιώδης
div1.sense: becoming a youth, youthful, Plat.
puerile, Plat.

div1.head: μειρακύλλιον
div1.sense: a mere lad, Ar.

div1.head: μεῖραξ
div1.sense: a young girl, lass, (μειράκιον being used of boys), Ar., etc.

div1.head: μείρομαι
div1.sense: to receive as oneʼs portion or due, καὶ ἥμισυ μείρεο τιμῆς take half the honour as thy due, Il.
in perf. to have oneʼs share of, c. gen., ἔμμορε τιμῆς he has gotten his share of honour, Hom.

in 3rd sg. perf. pass. εἵμαρται, impers. it is allotted, decreed by fate, Plat.; plup. εἵμαρτο, it was decreed, Hom.; εἵμαρτο Dem., etc.:—part., εἱμαρμένος, η, ον, ordained, destined, allotted, Theogn., Aesch., etc.; ἡ εἱμαρμένη (sc. μοῖρα), that which is allotted, destiny, Plat.

div1.head: μεῖστος
div1.sense: most, Bion.

div1.head: μείωμα
div1.sense: curtailment:—a fine, Xen.

div1.head: μείων
div1.sense: less, Aesch., etc.: older, Soph.:—neut. μεῖον, as adv., less, μ. ἰσχύσειν Διός Aesch.:— μειόνως ἔχειν to be of less value, Soph.

div1.head: μελάγγαιος
div1.sense: with black soil, loamy, Hdt.

div1.head: μελάγκερως
div1.sense: black-horned, black, Aesch.

div1.head: μελαγκόρυφος
div1.sense: the blackcap, Ar.

div1.head: μελάγκροκος
div1.sense: with black woof: of a ship, with black sails, Aesch.

div1.head: μελαγχαίτης
div1.sense: black-haired, of Centaurs, Hes., Soph., Eur.

div1.head: μελάγχιμος
div1.sense: black, dark, Aesch., Eur.
div1.etym: Formed from μέλας, with termin. -χιμος, as δύσχιμος from δυσ-

div1.head: μελαγχίτων
div1.sense: with black raiment, darksome, gloomy, Aesch.

div1.head: μελάγχλαινος
div1.sense: black-cloaked, Mosch.
οἱ M., a Scythian nation, Hdt.

div1.head: μελαγχολάω
div1.sense: to be atrabilious, Ar., Plat.

div1.head: μελαγχολικός
div1.sense: atrabilious, choleric, Plat.

div1.head: μελάγχολος
div1.sense: dipped in black bile, Soph.

div1.head: μελαγχροιής
div1.sense: black-skinned, swarthy, Od.

div1.head: μελάγχροος
div1.sense: swarthy, Plut., etc.; a heterocl. nom. pl. μελάγχροες, Hdt.

div1.head: μέλαθρον
div1.sense: the ceiling of a room, or (rather) the main beam which bears the ceiling, Od.; in Od. 19. 544, the end of this beam outside the house.
generally, a roof, Hom.
a house, hall, Pind., Eur.; mostly in pl., like Lat. tecta, Trag.

div1.head: μελαίνω
div1.sense: to blacken: Pass., μελαίνετο χρόα he had his skin stained black (with blood), Il.; of earth just turned up, Il.; of ripening grapes, Hes.; of a newly-bearded chin, Hes.
intr., = Pass., to grow black, Plat., Anth.

div1.head: μελαμβαθής
div1.sense: darkly deep, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: μελάμβωλος
div1.sense: with black soil, Anth.

div1.head: μελαμπαγής
div1.sense: black clotted, Aesch.: generally, discoloured, Aesch.

div1.head: μελάμπεπλος
div1.sense: black-robed, Eur.: generally, black, Eur.

div1.head: μελαμπέταλος
div1.sense: dark-leaved, Anth.

div1.head: μελάμπτερος
div1.sense: black-winged, Anth.

div1.head: μελαμφαής
div1.sense: whose light is blackness, Eur.

div1.head: μελάμφυλλος
div1.sense: dark-leaved, Anacr.: of places, dark with leaves, Pind., Soph.

div1.head: μελάναιγις
div1.sense: with dark aegis, Aesch.

div1.head: μελαναυγής
div1.sense: dark-gleaming, Eur.

div1.head: μελάνδετος
div1.sense: bound or mounted with black, of swords with black scabbards, Il., Eur.; σάκος μ. an iron-rimmed shield, Aesch.

div1.head: μελανδόκος
div1.sense: holding ink, Anth.

div1.head: μελανείμων
div1.sense: black-clad, μ. ἔφοδοι the assaults of the black-robed ones (the Furies), Aesch.

div1.head: μελανία
div1.sense: blackness: a black cloud, Xen.

div1.head: μελανοκάρδιος
div1.sense: black-hearted, Ar.

div1.head: μελανόμματος
div1.sense: black-eyed, Plat.

div1.head: μελανονεκυοείμων
div1.sense: clad in black death-clothes, Ar.

div1.head: μελανόπτερος
div1.sense: black-winged, Eur., Ar.

div1.head: μελάνοσσος
div1.sense: black-eyed, Il.

div1.head: μελάνοστος
div1.sense: black-boned, Il.

div1.head: μελάνουρος
div1.sense: a sea-fish, the black-tail: fem. μελαν-ουρίς, ίδος, Anth.

div1.head: μέλαν
div1.sense: black pigment, ink, Dem.

div1.head: μελαντειχής
div1.sense: black-walled, Pind.

div1.head: μελαντηρία
div1.sense: a black dye, Luc.

div1.head: μελαντραγής
div1.sense: black when eaten, Anth.

div1.head: μελάνυδρος
div1.sense: with black water, κρήνη μελάνυδρος of water which looks black from its depth, Il., Od.

div1.head: μελάνω
div1.sense: intr. to grow black, Il.

div1.head: μέλασμα
div1.sense: anything black, μ. γραμματόκον a black lead pencil, Anth.

div1.head: μέλας
div1.etym: cf. τάλας, the only word like it in form
div1.sense: black, swart, Hom., etc.; μέλαν ὕδωρ of water drawn from a deep well (cf. μελάνυδρος) , Od.
black, dark, murky, ἕσπερος, νύξ Hom., etc.
metaph. black, dark, θάνατος, Κήρ, the origin of the metaphor being seen in such phrases as μέλαν νέφος θανάτοιο, Hom.
dark, obscure, Anth.
comp. μελάντερος, η, ον, blacker, very black, Il.; cf. ἠΰτε.
μέλαν, v. sub voc.

div1.head: μέλδω
div1.sense: In mid., only in pres. in Hom., to melt, λέβης κνίσην μελδόμενος a pot filled with melting fat, Il.

div1.head: μελεδαίνω
div1.sense: to care for, be cumbered about a thing, c. gen., Theogn., Theocr.
c. acc. to tend, attend to, Hdt., Theocr.
c. inf., γῆμαι οὐ μελεδαίνει cares not to marry, Theogn.

div1.head: μελέδημα
div1.sense: care, anxiety, Il.; μελεδήματα πατρός anxieties about oneʼs father, Od.:— μελεδήματα θεῶν the care of gods [for men], Eur.

div1.head: μελεδήμων
div1.sense: careful, busy, Anth.

div1.head: μελεδώνη
div1.sense: care, sorrow, Od., Theocr.

div1.head: μελεδωνός
div1.sense: one who takes care of anything, a manager, keeper, μ. τῶν οἰκιῶν a house- steward, Hdt.; ὁ μ. τῶν θηρίων the keeper of the crocodiles, Hdt.; μ. τῆς τροφῆς one who provides their food, Hdt.

div1.head: μελεϊστί
div1.sense: limb from limb, Shaksp. "limb-meal, " μελεϊστὶ ταμεῖν Hom.

div1.head: μελεοπαθής
div1.sense: sadly suffering, Aesch.

div1.head: μελεοπόνος
div1.sense: having laboured wretchedly, Aesch.

div1.head: μέλεος
div1.sense: idle, useless, Lat. irritus, Hom.: neut. as adv. in vain, Il.
unhappy, miserable, ὦ μέλεοι, τί κάθησθε; Orac. ap. Hdt.; μέλεος γάμων unhappy in marriage, Aesch., etc.; μ. ἔργα, μ. θάνατος Aesch.

div1.head: μελεόφρων
div1.sense: miserable-minded, Eur.

div1.head: μέλε
div1.sense: and ὦ μέλε, only in voc., ὦ μέλε, dear!good friend! Ar.

div1.head: μελεσίπτερος
div1.sense: singing with its wings, of the cicada, Anth.

div1.head: μελετάω
div1.sense: to care for, attend to a thing, c. gen., Hes.
c. acc. rei, to attend to, study, Hdt., Soph.; μ. δόξαν to study, court reputation, Thuc.

to practise an art, Lat. meditari, μαντείαν Hhymn.; μ. τοῦτο (sc. κήρυκα εἶναι) Hdt.; μ. σοφίαν Ar.; ῥητορικήν Plat.:—in Attic also, to practise speaking, to con over a speech, Dem.:—Pass., τὸ ναυτικὸν οὐκ ἐνδέχεται ἐκ παρέργου μελετᾶσθαι nautical skill cannot be acquired by occasional practice, Thuc.; εὐταξία μετὰ κινδύνων μελετωμένη discipline won by practice on the battle-field, Thuc.
c. inf. to practise doing a thing, μ. τοξεύειν καὶ ἀκοντίζειν Xen.; μ. ἀποθνήσκειν Plat.
absol. to practise, exercise oneself, the acc. rei being omitted, Thuc., Xen.; ἐν τῷ μὴ μελετῶντι (= μελετᾶν) by want of practice, Thuc.: —esp. to rehearse a speech, declaim, Plat., etc.
c. acc. pers. to exercise or train persons, Xen.

div1.head: μελέτημα
div1.sense: a practice, exercise, study, Plat., Xen.

div1.head: μελέτη
div1.sense: care, attention, Hes.; μ. πλεόνων care for many things, Hes.; ἔργων μ. attention to action, Thuc.:—but c. gen. subjecti, care paid by one, θεῶν του μελέτῃ Soph.
practice, exercise, Lat. meditatio, Pind.; ἡ διʼ ὀλίγου μ. their short practice, Thuc.; πόνων μελέται painful exercises, of the Spartan discipline, Thuc.
in a military sense, exercise, practice, drill, Thuc.
of an orator, rehearsal, Dem.
a pursuit, Pind.
care, anxiety, μελέτῃ κατατρύχεσθαι Eur.

div1.head: μελετηρός
div1.sense: practising diligently, Xen.

div1.head: μελετητέος
div1.sense: one must study, Plat.

div1.head: μελετητήριον
div1.sense: a place for practice, Plut.

div1.head: μελέτωρ
div1.sense: one who cares for, an avenger, ἀμφί τινα Soph.

div1.head: μέλημα
div1.sense: the object of care, a darling, of persons, τοὐμὸν μέλ., like Virgilʼs mea cura, Pind.; ὦ φίλτατον μ. Aesch.
a charge, duty, Aesch., Soph.
care, anxiety, Aesch., Theocr.

div1.head: μελησίμβροτος
div1.sense: with μ inserted, an object of care or love to men, Pind.

div1.head: μελητέος
div1.sense: one must take thought for, τινός Plat.

div1.head: Μελητίδης
div1.sense: proverbial at Athens for a blockhead (in form a patronymic from Μέλητος) ) , Ar.

div1.head: μελία
div1.sense: the ash, Lat. fraxinus, Il., etc.
an ashen spear, Il.

div1.head: μελίβρομος
div1.sense: sweet-toned, Anth.

div1.head: μελίγδουπος
div1.sense: sweet-sounding, Pind.

div1.head: μελίγηρυς
div1.note: μελί-γηρυς, Doric μελί-γᾱρυς, υος, ὁ, ἡ,
div1.sense: sweet-voiced, melodious, Od., Pind.

div1.head: μελίγλωσσος
div1.sense: honey-tongued, Aesch., Ar.

div1.head: μέλιγμα
div1.sense: a song, Mosch.
a pitch-pipe, Mosch.

div1.head: μελίζω
div1.sense: to modulate, sing, warble, Theocr.: mostly in Mid., Theocr., Anth.
trans. to sing of, celebrate in song, Pind., Aesch.

div1.head: μελιηδής
div1.sense: honey-sweet, of wine, Hom.:— metaph., μελιηδέα θυμὸν ἀπηύρα Il.; μ. ὕπνος Od.

div1.head: μελίθρεπτος
div1.sense: honey-fed, Anth.

div1.head: μελίκηρον
div1.sense: a honey-comb, Theocr.

div1.head: μελίκομπος
div1.sense: sweet-sounding, Pind.

div1.head: μελίκρατον
div1.sense: a drink of honey and milk offered to the powers below, Od.

div1.head: μελικτής
div1.sense: a singer, player, Theocr., Mosch.

div1.head: μελίλωτον
div1.sense: melilot, a kind of clover, rich in honey, Cratin., etc.

div1.head: μελίνη
div1.sense: millet, Lat. panicum, Hdt.: in pl. millet-fields, Xen., Dem.

div1.head: μέλινος
div1.sense: ashen, Lat. fraxineus, Hom.

div1.head: Μελινοφάγοι
div1.sense: millet-eaters, a Thracian tribe, Xen.

div1.head: μελίπαις
div1.sense: with honey-children, of a bee-hive, Anth.

div1.head: μέλι
div1.sense: Lat. mel, honey, Hom., etc.

div1.head: μελίπνοος
div1.sense: honey-breathing, sweet-breathing, Theocr., Anth.

div1.head: μελίρρυτος
div1.sense: honey-flowing, Plat.

div1.head: μελίσκιον
div1.etym: Dim. of μέλος II, Alcman, Antipho.

div1.head: μέλισμα
div1.sense: a song, Theocr.: a tune, Anth.

div1.head: μέλισσα
div1.sense: a bee, Lat. apis, Hom., etc.
one of the priestesses of Delphi, Pind.
= μέλι, honey, Soph.

div1.head: μελίσσειος
div1.sense: of bees, κηρίον μ. a honeycomb, NTest.

div1.head: μελισσόβοτος
div1.sense: fed on by bees, Anth.

div1.head: μελισσονόμος
div1.sense: keeping bees, :—in Aesch. ap. Ar., the Μελισσονόμοι are priestesses of Artemis.

div1.head: μελισσοσόος
div1.sense: guardian of bees, Anth.

div1.head: μελισσότοκος
div1.sense: produced by bees, honied, Anth.

div1.head: μελισσοτρόφος
div1.sense: feeding bees, Eur.

div1.head: μελισταγής
div1.sense: dropping honey, Anth.

div1.head: μελίτεια
div1.sense: baulm, Lat. apiastrum, Theocr.

div1.head: μελίτειον
div1.sense: mead, Plut., etc.

div1.head: μελιτόεις
div1.sense: honied, i. e. sweet, delicious, Pind.
sweetened with honey, μελιτόεσσα (sc. μᾶζα) , a honey-cake, as a sacred offering, Hdt.; Attic contr. μελιτοῦττα, Ar.

div1.head: μελιτόω
div1.sense: Pass. to be sweetened with honey, Thuc.

div1.head: μελιτοπώλης
div1.sense: a dealer in honey, Ar.

div1.head: μελιττουργός
div1.sense: a bee-keeper, Plat.

div1.head: μελιτώδης
div1.sense: like honey: a name of Persephone, Lat. Mellita, Theocr.

div1.head: μελίτωμα
div1.sense: a honey-cake, Batr.

div1.head: μελίφθογγος
div1.sense: honey-voiced, Pind.

div1.head: μελίφρων
div1.sense: sweet to the mind, delicious, Hom., Hes.

div1.head: μελίχλωρος
div1.sense: honey-pale, Plat., Theocr.

div1.head: μελιχρός
div1.sense: honey-sweet, Theocr.:—metaph., of Sophocles, Anth.:—comp. adv. μελιχρότερον, Anth.

div1.head: μελιχρώδης
div1.sense: yellow as honey, Anth.

div1.head: μελλείρην
div1.sense: a Spartan youth before the age of 20, Plut.

div1.head: μέλλημα
div1.sense: a delay, Eur., Aeschin.

div1.head: μέλλησις
div1.sense: a being about to do, threatening to do, Thuc.
an intention not carried into effect, delay, Thuc.; διὰ βραχείας μελλήσεως at short notice, Thuc.
c. gen. rei, a putting off, a delaying to execute, Thuc.

div1.head: μελλητέος
div1.sense: one must delay, Eur.

div1.head: μελλητής
div1.sense: a delayer, loiterer, Thuc., Arist.

div1.head: μελλόγαμος
div1.sense: betrothed, Soph., Theocr.

div1.head: μελλονικιάω
div1.sense: to be going to conquer, with a play on the name of Νικίας, the Athenian Cunctator, Ar.

div1.head: μελλόνυμφος
div1.sense: of girls, about to be betrothed or wedded, Lat. nubilis, Soph.:—in Soph. Tr. 207, ἀνολολύξατε ὁ μελλόνυμφος, ὁ μ. (sc. χορός) must be taken collectively for αἱ μελλόνυμφοι, the maidens of the house.

div1.head: μέλλω
div1.sense: to think of doing, intend to do, to be about to do, with inf., mostly inf. fut., τάχʼ ἔμελλε δώσειν he was just going to give, Il.; μέλλεις ἀφαιρήσεσθαι ἄεθλον thou thinkest to strip me of the prize, Il.; often with οὐκ ἄρα, as, οὐκ ἄρʼ ἔμελλες λήξειν; did you not think you might stop? could you not stop? Od., etc.; to be about to do (on compulsion), to be destined to do or to be, τὰ οὐ τελέεσθαι ἔμελλον which were not to be accomplished, Il.; μέλλεν οἶκος ἀφνειὸς ἔμμεναι the house was destined to be wealthy, Od.; εἰ ἐμέλλομεν ἀνοίσειν if we were able to refer, Plat.
to express a certainty, μέλλω ἀπέχθεσθαι Διί it must be that I am hated by Zeus, Il.; μέλλω ἀθανάτους ἀλιτέσθαι I must have sinned against the immortals, Od.

to mark a probability, when it may be rendered to be like to do or be, or expressed by an adv., τὰ δὲ μέλλετʼ ἀκουέμεν belike ye have heard it, Hom.; μέλλεις ἴδμεναι thou art like to know of it, Od.; ἐμέλλετʼ ἆρα πάντες ἀνασείειν βοήν aye, all of you were like to raise (i. e. I thought you would raise) a cry of submission, Ar.

to mark mere intention, to be always going to do without ever doing, and so to delay, put off, hesitate, scruple, mostly with inf. pres., τί μέλλομεν χωρεῖν; Soph.; often followed by μὴ οὐ or μή, τί μέλλομεν μὴ πράσσειν; Eur.

μέλλω often stands without its inf., τὸν υἱὸν ἑόρακας αὐτοῦ; Answ. τί δʼ οὐ μέλλω; why shouldnʼt I have seen him? i. e. be sure I have, Xen.; οὐδὲν ἐπάθετε οὐδὲ ἐμελλήσατε (sc. παθεῖν) Thuc.:—so, when μέλλω seems to govern an acc., an inf. is omitted, τὸ μέλλειν ἀγαθά (sc. πράσσειν) the expectation of good things, Eur.: hence

the part. μέλλων without an inf. (where εἶναι or γίγνεσθαι may be supplied), ὁ μ. χρόνος the future time, Pind., Aesch.; esp. in neut., τὸ μέλλον, τὰ μέλλοντα things to come, the event, issue, future, Aesch., etc.:—so in Mid., τὰ ἰσχυρότατα ἐλπιζόμενα μέλλεται your strongest pleas are hopes in futurity, Thuc.
μέλλομαι as Pass., ὡς μὴ μέλλοιτο τὰ δέοντα that the necessary steps might not be delayed, Xen.; ἐν ὅσωι ταῦτα μέλλεται while these delays are going on, Dem.

div1.head: μελογραφία
div1.sense: song-writing, Anth.

div1.head: μελογράφος
div1.sense: writing songs, Anth.

div1.head: μελοποιέω
div1.sense: to make lyric poems, Ar.

div1.head: μελοποιΐα
div1.sense: a making of lyric poems or music: the theory of music, as opposed to its practice, Plat.

div1.head: μελοποιός
div1.sense: a maker of songs, a lyric poet, Ar., Plat.
as adj. tuneful, Eur.

div1.head: μέλος
div1.sense: a limb, Hom., etc.; μελέων ἔντοσθε within my bodily frame, Aesch.; κατὰ μέλεα limb by limb, like μελεϊστί, Hdt.
a song, strain, Hhymn., etc.:—esp. of lyric poetry, ἐν μέλεϊ ποιέειν to write in lyric strain, Hdt.; μέλη, τά, lyric poetry, the choral songs, opp. to the dialogue, Plat.
the music to which a song is set, the tune, Plat.; ἐν μέλει in tune, Plat.; παρὰ μέλος, out of tune, Plat.

div1.head: μελοτυπέω
div1.sense: to strike up a strain, chant, Aesch.

div1.head: μέλπηθρον
div1.sense: the song with the dance, festive sport, κυνῶν μέλπηθρα a sport for dogs, of a corpse, κυσὶ μέλπηθρα γενέσθαι Il.

div1.head: Μελπομένη
div1.sense: Melpomene, a Muse, properly the songstress, Hes.: later the Muse of tragedy.

div1.head: μέλπω
div1.sense: to sing of, celebrate with song and dance, Il., Eur.; μ. τινὰ κατὰ χέλυν Eur.
intr. to sing, Aesch., Eur.;— c. acc. cogn., μ. θανάσιμον γόον Aesch.; ἰαχάν, βοάν Eur.
also as Dep. μέλπομαι to sing to the lyre or harp, Od.; to dance and sing, as a chorus, μετὰ μελπομένηισιν ἐν χορῶι Il.; μέλπεσθαι Ἄρηι to dance a war-dance in honour of Ares, i. e. to fight, Il.
c. acc., as in Act. to sing, celebrate, Hes., Eur.

div1.head: μελύδριον
div1.sense: a ditty, Theocr., Bion.

div1.head: μελῳδέω
div1.sense: to sing, chant, Ar.

div1.head: μελῳδία
div1.sense: a singing, chanting, Eur.
a chant, choral song, Plat.

div1.head: μελῳδός
div1.sense: singing, musical, melodious, Eur.

div1.head: μέλω
div1.etym: on II., most usual in 3rd sg. and pl. of act. pres. μέλει, μέλουσι.
div1.sense: neuter, with perf. μέμηλα, to be an object of care or thought to anyone, c. dat. pers., ἀνθρώποισι μέλω I am a source of care to men, i. e. am well known to them, Od.; so, Ἀργὼ πᾶσι μέλουσα Od.; νερτέροισι μέλω Eur., etc.

μή τοι ταῦτα μελόντων let not these things be a care to thee, Hom.; πόλεμος ἄνδρεσσι μελήσει Il.; ὧι τόσσα μέμηλε to whom so great things are a care, Od., etc.:—an inf. often stands as nom., οὐκ ἔμελέν μοι ταῦτα μεταλλῆσαι Od.

in Attic 3rd sg. is commonly used impers. with the object in gen., and pers. in dat., ὧι μέλει μάχας to whom there is care for the battle, who careth for it, Aesch.; Ζηνὶ τῶν σῶν μέλει πόνων Eur., etc.;—also, μέλει μοι περί τινος Hdt., Attic; ὑπέρ τινος Dem.
absol., with a neg., οὐδέν μοι μέλει I care not, Ar.
μέλον ἔστι periphr. for μέλει, as, ἐστί τι μέλον τινί Soph.; τοῦτο ἴσασιν ἐμοὶ μεμεληκός Xen.:—also absol., μέλον γέ σοι since you have thought about it, Plat.

Mid. is used by Poets like Act., to be an object of care, ἐμοὶ δέ κε ταῦτα μελήσεται Il.; τἀνθάδʼ ἂν μέλοιτό μοι what remains should be a care to you, Soph., etc.; rarely impers., μέλεταί μοί τινος Theocr.

in Epic Poets are found perf. and plup. pass. μέμβλεται, μέμβλετο, shortd. for μεμέληται, μεμέλητο, with pres. and imperf. sense, οὐκέτι μέμβλετʼ Ἀχιλλεύς (for μέλει) Achilles cares no longer for it, Il.; μέμβλετο οἱ τεῖχος (for ἔμελε) the wall was a care to him, Il.:—the regul. perf. occurs in later Poets, Φοίβωι μεμελήμεθα Anth.; 2 and 3rd sg. plup. μεμέλησο, -ητο, Anth., Theocr.

trans., c. gen. of persons, to care for, take care of, take an interest in a thing, πλούτοιο μεμηλώς busied with riches, Il.; πολέμοιο μεμηλώς Il.; θεοὶ τῶν ἀδίκων μέλουσιν Eur.:—absol. to be anxious, μέλει κέαρ Aesch., etc.

Mid. μέλομαι, to care for, take care of, c. gen., Trag.; so in aor1 pass., τάφου μεληθείς having provided for the burial, Soph.:—also μεληθέν, as Pass. cared for, Anth.; and perf. part. μεμελημένος, Anth.

div1.head: μέμαα
div1.etym: found only in perf. μέμαα with pres. sense
