div1.sense: to wish eagerly, strive, yearn, desire, c. inf., Hom., etc.: c. gen. to long for, be eager for:—often also with an adv., πῆ μέματον; whither so fast? Il.; πρόσσω μεμαυῖαι pressing forward, Il.; absol. in part., ἔβη μεμαώς he strode on hastily, eagerly, Il.; ἐν πέτρᾳ μεμαώς, of a fisher, expectant, Theocr.
to be bent on doing, to purpose, μεμάασιν αὖθι μένειν Il., etc.
Mid. in Doric inf. μῶσθαι, part. μώμενος: — to seek after, covet, c. acc., Theogn., etc.; c. inf. or absol., Aesch.

div1.head: μεμβράνα
div1.sense: the Lat. membra_na, parchment, NTest.

div1.head: μεμβράς
div1.sense: a small kind of anchovy, Ar.

div1.head: μεμελημένως
div1.sense: carefully, Plat.

div1.head: μεμετρημένως
div1.etym: adverb perf. pass. part. of μετρέω
div1.sense: according to a stated measure, Luc.

div1.head: μεμηχανημένως
div1.sense: by stratagem, Eur.

div1.head: Μεμνόνειον
div1.sense: the temple of Memnon, in Egypt, Luc.; τὰ βασιλήια τὰ Μεμνόνεια (or Μεμνόνια) Hdt.

div1.head: Μέμνων
div1.sense: the steadfast or resolute (cf. Ἀγαμέμνων) , Memnon, son of Eos and Tithonus, killed by Achilles, Od., Hes.

div1.head: μέμονα
div1.etym: perf. used as pres., but only in sg., the pl. being supplied by μέμαα
div1.sense: to wish eagerly, to yearn, strive, be fain, to do a thing, c. inf., Hom.:—absol., διχθὰ δέ μοι κραδίη μέμονε my heart yearneth with a twofold wish, Il.; μέμονεν ὅγε ἶσα θεοῖσι he puts forth spirit equal with the gods, Il.; τί μέμονας; what wishest thou? Aesch.

div1.head: μεμπτός
div1.sense: to be blamed, blameworthy, Hdt., Eur.; comp. μεμπτότερος Thuc.; οὐ μ. not contemptible, Thuc.:—adv. μεμπτῶς Plut.
act. throwing blame upon, τινι Soph.; where μεμπτός is fem. for -τή.

div1.head: μέμφομαι
div1.sense: to blame, censure, find fault with a person or thing, c. acc., Hes., Hdt., Attic
c. dat. pers. et acc. rei, to impute as blameworthy, cast it in his teeth, Lat. exprobrare or objicere alicui, Hdt., Attic

c. dat. pers. only, to find fault with, Trag.;—c. gen. rei only, to complain of a thing, Eur., Thuc.; and with both these cases, τοῦδʼ ἂν οὐδεὶς μέμψαιτό μοι no one would find fault with me for this, Aesch.
c. inf. with μή pleonastic, μ. μὴ πολλάκις βουλεύεσθαι to impute blame for doing, Thuc.

div1.head: μεμψιμοιρέω
div1.sense: to complain of fate, Luc.
to impute as blameworthy, τί τινι ap. Dem.

div1.head: μεμψίμοιρος
div1.sense: complaining of oneʼs fate, repining, querulous, Isocr., Luc.

div1.head: μέμψις
div1.sense: blame, censure, reproof, μ. ἐπιφέρειν τινί Ar.; ἔχειν μ. to incur blame, Eur.
act. cause for complaint, Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: μεναίχμης
div1.sense: abiding the spear, staunch in battle, Anth.

div1.head: μενεαίνω
div1.sense: to desire earnestly or eagerly, to be bent on doing, c. inf., Hom.; also, c. gen., μ. μάχης to long for battle, Hes.
absol. to be angry, rage, Hom.; but, κτεινόμενος μενέαινε he struggled as he was dying, Il.

div1.head: μενεδήϊος
div1.sense: standing against the enemy, staunch, steadfast, Il.; Doric -δάϊος, Anth.

div1.head: Μενέλαος
div1.sense: pr. n. withstanding-men, Hom.: Attic Μενέλεως, gen. εω, Trag.; Doric dat. Μενέλᾳ, Pind., acc. Μενέλαν Eur.

div1.head: μενεπτόλεμος
div1.sense: staunch in battle, steadfast, Il.

div1.head: Μενεσθεύς
div1.sense: pr. n., abider, Il.

div1.head: μενετέος
div1.sense: one must remain, Plat., Xen.

div1.head: μενετός
div1.sense: inclined to wait, patient, Ar.: οἱ καιροὶ οὐ μενετοί opportunities will not wait, Thuc.

div1.head: μενεχάρμης
div1.sense: staunch in battle, of heroes, Il.:—also μενέχαρμος, ον, Il.

div1.head: μενοεικής
div1.sense: suited to the desires, satisfying, sufficient, plentiful, agreeable to oneʼs taste, Hom.; τάφος μ. a plentiful funeral feast, Il.; μενοεικέα ὕλην great store of wood, Il.

div1.head: μενοινάω
div1.sense: to desire eagerly, to be bent on a thing, c. acc., Hom.: also c. inf. to be eager to do, Hom.:—absol., ὧδε μενοινῶν so eager, Il.:— μ. τί τινι to design or purpose something against one, κακὰ Τρώεσσι μενοίνα Od.; c. dat. rei, to strive for a thing, Theogn.

div1.head: μενοινή
div1.sense: eager desire, Anth.

div1.head: μένος
div1.sense: might, force, strength, prowess, courage, Hom., etc.
strength, as implying life, life itself, Il.: life-blood, Soph.
rage, passion, μένος ἔλλαβε θυμόν Il.; μένεος φρένες πίμπλαντο Il.; μένεα πνείοντες Il.:— μένει in dat. violently, furiously, Aesch.
the bent, intent, purpose of any one, Τρώων μ. αἰὲν ἀτάσθαλον their bent is aye to folly, Il.
μένος is also used in periphr., ἱερὸν μένος Ἀλκινόοιο, i. e. Alcinous himself, Od.; μένος Ἀτρείδαο, Ἕκτορος, etc., Il.

div1.head: μέν
div1.sense: Particle, used to shew that the word or clause with which it stands answers to a following word or clause, which is introduced by δέ. Generally, μέν and δέ may be rendered on the one hand, on the other hand, or as well . . , as, while or whereas, but it is often necessary to leave μέν untranslated.
μέν is not always answered by δέ, but by other equiv. Particles, as ἀλλά, ἀτάρ or αὐτάρ, αὖ, αὖθις, αὖτε; also πρῶτον μέν, εἶτα Soph.; πρῶτον μέν, ἔπειτα Soph.; πρῶτον μέν, μετὰ τοῦτο Xen.

the answering clause with δέ is sometimes left to be supplied, ὡς μὲν λέγουσι as indeed they say, (but as I believe not), Eur.; this isolated μέν is often a Pron., ἐγὼ μὲν οὐκ οἶδα I for my part, (whatever others may say), Xen.; οὗτος μέν Plat.
μέν was orig. the same as μήν, and like it is used in protestations, καί μοι ὄμοσσον, ἦ μέν μοι ἀρήξειν and swear to me, that surely thou wilt assist me, Il.
μέν before other Particles: μὲν ἄρα, μέν ῥα accordingly, and so, Hom., etc.
μέν γε, used much like γοῦν, at all events, at any rate, Ar., etc.
μὲν δή to express certainty, Soph., etc.

μὲν οὖν or μενοῦν, a strengthd. form of οὖν, so then, Soph.; in replies, it affirms strongly, πάνυ μὲν οὖν Plat., etc.; also it corrects a statement, nay rather, like Lat. imo, imo vero, μου πρὸς τὴν κεφαλὴν ἀποψῶ wipe your nose on my head, Answ. ἐμοῦ μὲν οὖν . . , nay on mine, Ar., etc.; μὲν οὖν δή Soph.:—so in NTest., μενοῦνγε, to begin a sentence, yea rather, Lat. quin imo.
μέν τοι or μέντοι,
conjunctive, yet, but however, nevertheless, tamen, vero, Aesch., etc.

Adverbial, of course, certainly, Plat., etc.; with an imperat., to enforce the command, τουτὶ μέντοι σὺ φυλάττου only take heed . . , Ar.; strengthd. μέντοι γε Xen.:—in narrative, etc., to add something, καὶ φυλάξασθαι μέντοι . . , and of course to take care . . , Xen.

div1.head: Μεντορουργής
div1.sense: wrought by Mentor, Luc.

div1.head: μένω
div1.sense: Lat. maneo, to stay stand fast, abide, in battle, Hom., Aesch.; μ. κατὰ χώραν, of soldiers, Thuc.
to stay at home, stay where one is, not stir, Il.; μ. εἴσω δόμων Aesch.; κατʼ οἶκον Eur., etc.:—but, μ. ἀπό τινος to stay away from, Il.
to stay, tarry, Hom., etc.
of things, to be lasting, remian, last, stand, στήλη μένει ἔμπεδον Il., etc.
of condition, to remain as one was, of a maiden, Il.; ἢ μείνωσιν ὅρκοι if oaths hold good, Eur.; μ. ἐπὶ τούτων to remain contented with.., Dem.
to abide by an opinion, conviction, etc., ἐπὶ τῶι ἀληθεῖ Plat.
impers. c. inf., it remains for one to do, ἀνθρώποισι κατθανεῖν μένει Eur.

trans. to await, expect, wait for, c. acc., Il.; so, like Lat. manere hostem, Hom., etc.:—so, also c. acc. et inf., ἦ μένετε Τρῶας σχεδὸν ἐλθέμεν; wait ye for the Trojans to come nigh? Il.; μένον δʼ ἐπὶ ἕσπερον ἐλθεῖν they waited for eveningʼs coming on, Od.; μένω δʼ ἀκοῦσαι I wait, i. e. long, to hear, Aesch.

div1.head: Μεριδάρπαξ
div1.sense: bit-stealer, a mouse in Batr.

div1.head: μερίζω
div1.sense: to divide, distribute, Plat., etc.
Mid., μερίζεσθαί τι to divide among themselves, Theocr., Dem.:—c. gen. rei, to take part in, Arist.
Pass. to be divided, Xen.
to be reckoned as part, Dem.

div1.head: μέριμνα
div1.sense: care, thought, esp. anxious thought, solicitude, Hes., Trag.; μ. τινος care for, Aesch., Soph.: —pl. cares, anxieties, Aesch., Ar.
the thought, mind, Aesch.

div1.head: μεριμνάω
div1.sense: to care for, be anxious about, think earnestly upon, scan minutely, Lat. meditari, Soph., Xen.; πολλὰ μ. to be cumbered with many cares, Xen.:—c. inf. to be careful to do, Dem.

div1.head: μερίμνημα
div1.sense: anxiety, Soph.

div1.head: μεριμνητής
div1.sense: one who is anxious about a thing, c. gen., Eur.

div1.head: μεριμνοτόκος
div1.sense: mother of cares, Anth.

div1.head: μερισμός
div1.sense: a dividing, division, Plat.

div1.head: μερίς
div1.sense: a part, portion, share, parcel, Plat.
a contribution, Dem.
a part, division, class, Eur., Dem.

div1.head: μεριστής
div1.sense: a divider, NTest.

div1.head: μεριστός
div1.sense: divided, divisible, Plat., Arist.

div1.head: μερίτης
div1.sense: a partaker in, τινός Dem.

div1.head: μέρμερος
div1.sense: causing anxiety, mischievous, baneful, μέρμερα μητίσασθαι to meditate mischief, Il.; μέρμερα ῥέζειν Il.; πολέμοιο μ. ἔργα Il.
of persons, anxious, peevish, morose, Plat.

div1.head: μέρμηρα
div1.sense: Epic gen. pl. -άων, poet. form of μέριμνα, care, trouble, Hes., Theogn.

div1.head: μερμηρίζω
div1.sense: intr. to be full of cares, to be anxious or thoughtful, to be in doubt, Hom.; δίχα or διάνδιχα μερμηρίζειν to halt between two opinions, Hom.
trans. to devise, contrive, δόλον ἐνὶ φρεσὶ μερμ. Od.; φόνον ἡμῖν μερμηρίζει Od.

div1.head: μέρμις
div1.sense: a cord, string, rope, Od.

div1.head: μέρος
div1.sense: a part, share, Hdt., etc.
oneʼs portion, heritage, lot, Aesch.; ἀπὸ μέρους from considerations of rank, Thuc.

oneʼs turn, Hdt., etc.; ἀγγέλου μ. his turn of duty as messenger, Aesch.:— ἀνὰ μέρος in turn, by turns, Eur.; so, κατὰ μέρος Thuc.; ἐν μέρει in turn, Hdt., etc.; ἐν τῷ μέρει in oneʼs turn, Hdt.; παρὰ τὸ μ. out of oneʼs turn, Xen.; πρὸς μέρος in proportion, Thuc.; τὸ μέρος in part, Hdt.

the part one takes in a thing, or the part assigned one, τοὐμὸν μέρος, τὸ σὸν μ. my or thy part, i. e. simply I or me, thou or thee, Soph.; and absol. as adv., τοὐμὸν μ. as to me, Lat. quod ad me attinet, Soph.
a part, as opp. to the whole, ἡμέρας μ. Aesch.: a division of an army, Xen.; τὰ πέντε μ. five-sixths, τὰ ὀκτὼ μ. eight-ninths, etc.
ἐν μέρει τινὸς τιθέναι, ποιεῖσθαι to put in the class of . . , consider as so and so, Plat.; ἐν οὐδενὸς εἶναι μέρει to be as no one, Dem.; ἐν προσθήκης μέρει as an appendage, Dem.

div1.head: μέροψ
div1.sense: only in pl. as epithet of men, dividing the voice, i. e. articulate-speaking, endowed, with speech, Hom., Hes.:—hence μέροπες as Subst. = ἄνθρωποι, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: μέσαβον
div1.sense: a leathern strap, by which the yoke was fastened to the pole, Hes.

div1.head: μεσάγκυλον
div1.sense: a javelin with a strap (ἀγκύλη) for throwing it by, Eur.

div1.head: μεσαιπόλιος
div1.sense: half-gray, grizzled, i. e. middle-aged, Il.

div1.head: μέσακτος
div1.sense: between shores, in mid-sea, Aesch.

div1.head: μέσαυλος
div1.sense: the inner court, behind the αὐλή, where the cattle were put at night, Il.; of the cave of the Cyclops, Od.
in Attic, μέταυλος (with or without θύρα) , the door between the αὐλή and the inner part of the house, Ar.; θύραι μέσαυλοι Eur.

div1.head: μεσεγγυάω
div1.sense: to deposit a pledge in the hands of a third party, Plat.: —Mid., μεσεγγυᾶσθαι ἀργύριον to have oneʼs money deposited in the hands of a third party, Dem.

div1.head: μεσεγγύημα
div1.sense: money or a pledge deposited with a third party, Aeschin.

div1.head: μεσεύω
div1.sense: to keep the middle or mean between two, c. gen., Plat.: absol. to stand mid-way, to be neutral, Xen.

div1.head: μεσηγύ
div1.sense: adverb
of Space, absol. in the middle, between, οὐδέ τι πολλὴ χώρη μεσσηγύς Il.
c. gen. between, betwixt, μ. γαίης τε καὶ οὐρανοῦ Il., etc.
of Time, meanwhile, meantime, Od.
as Subst., τὸ μεσηγύ the part between, Hhymn.; τὸ μεσηγὺ ἤματος mid-day, Theocr.

div1.head: μεσήεις
div1.sense: middle, middling, Il.

div1.head: μεσημβριάζω
div1.sense: to pass the noon, Lat. meridiari, μεσημβριάζοντα εὕδειν to sleep at noon, Plat.

div1.head: μεσημβρία
div1.sense: mid-day, noon, Hdt.; μεσαμβρίης at noon, Hdt.; τῆς μεσημβρίας Ar.; so, τῇ μεσαμβρίῃ Hdt.; ἐν μεσημβρίᾳ Thuc.; μ. ἵσταται ʼtis high noon, Plat.
the parts towards noon, the South, Hdt.

div1.head: μεσημβρινός
div1.sense: belonging to noon, about noon, noontide, εὖτε πόντος ἐν μεσημβριναῖς κοίταις εὕδοι πεσών Aesch.; μεσημβρινοῖσι θάλπεσι in the noon-day heats, Aesch.; ὁ μ. ᾠδός, of the cicada, Anth.:— τὸ μεσαμβρινόν noon, Theocr.
southern, Aesch., Thuc.

div1.head: μεσημέριος
div1.sense: μεσαμέριον at mid-day, Theocr.

div1.head: μεσήρης
div1.sense: in the middle, midmost, Eur.; Σείριος ἔτι μ. Sirius is still in mid-heaven, Eur.

div1.head: μεσιτεία
div1.sense: mediation, negotiation, Barb.

div1.head: μεσιτεύω
div1.sense: to act as mediator, Barb., NTest.

div1.head: μεσίτης
div1.sense: a mediator, umpire, arbitrator, Polyb., NTest.

div1.head: μεσοβασιλεία
div1.sense: an interregnum, Plut.

div1.head: μεσοβασιλεύς
div1.sense: the Roman interrex, one who holds kingly power between the death of one king and the accession of another, Plut.

div1.head: μεσόγαιος
div1.sense: inland, in the heart of a country, Hdt.; τὴν μ. τῆς ὁδοῦ the inland road, Hdt.

div1.head: μεσόγεως
div1.sense: μεσόγεως As adj., Plat.
as Subst., μεσογαία, the inland parts, interior, Lat. loca mediterranea, Hdt.; so, μεσογεία, ἡ, Thuc., Dem.

div1.head: μεσόγραφος
div1.sense: drawn in the middle: τὸ μ. a mean proportional found by the μεσόλαβος, Anth.

div1.head: μεσόδμη
div1.sense: something built between: in pl., prob., the bays or compartments between the pillars that supported the roof, Od.
a box amidships in which the mast was stepped, Od.

div1.head: μεσολαβής
div1.sense: held by the middle, Aesch.

div1.head: μεσόλευκος
div1.sense: middling white, χιτὼν πορφυρᾶ μ. a tunic of purple shot with white, Xen.

div1.head: μεσόμφαλος
div1.sense: in mid-navel, central, of Apolloʼs shrine at Delphi (cf. ὀμφαλός) , Aesch., Eur.; τὰ μ. γῆς μαντεῖα Soph.

div1.head: μεσονύκτιος
div1.sense: of or at midnight, Pind., Eur.:— neut. as adv., Theocr.

div1.head: μεσοπαγής
div1.sense: fixed up to the middle, μεσσοπαγὲς δʼ ἄρʼ ἔθηκε ἔγχος drove the spear in up to the middle, Il.

div1.head: μεσοπορέω
div1.sense: to be half-way, Theophr.

div1.head: μεσοπόρος
div1.sense: going in the middle, μ. διʼ αἰθέρος through mid- air, Eur.

div1.head: μεσοποτάμιος
div1.sense: between rivers: Μεσοποταμία, sc. χώρα, a land between two rivers, esp. that between the Tigris and Euphrates, Mesopotamia, Polyb., Strab.:— Μεσοποταμίτης, [ῑ], ου, ὁ, Luc.

div1.head: μέσος
div1.sense: middle, in the middle, Lat. medius, Hom., etc.; μέσον σάκος the middle or centre of the shield, Il.; ἐν αἰθέρι μέσῳ in mid air, Soph.; with the Art. following, διὰ μέσης τῆς πόλεως, ἐν μ. τῇ χώρᾳ Xen.
with a Verb, ἔχεται μέσος by the middle, by the waist, proverb. from the wrestling-ring, Ar.
μ. δικαστής μεσίτης, a judge between two, an umpire, Thuc.
ὁ μέσος (sc. δάκτυλος) Plat.
of Time, μέσον ἦμαρ mid- day, Hom.; μέσαι νύκτες Hdt.; also, μέσον τῆς ἡμέρας Hdt.
middling, moderate, μέσος ἀνήρ a man of middle rank, Hdt.; μ. πολίτης Thuc.; also οἱ διὰ μέσου the moderate or neutral party, Thuc.
middling, i. e. middling good, Plat.

μέσον Epic μέσσον, ου, as Subst. the middle, the space between, ἐν μέσσῳ, for ἐν μεταιχμίῳ, Il.; or without ἐν, ἔνθορε μέσσῳ he leaped into the middle, Il.; οἱ ἐν μ. λόγοι the intervening words, Soph.; τὰ ἐν μ. what went between, Soph.; ἐν μ. ἡμῶν καὶ βασιλέως between us and him, Xen.; ἐν μ. νυκτῶν at mid night, Xen.; ἆθλα κείμενα ἐν μέσῳ prizes set up for all to contend for, Dem.;—so in pl., κεῖτο δʼ ἄρʼ ἐν μέσσοισι Il.

ἐς μέσον, ἐς μ. ἀμφοτέρων Hom.; ἐς μ. τιθέναι τισί τι to set a prize before all, for all to contest, Lat. in medio ponere, Il.; ἐς τὸ μ. τιθέναι to propose, bring forward in public, Hdt.; ἐς τὸ μ. λέγειν to speak before all, Hdt.; ἐς μ. Πέρσῃσι καταθεῖναι τὰ πρήγματα to give up the power in common to all, Hdt.
ἐκ τοῦ μέσου καθέζεσθαι to keep clear of a contest, i. e. remain neutral, Hdt.
διὰ μέσου = μεταξύ, between, Hdt., Thuc.; and of Time, meanwhile,Hdt., Thuc.
ἀνὰ μέσον midway between, Theocr.
κατὰ μέσσον, ἐν μέσῳ, Il.
τὸ μέσον, also, the difference, average, Hdt., Thuc.
the middle state or mean, Lat. mediocritas, Arist.; παντὶ μέσῳ τὸ κράτος θεὸς ὤπασεν Aesch.
adv. μέσον, Epic μέσσον, in the middle, Hom.: c. gen. between, οὐρανοῦ μ. χθονός τε Eur.
in Attic μέσως, moderately, Eur.; καὶ μέσως even a little, Thuc.; μέσως βεβιωκέναι in a middle way, i. e. neither well nor ill, Plat.
irreg. comp. μεσαίτερος (cf. μεσαῖος) Plat.; Sup. μεσαίτατος Hdt., etc.

div1.head: μεσοσχιδής
div1.sense: split in two, Anth.

div1.head: μεσότης
div1.sense: a middle or central position, Plat.
a mean between two extremes, Arist.

div1.head: μεσότοιχον
div1.sense: a partition-wall, NTest.

div1.head: μεσοτομέω
div1.sense: to cut through the middle, cut in twain, bisect, Plat., Xen.

div1.head: μεσότομος
div1.sense: cut through the middle, Anth.

div1.head: μεσουράνημα
div1.sense: mid-heaven, mid-air, NTest.

div1.head: μεσουράνησις
div1.sense: the sunʼs place in meridian, Strab.

div1.head: μεσόω
div1.sense: to form the middle, be in or at the middle, Aesch., Eur.:—of time, ἡμέρα μεσοῦσα mid- day, Hdt.; θέρους μεσοῦντος in mid summer, Thuc.
c. gen. to be in the middle of, τῆς ἀναβάσιος Hdt.; so, c. acc., μεσῶν τὴν ἀρχήν in the middle of his time of office, Aeschin.

div1.head: μέσσατος
div1.sense: midmost, Il.; Attic μέσατος, Ar.

div1.head: μεσσόθεν
div1.sense: from the middle, Anth.

div1.head: μεσσόθι
div1.sense: in the middle, Hes.

div1.head: μεστός
div1.sense: full, filled, filled full, Ar., etc.
c. gen. full of, filled with a thing, Hdt., Ar.:—metaph., ἀπάτης, ἀπορίας μ. Plat.:—metaph. also, sated with a thing, Eur.; so c. part., μεστὸς ἦν θυμούμενος i. e. had had my fill of anger, Soph.

div1.head: μεστόω
div1.sense: to fill full of a thing, c. gen., Soph.:—Pass. to be filled or full of, Soph.

div1.head: μέσφα
div1.sense: until, c. gen., μέσφʼ ἠοῦς Il.; with adv., μ. ἐχθές till to-morrow, Theocr.

div1.head: μετάβασις
div1.sense: a passing over, migration, Plut.
change, revolution in government, Plat.
transition from one to another, Luc.

div1.head: μεταβιβάζω
div1.sense: to carry over, shift bring into another place or state Ar., Xen.
to lead in a different direction, Plat.

div1.head: μεταβλητέος
div1.sense: one must change, trans., τινὰ εἴς τι Plat.
intr., Plat.

div1.head: μεταβλητικός
div1.sense: by way of exchange, Arist.: ἡ μεταβλητική (sub. τέχνη) exchange, barter, Plat.

div1.head: μεταβολή
div1.sense: a change, changing, Pind.
exchange, barter, traffic, Thuc.

(from Mid.) a transition, change, and in pl. changes, vicissitudes, Hdt., Eur.:—c. gen. change from a thing, μ. κακῶν Eur.; rarely change to . . , μ. ἀπραγμοσύνης Thuc.; but this is generally expressed by a prep., ἅμα τῇ μ. ἐς Ἕλληνας their going over to the Greeks, Hdt.; ἡ ἐναντία μ. change to the contrary, Thuc.
μ. τῆς ἡμέρης an eclipse, Hdt.
μ. πολιτείας change of government, a revolution, Thuc.
as military term, a wheeling about, Polyb.; metaph. of a speaker, Aeschin.

div1.head: μεταβουλεύω
div1.sense: to alter oneʼs plans, change oneʼs mind, Od.; but commonly as Dep. μεταβουλεύομαι, Hdt., Eur.; μετ. στράτευμα μὴ ἄγειν ἐπὶ τὴν Ἑλλάδα to change oneʼs mind and not march, Hdt.

div1.head: μετάβουλος
div1.sense: changing oneʼs mind, changeful, Ar.

div1.head: μετάγγελος
div1.sense: a messenger between two parties, Lat. internuncius, -cia, of Iris, Il.

div1.head: Μεταγειτνιών
div1.sense: Metageitnion, the second month of the Athen. year, the latter half of August and first of September, so called because then people flitted and changed their neighbours.

div1.head: μεταγιγνώσκω
div1.sense: to change oneʼs mind, to repent, Hdt., Attic
c. acc. rei, to change oneʼs mind about a thing, to repent of, μετέγνων τὰ πρόσθʼ εἰρημένα Eur.; μ. τὰ προδεδογμένα to alter or repeal a previous decree, Thuc.
c. inf. to change oneʼs mind so as to do something different, Thuc.; μετ. ὡς . . , to change oneʼs mind and think that . . , Xen.

div1.head: μετάγνοια
div1.sense: repentance, remorse, Soph.

div1.head: μετάγνωσις
div1.sense: change of mind or purpose, Hdt., Dem.

div1.head: μεταγράφω
div1.sense: to write differently, to alter or correct what one has written, Eur., Thuc.; in a trial, to alter the record, Dem.
to translate, Luc.: Mid., τὰς ἐπιστολὰς μεταγραψάμενοι having got them translated, Thuc.
to transcribe, Luc.

div1.head: μετάγω
div1.sense: to convey from one place to another: metaph., τὴν ψυχὴν ἐς εὐφροσύνην Anth.
intr. to go by another route, change oneʼs course, Xen.

div1.head: μεταδαίνυμαι
div1.sense: Dep. to share the feast with another, c. dat., Hom.:— to partake of a thing, c. gen., Il.

div1.head: μεταδετέος
div1.sense: one must untie, Xen.

div1.head: μεταδήμιος
div1.sense: in the midst of or among the people, in the country, Od.

div1.head: μεταδιαιτάω
div1.sense: to change oneʼs way of life, Luc.

div1.head: μεταδίδωμι
div1.sense: to give part of, give a share of a thing, c. gen., Theogn., Hdt., Attic
the part given is sometimes expressed, μ. τὸ τριτημόριόν τινι Hdt.; μ. τὸ μέρος Xen.

div1.head: μεταδίωκτος
div1.sense: pursued, overtaken, Hdt.

div1.head: μεταδιώκω
div1.sense: to follow closely after, pursue, c. acc., Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: μεταδοκέω
div1.sense: to change oneʼs opinion:—mostly impers., δείσασα μή σφι μεταδόξῃ in fear lest they should change their mind, Hdt.; c. acc. et inf., μετέδοξέ σοι ταῦτα βελτίω εἶναι you changed your mind and thought that this was better, Luc.:—part., μεταδόξαν when they changed their mind, Dem.; and in Pass., μεταδεδογμένον μοι μὴ στρατεύεσθαι since I have changed my mind and resolved not to march, Hdt.

div1.head: μεταδοξάζω
div1.sense: to change oneʼs opinion, Plat.

div1.head: μεταδόρπιος
div1.sense: in the middle of supper, during supper, Od.
after supper, Anth.

div1.head: μετάδοσις
div1.sense: the giving a share, imparting, Xen.
exchange of commodities, Arist.
a contribution, Plut.

div1.head: μεταδοτέος
div1.sense: one must give a share, τινί τινος Plat., Xen.

div1.head: μετάδουπος
div1.sense: falling at haphazard, Hes.

div1.head: μεταδρομάδην
div1.sense: adv. running after, following close upon, Il.

div1.head: μεταδρομή
div1.sense: a running after, pursuit, Eur., Xen.

div1.head: μετάδρομος
div1.sense: running after, taking vengeance for a thing, c. gen., Soph.

div1.head: μέταζε
div1.sense: afterwards, in the rear, Hes.

div1.head: μεταζεύγνυμι
div1.sense: to put to another carriage, Xen.

div1.head: μετάθεσις
div1.sense: transposition, Dem.
change of sides or opinions, amendment, Polyb.
a power of changing, Thuc.

div1.head: μεταθέω
div1.sense: to run after, chase, Xen., etc.
to hunt or range over, τὰ ὄρη Xen.: absol. to hunt about, range, Xen.

div1.head: μεταΐζω
div1.sense: to seat oneself with or beside, Od.

div1.head: μεταίρω
div1.sense: to lift up and remove, to shift, Eur.; ψήφισμα μ. repeal a decree, Dem.
intr. to depart, NTest.

div1.head: μεταΐσσω
div1.sense: to rush after, rush upon an enemy, Hom.
μ. τινά to follow him closely, Pind.

div1.head: μεταιτέω
div1.sense: to demand oneʼs share of a thing, c. gen., Hdt.: also μεταιτεῖν μέρος τινός Ar.:—absol., μ. παρά τινος Dem.
to beg of, ask alms of, c. acc. pers., Ar.
to beg, solicit, Luc.

div1.head: μεταίτης
div1.sense: a beggar, Luc.

div1.head: μεταίτιος
div1.sense: c. gen. rei, being in part the cause of a thing, accessory to it, c. gen., Hdt., Attic: —c. dat. pers., θεοὺς τοὺς ἐμοὶ μεταιτίους νόστου who were accessory to my return, Aesch.

div1.head: μεταίχμιος
div1.sense: between two armies:—as Subst. μεταίχμιον, ου, τό, the space between two armies, Hdt., Eur.; ἐν μεταιχμίοις δορός Eur.
a disputed frontier, debateable land, Hdt.:—metaph., ἐν μεταιχμίῳ σκότου in the border-land between light and darkness, Aesch.
what is midway between, c. gen., ἀνὴρ γυνή τε χὤτι τῶν μεταίχμιον Aesch.; πεδαίχμιοι λαμπάδες hanging in mid air, Aesch.

div1.head: μετακαθέζομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to change oneʼs seat, Luc.

div1.head: μετακαινίζω
div1.sense: to model anew, Anth.

div1.head: μετακαλέω
div1.sense: to call away to another place, Aeschin.: to call back, recall, Thuc.
in Mid. to call in a physician, Luc.

div1.head: μετακιάθω
div1.sense: to follow after, absol., Il.: c. acc. to chase, Τρῶας μετεκίαθε Il.
to go to visit, Αἰθίοπας μετεκίαθε Od.

div1.head: μετακινέω
div1.sense: to transpose, shift, remove, Hdt.:— Mid. to go from one place to another, Hdt.
to change, alter, τὴν πολιτείαν Dem.

div1.head: μετακινητέος
div1.sense: to be removed, Luc.

div1.head: μετακινητός
div1.sense: to be disturbed, Thuc.

div1.head: μετακλαίω
div1.sense: to weep afterwards or too late, Il.:—Mid. to lament after or next, Eur.

div1.head: μετακλίνω
div1.sense: Pass. to shift to the other side, Il.

div1.head: μετακοιμίζομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to change to a state of sleep, to be lulled to sleep, Aesch.

div1.head: μετάκοινος
div1.sense: sharing in common, partaking, Aesch.; τινι with another, Aesch.

div1.head: μετακομίζω
div1.sense: to transport, Plat.:—Mid. to cause to be carried over, Lycurg.

div1.head: μετακυλίνδω
div1.sense: to roll to another place, to roll over, Ar.

div1.head: μετακύμιος
div1.sense: between the waves, ἄτας μ. between two waves of misery, i. e. bringing a short lull or pause from misery, Eur.

div1.head: μεταλαγχάνω
div1.sense: to have a share of a thing allotted one, c. gen., Plat.; also, μ. μέρος τινός Eur.

div1.head: μεταλαμβάνω
div1.sense: to have or get a share of, to partake of a thing, c. gen., Hdt., etc.:—Mid., μεταλαμβάνεσθαί τινος to get possession of, lay claim to, Hdt.
the part received is sometimes added in acc., μ. μοῖραν or μέρος τινός Eur., etc.; μ. τὸ πέμπτον μέρος τῶν ψήφων Plat.
c. gen. pers. to share his society, Xen.: in bad sense, to lay hold of, accuse, Ar.
to take after another, to succeed to, c. acc., Xen.
to take in exchange, substitute, πόλεμον ἀντʼ εἰρήνης Thuc.; μ. τὰ ἐπιτηδεύματα to adopt new customs, Thuc.; ἱμάτια μ. Xen.
to interchange, Plat.

div1.head: μεταλήγω
div1.sense: to leave off, cease from, c. gen., Il.

div1.head: μετάληψις
div1.sense: participation, Plat.; τινος in a thing, Il.

div1.head: μεταλλαγή
div1.sense: change, μ. τῆς ἡμέρης an eclipse, Hdt.; ἐν μεταλλαγῇ πολυμηχάνου ἀνδρός by having a crafty man for thy master instead [of me], Soph.
c. gen. objecti, μ. πολέμου a change from war, Xen.

div1.head: μεταλλακτός
div1.sense: changed, altered, Aesch.

div1.head: μεταλλάσσω
div1.sense: to change, alter, Hdt.
to exchange,
to take in exchange, adopt, assume, ὀρνίθων φύσιν Ar.; so, μ. τόπον, χώραν to go into a new country, Plat.
to exchange by leaving, to quit, μ. τὸν βίον Isocr.; so, μεταλλάσσειν alone, Plat.
intr. to undergo a change, Hdt.

div1.head: μετάλλατος
div1.sense: to be searched out, Pind.

div1.head: μεταλλάω
div1.sense: properly, to search after other things (μετὰ ἄλλα, cf. μέταλλον) , to search carefully, to inquire diligently, Od.
c. acc. pers. to inquire of, question, Hom.
c. acc. objecti, to ask about or after, Hom.; so, μεταλλῆσαι ἀμφὶ πόσει Od.
c. dupl. acc. to ask one about a thing, ask him a thing, Od.

div1.head: μεταλλεία
div1.sense: a searching for metals and the like, mining, Plat.

div1.head: μεταλλευτής
div1.sense: one who searches for metals, a miner, Strab.

div1.head: μεταλλευτικός
div1.sense: skilled in searching for metals: ἡ -κή (sc. τέχνη) the art of mining, Arist.

div1.head: μεταλλεύω
div1.sense: to get by mining:—Pass. to be got by mining, of metals, Plat., etc.
generally, to explore, Anth.

div1.head: μεταλλικός
div1.sense: of or for mines, Dem.

div1.head: μέταλλον
div1.sense: a mine or quarry, ἁλὸς μέταλλον a salt- pit, salt- mine, Hdt.; χρύσεα καὶ ἀργύρεα μέταλλα gold and silver mines, Hdt.; μέταλλα (alone) silver mines, Xen.; μαρμάρου μ. marble quarries, Strab.
the sense of metal, Lat. metallum, does not occur in classical Greek.
div1.etym: Prob., like μεταλλάω, from μετʼ ἄλλα, a search for other things.

div1.head: μεταμαίομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to search after, chase, Pind.

div1.head: μεταμανθάνω
div1.sense: to learn differently, μετ. γλῶσσαν to unlearn one language and learn another instead, Hdt.; μ. ὕμνον to learn a new strain, Aesch.
to learn to forget, unlearn, Lat. dediscere, Aeschin.
absol. to learn better, Ar.

div1.head: μεταμείβω
div1.sense: to exchange, ἐσλὸν πήματος good for ill, Pind.
to change to another form, ἐκ βοὸς μετάμειβε γυναῖκα Mosch.
γᾶν τέκνοις μ. to hand down land to children, Eur.
Mid. to change oneʼs condition, to escape, Pind.; μεταμειβόμενοι in turns. Pind.
c. acc., μ. τί τινι to change one thing for another, Eur.

div1.head: μεταμέλει
div1.sense: impers. it repents me, rues me, Lat. poenitet me:—Construction:
c. dat. pers. et gen. rei, μεταμέλει σοι τῆς δωρεᾶς Xen.
oftener, the thing one repents of is in part. agreeing with the dat., μεταμέλει μοι οὕτως ἀπολογησαμένῳ I repent of having so defended myself, Plat.
absol., μ. μοι it repents me, Ar.; ξυνέβη ὑμῖν πεισθῆναι μὲν ἀκεραίοις, μεταμέλειν δὲ κακουμένοις to adopt a measure when your forces are unbroken, and to repent when in distress, Thuc.
part. neut. μεταμέλον absol., since it repented him, Plat.
seldom with a nom., to cause repentance or sorrow, τῷ Ἀρίστωνι μετέμελε τὸ εἰρημένον (for τοῦ εἰρημένου) Hdt., ; οἶμαί σοι ταῦτα μεταμελήσει (for τούτων) Ar.
Dep., to feel repentance, to rue, regret, c. part., μετεμέλοντο οὐ δεξάμενοι they repented that they had not received, Thuc.: absol. to change oneʼs purpose or line of conduct, Xen.
Causal in part. fut. τὸ μεταμελησόμενον that which will cause regret, matter for future repentance, Xen.

div1.head: μεταμέλεια
div1.sense: change of purpose, regret, repentance, Thuc.; μ. ἔχει με μεταμέλει μοι, Xen.

div1.head: μεταμελητικός
div1.sense: full of regrets, Arist.

div1.head: μετάμελος
div1.sense: repentance, regret, Thuc.

div1.head: μεταμέλπομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to sing or dance among others, c. dat., Hhymn.

div1.head: μεταμίσγω
div1.sense: to mix among, confound with, τί τινι Od.

div1.head: μεταμορφόω
div1.sense: to transform: Pass. to be transfigured, NTest.

div1.head: μεταμόρφωσις
div1.sense: a transformation, Luc.

div1.head: μεταμπίσχω
div1.sense: Mid., to put on a different dress, μ. δουλείαν to put on the new dress of slavery, Plat.

div1.head: μεταμφιάζω
div1.sense: to change the dress of another, strip off his dress, τινά Plut., Luc.:—metaph. to change, τι εἴς τι Anth.; ἀποδυσάμενος τὸν Πυθαγόραν τίνα μετημφιάσω μετʼ αὐτόν; what body didst thou assume after him? Luc.

div1.head: μεταμώνιος
div1.sense: borne by the wind, τὰ δὲ πάντα θεοὶ μετ. θεῖεν may the gods give all that to the winds, Il.; ἐς κόρακας βαδιεῖ μεταμώνιος Ar.
bootless, vain, idle, μεταμώνια νήματα vainly-woven webs, Od.; μεταμώνια βάζειν to talk idly, Od.

div1.head: μεταναγιγνώσκομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to repent of a thing, c. gen., Soph.

div1.head: μεταναιετάω
div1.sense: to dwell with, τινί Hhymn.

div1.head: μεταναιέτης
div1.sense: one who dwells with, Hes.

div1.head: μετανάστασις
div1.sense: migration, Thuc.

div1.head: μετανάστης
div1.sense: one who has changed his home, a wanderer, immigrant, commonly as a term of reproach, like Scottish land-louper, Il.

div1.head: μετανάστιος
div1.sense: wandering, Anth.

div1.head: μετανάστρια
div1.sense: a wanderer (planet as opposed to star, see μετανάστης LSJ), Anth.

div1.head: μετανίσομαι
div1.sense: to pass over to the other side, Ἠέλιος μετενίσσετο the sun was passing over the meridian, Hom.
c. acc. to go after, pursue, Eur.: also to win, get possession of, Pind.

div1.head: μετανίστημι
div1.sense: to remove one from his country, Polyb.
Pass. c. aor2 et perf. act. to move off and go elsewhere, to migrate, Hdt., Soph.

div1.head: μετανοέω
div1.sense: to change oneʼs mind or purpose, Plat., Xen.
to repent, Antipho., etc.

div1.head: μετάνοια
div1.sense: after-thought, repentance, Thuc., etc.

div1.head: μεταντλέω
div1.sense: to draw from one vessel into another, Anth.

div1.head: μεταξύ
div1.sense: adv.,
of Place, betwixt, between, Il., etc.; with the Art., τὸ μεταξύ Hdt.; ἐν τῷ μ. Thuc.
of Time, between-whiles, meanwhile, Hdt., etc; with pres. part., μεταξὺ ὀρύσσων in the midst of his digging, Lat. inter fodiendum, Hdt.; μ. θύων Ar.; λέγοντα μ. in the middle of his discourse, Plat.
after, afterwards, NTest.
of Qualities, τὰ μ. intermediate, i. e. neither good nor bad, Plat.
as prep. with gen. between, Hdt., etc.
of Time, ὁ μ. τῆς δίκης τε καὶ τοῦ θανάτου χρόνος Plat.; τὰ μ. τούτου meanwhile, Soph.

div1.head: μεταπαιδεύω
div1.sense: to educate differently, Luc.

div1.head: μεταπαύομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to rest between-whiles, Il.

div1.head: μεταπαυσωλή
div1.sense: rest between-whiles, πολέμοιο from war, Il.

div1.head: μεταπείθω
div1.sense: to change a manʼs persuasion, Ar., Dem.:—Pass. to be persuaded to change, Plat., etc.

div1.head: μετά

trans.i: in the midst of, among with gen., dat., and acc.

div1.sense: Prep. with gen., dat., and acc.
WITH GEN. in the midst of, among a number, μετʼ ἄλλων ἑταίρων Od.; πολλῶν μετὰ δούλων Aesch.
in common, along with, μετὰ Βοιωτῶν ἐμάχοντο Il.; μ. ξυμμάχων κινδυνεύειν Thuc.; μετά τινος πάσχειν, στῆναι Aesch., Soph.
with, by means of, ἱκετεύειν μετὰ δακρύων Plat.; μετʼ ἀρετῆς πρωτεύειν Xen.:—as a periphr. for Adverbs, ὁσίως καὶ μετʼ ἀληθείας Plat.
WITH DAT., only poet., mostly Epic,
properly of persons, among, in company with, μετὰ τριτάτοισιν ἄνασσεν in or among the third generation Nestor reigned, Il.
of things, μετὰ νηυσί, ἀστράσι among, in the midst of, Hom.; μετὰ πνοιῇς ἀνέμοιο in company with the winds, as swift as they, Hom.
between, μετὰ χερσὶν ἔχειν to hold between, i. e. in, the hands, Il.; μετὰ φρεσίν Il.
to complete a number, with, besides, πέμπτος μετὰ τοῖσιν a fifth with them, Hom.;—N. B., μετά is never used with dat. sg., unless of collective Nouns, μετὰ στρατῷ Il.
WITH ACCUS.,
of motion, into the middle of coming among a number, μετὰ φῦλα θεῶν Hom.; μετὰ λαὸν Ἀχαιῶν Il.

in pursuit or quest of, βῆναι μετὰ Νέστορα Il.; in hostile sense. βῆναι μετά τινα to go after, pursue him, Il.;—also, βῆναι μετὰ πατρὸς ἀκουήν to go in search of news of thy father, Od.; πόλεμον μέτα θωρήσσοντο they were arming for the battle, Il.
of mere sequence or succession,
of Place, after, next after, behind, λαοὶ ἕπονθʼ ὡσεὶ μετὰ κτίλον ἕσπετο μῆλα as sheep follow after the bell-wether, Il.
of Time, after, next to, μεθʼ Ἕκτορα πότμος ἑτοῖμος after Hector thy death is at the door, Il.; μετὰ ταῦτα thereupon, thereafter, Attic; μεθʼ ἡμέραν in the course of the day, Hdt.
of Worth, Rank, next to, next after, following a Sup., κάλλιστος ἀνὴρ μετʼ ἀμύμονα Πηλείωνα Il.
after, according to, μετὰ σὸν καὶ ἐμὸν κῆρ as you and I wish, Il.; μετʼ ὔλμον by the line of the furrow, Il.
generally, among, between, as with dat., μετὰ πάντας ἄριστος best among all, Il.; μετὰ χεῖρας ἔχειν Hdt.
absol. as ADV. among them, with them, Il.
and then, next afterwards, thereafter, Hom., Hdt.
μέτα for μέτεστι, Od., etc.
IN COMPOS:
of community or participation, as μεταδίδωμι, μετέχω, c. gen. rei.
of action in common with another, as μεταδαίνυμαι, c. dat. pers.
of an interval, as μεταίχμιον.
of succession, as μεταδόρπιος.
of pursuit, as μετέρχομαι.
of letting go, as μεθίημι.
after, behind, as μετάφρενον.
back again, reversely, as μετατρέπω, μεταστρέφω.
most often of change of place, condition, plan, etc., as μεταβαίνω, μεταβουλεύω, etc.

div1.head: μεταβαίνω
div1.sense: to pass over from one place to another, μετὰ δʼ ἄστρα βεβήκει ( for μετεβεβήκει) the stars had passed over the meridian, Od.; μ. ἐς τὴν Ἀσίην Hdt.: to go over to the other side, Aesch.
to pass from one point to another, μετάβηθι change thy theme, Od.; μεταβάντες changing their course, turning round, Hdt.; μ. ἐκ μείζονος εἰς ἔλαττον Plat.
c. acc., μεταβὰς βίοτον having passed to another life, Eur.
Causal in aor1 μεταβῆσαι, to carry over, to change, Eur.

div1.head: μεταβάλλω
div1.sense: to throw into a different position, to turn quickly, μετὰ νῶτα βαλών Il.; μ. θοἰμάτιον ἐπὶ δεξιάν to throw oneʼs mantle over to the right, Ar.
to turn about, change, alter, Hdt., Attic; μ. ὕδατα to drink different water, Hdt.:— μ. ὀργάς to change, i. e. give up, anger, Eur.
intr. to undergo a change, change oneʼs condition, Hdt., Plat.

to change oneʼs course, μεταβαλὼν πρὸς Ἀθηναίους changing his course and turning to the Athenians, Hdt.:—the part. μεταβάλλων or μεταβαλών is used absol., almost like an adv. instead, in turn, Hdt., Eur.
Mid. to change what is oneʼs own, etc. μ. ἱμάτια to change oneʼs clothes, Xen.; μ. τοὺς τρόπους Ar., etc.
to change one with another, exchange, μ. σιγὰν λόγων to exchange silence for words, Soph.: — to barter, traffic, Xen.
to turn oneself, turn about, Plat.:— to change oneʼs purpose, change sides, Hdt., Thuc.
to turn or wheel about, Xen.

div1.head: μεταβάπτω
div1.sense: to change by dipping, Plut., Luc.

div1.head: μεταπεμπτέος
div1.sense: to be sent for, Thuc.

div1.head: μετάπεμπτος
div1.sense: sent for, Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: μεταπέμπω
div1.sense: to send after, Eur., Ar.:— to send for, summon, Lat. arcessere, Hdt., etc.; so in Med: —Pass., aor1 μεταπεμφθῆναι to be sent for, Dem.

div1.head: μεταπέταμαι
div1.sense: Dep. to fly to another place, fly away, Luc.

div1.head: μεταπηδάω
div1.sense: to leap from one place to another, jump about, Luc.

div1.head: μεταπίπτω
div1.sense: to fall differently, undergo a change, μ. τὸ εἶδος Hdt., or εἰς ἄλλο εἶδος Plat.: also, to change oneʼs opinion suddenly, Eur., Ar.; εἰ τρεῖς μόναι μετέπεσον τῶν ψήφων Plat.
to change, esp. for the worse, μεταπίπτοντος δαίμονος if fortune changes, Eur.; rarely for the better, Eur.:—of political changes, to undergo change or revolution, Thuc.

div1.head: μεταπλάσσω
div1.sense: to mould differently, remodel, Plat.; so in Mid., Anth.

div1.head: μεταποιέω
div1.sense: to alter the make of a thing, remodel, alter, Solon., Dem.
Mid. to make a pretence of, lay claim to, pretend to, c. gen., ἀρετῆς Thuc.

div1.head: μεταπορεύομαι
div1.sense: Dep.
to go after, follow up, ἔχθραν Lys.
to pursue, punish, Polyb.

div1.head: μετάπρασις
div1.sense: a selling by retail, retail-trade, Strab.

div1.head: μεταπρεπής
div1.sense: distinguished among others, c. dat. pl., Il.

div1.head: μεταπρέπω
div1.sense: to distinguish oneself or be distinguished among others, c. dat. pl., Hom.

div1.head: μετάπτωσις
div1.sense: change, Plat.: change of party, Polyb.

div1.head: μεταπύργιον
div1.sense: the wall between two towers, the curtain, Thuc.

div1.head: μεταρίθμιος
div1.sense: counted among others, c. dat. pl., Hhymn.

div1.head: μεταρρέω
div1.sense: to flow differently, to change to and fro, ebb and flow, Arist.

div1.head: μεταρρίπτω
div1.sense: to turn upside down, Dem.

div1.head: μεταρρυθμίζω
div1.sense: to change the fashion of a thing, to remodel, Hdt., Aesch.:— to reform, amend, Xen.

div1.head: μεταρσιόω
div1.sense: Mid.-Pass. to rise, be lifted, high into the air, νέφος μεταρσιωθέν Hdt.,

div1.head: μετάρσιος
div1.sense: raised from the ground, high in air, Lat. sublimis, Trag.; λόγοι πεδάρσιοι scattered to the winds, Aesch.; ναῦς ἄρμενʼ ἔχοισα μετάρσια a ship having her sails hoisted, Theocr.
like μετέωρος II. 2, on the high sea, out at sea, Hdt.
metaph. in air, high above this world, Eur.
of things, airy, empty, Eur.
in Medic., of the breath, high, quick.

div1.head: μετασεύομαι
div1.sense: Pass.:— to rush towards or after, Il.:— c. acc. to rush upon, μετέσσυτο ποιμένα λαῶν Il.

div1.head: μετασκευάζω
div1.sense: to put into another dress (σκευή) , to change the fashion of, transform, Xen.
Mid. to pack up so as to shift oneʼs quarters, Luc.

div1.head: μετασπάω
div1.sense: to draw over from one side to another, Soph.

div1.head: μέτασσα
div1.sense: lambs born midway between the πρόγονοι (early-born) and the ἕρσαι (freshlings or lateborn).

div1.head: μετάστασις
div1.sense: a removing, removal, κακοῦ Andoc.
(μεθίσταμαι) a being put into a different place, removal, migration, Plat.; μ. ἡλίου an eclipse, Eur.
a changing, change, Eur.; θυμῷ μετάστασιν διδόναι to allow a change to oneʼs wrath, i. e. suffer it to cease, Soph.
a change of political constitution, revolution, Thuc.

div1.head: μεταστατέος
div1.sense: one must alter, Isocr.

div1.head: μεταστείχω
div1.sense: to go in quest of, τινά Eur.

div1.head: μεταστέλλω
div1.sense: Mid., to send for, summon, Luc.

div1.head: μεταστένω
div1.sense: only in pres. and imperf., to lament afterwards, Od., Aesch.
to lament after this or next, Eur.

div1.head: μεταστοιχεί
div1.sense: adv. all in a row, Il.

div1.head: μεταστοναχίζομαι
div1.sense: to sigh or lament afterwards, Hes.

div1.head: μεταστρατοπεδεύω
div1.sense: to shift oneʼs ground or camp, Polyb.:—so in Mid., Xen.

div1.head: μεταστρεπτικός
div1.sense: fit for turning another way, fit for directing, Plat.

div1.head: μεταστρέφω
div1.sense: to turn about, turn round, turn, Il., Ar.:—Pass. to turn oneself about, turn about, whether to face the enemy or to flee, Il.; then, simply, to turn round, Hdt., Plat.
to pervert, change, alter, Plat., etc.:—Pass., τἀμὰ μετεστράφη my fortunes are changed, Eur.; τὸ ψήφισμʼ ὅπως μεταστραφείη Ar.
intr. to turn another way, change oneʼs ways, Il.; μεταστρέψας contrariwise, Plat.
c. gen. to care for, regard, Eur.

div1.head: μεταστροφή
div1.sense: a turning from one thing to another, Plat.

div1.head: μετάσχεσις
div1.sense: participation, τινος in the nature of a thing, Plat.

div1.head: μετασχηματίζω
div1.sense: to change the form of a person or thing, Plat.
to transfer as in a figure, NTest.

div1.head: μετατάσσω
div1.sense: to transpose: Mid. to change oneʼs order of battle, Xen.; μετατάσσεσθαι παρʼ Ἀθηναίους to go over and join them, Thuc.

div1.head: μετατίθημι
div1.sense: to place among, τῷ κʼ οὔτι τόσον κέλαδον μετέθηκεν (variant reading: μεθέηκεν) then he would not have caused so much noise among us, Od.
to place differently,
in local sense, to transpose, Plat.
to change, alter, of a treaty, Thuc., Xen.; μ. τὰς ἐπωνυμίας ἐπὶ ὑός to change their names and call them after swine, Hdt.; μ. τι ἀντί τινος to put one thing in place of another, substitute, Dem.
Mid. to change what is oneʼs own or for oneself, τοὺς νόμους, Xen.; μετατίθεσθαι τὴν γνώμην to adopt a new opinion, Hdt.; so, absol., Plat.
μ. τὸν φόβον to get rid of, transfer oneʼs fear, Dem.
c. dupl. acc., τὸ κείνων κακὸν τῷδε κέρδος μ. to alter their evil designs into gain for him, Soph.
Pass. to be changed, to alter, Eur.

div1.head: μετατίκτω
div1.sense: to bring forth afterwards, Aesch.

div1.head: μετατρέπω
div1.sense: Mid., to turn oneself round, turn round, Il.
to look back to, shew regard for, c. gen., Il.

div1.head: μετατρέχω
div1.sense: to run after, οὔκουν παρʼ Ἀθηναίων σὺ μεταθρέξει; you run and get it from the Athenians, Ar.

div1.head: μετατροπαλίζομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to turn about, il.

div1.head: μετατροπή
div1.sense: retribution, vengeance for a thing, c. gen., Eur.

div1.head: μετατροπία
div1.sense: a turn of fortune, a reverse, Pind.

div1.head: μετάτροπος
div1.sense: turning about, returning, Anth.
turning round upon, Aesch.; ἔργα μετάτροπα deeds that turn upon their author or are visited with vengeance, Hes.; so, μ. αὖραι Eur.; πολέμου μετάτροπος αὔρα Ar.

div1.head: μεταυγάζω
div1.sense: to look keenly about for, τινά Pind.

div1.head: μεταυδάω
div1.sense: to speak among others, to address them, c. dat. pl., Hom.
c. acc. pers. to accost, address, Mosch.

div1.head: μεταῦθις
div1.sense: afterwards, Hdt., Aesch.

div1.head: μεταυτίκα
div1.sense: just after, presently after, Hdt.

div1.head: μεταφέρω
div1.sense: to carry over, transfer, Dem.; μ. κέντρα πώλοις to apply the goad to the horses in turn, Eur.
to change, alter, Soph., Dem.; μ. τὰ δίκαια to change, confound, Aeschin.
in Rhetoric, to use a word in a changed sense, to employ a metaphor, Arist.

div1.head: μετάφημι
div1.sense: to speak among others, to address them, c. dat. pl., Hom.
c. acc. pers. to accost, Il.

div1.head: μεταφορικός
div1.sense: apt at metaphors, Arist.
metaphorical: adv. -κῶς, Plut.

div1.head: μεταφράζω
div1.sense: to paraphrase, to translate, Plut.
Mid. to consider after, ταῦτα μεταφρασόμεσθα καὶ αὖτις Il.

div1.head: μετάφρασις
div1.sense: a paraphrasing, Plut.

div1.head: μετάφρενον
div1.sense: properly, the part behind the midriff (μετά τὰς φρένας) , the back, Il., Plat.

div1.head: μεταφωνέω
div1.sense: to speak among others, c. dat. pl., Il.

div1.head: μεταχειρίζω
div1.etym: sometimes active, but more commonly as Dep.
div1.sense: to have or take in hand, handle, administer, manage, Hdt.
to manage, arrange, conduct, Thuc.:—so as Dep., Ar., Xen.
to practise, pursue an art or study, Plat.; c. inf. to study to do, Plat.
c. acc. pers. to handle, treat, or deal with in a certain way, χαλεπῶς τινὰ μεταχειρίζειν Thuc.:—of a physician, Plat.

div1.head: μεταχρόνιος
div1.sense: happening afterwards, Luc.
in Hes. = μετάρσιος.

div1.head: μετάχρονος
div1.sense: after the time, done later, Luc.

div1.head: μεταχωρέω
div1.sense: to go to another place, to withdraw, migrate, emigrate, Aesch., Thuc.

div1.head: μεταψαίρω
div1.sense: to brush against a thing, c. acc., Eur.

div1.head: μετεγγράφω
div1.sense: to put upon a new register: 3 sg. fut. 2 pass. μετεγγραφήσεται he will be put on a new register, Ar.

div1.head: μέτειμι
div1.sense: to be among, c. dat. pl., Hom.; absol., οὐ παυσωλὴ μετέσσεται no interval of rest will be mine, Il.
impers., μέτεστί μοί τινος I have a share in or claim to a thing, Hdt., Attic:—so part. neut. used absol., οὐδὲν Αἰολεῦσι μετεὸν τῆς χώρης since the Aeolians had no share in the land, Hdt.
sometimes the share is added in nom., μέτεστι πᾶσι τὸ ἴσον Thuc.; ἐμοὶ τούτων οὐδὲν μ. Plat.

div1.head: μέτειμι
div1.sense: to go between or among others, Il.
to go after or behind, follow, Il., Xen.
c. acc. to go after, go in quest of, pursue, Hdt., Attic
to pursue with vengeance, Aesch., Thuc.; δίκας μ. τινα (where δίκας is acc. cogn.), to execute judgment upon one, Aesch.
to pursue, go about a business, Eur.
μ. τινὰ θυσίαις to approach one with sacrifices, Hdt.: c. acc. et inf., ἕνα ἕκαστον μετῄεσαν μὴ ἐπιτρέπειν besought each one not to permit, Thuc.
to pass over to another, Ar.

div1.head: μετεῖπον
div1.sense: to speak among others address them, c. dat. pl., Hom.
absol. to speak thereafter, afterwards, Hom.

div1.head: μετεκβαίνω
div1.sense: to go from one place into another, Hdt.; c. acc., μ. φθόγγον to pass from one note to another, Anth.

div1.head: μετεκδίδωμι
div1.sense: to lend out, Plut.

div1.head: μετεκδύομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to pull off oneʼs own clothes and put on others, to assume, Plut.

div1.head: μετελευστέος
div1.sense: one must punish, Luc.

div1.head: μετεμβαίνω
div1.sense: to go on board another ship, Plut.

div1.head: μετεμβιβάζω
div1.sense: Causal of μετ-εμβαίνω, to put on board another ship, Thuc.

div1.head: μετέμφυτος
div1.sense: engrafted afresh, Anth.

div1.head: μετενδύω
div1.sense: Causal in aor1, to put other clothes on a person, invest with new power, τινά τι, Luc.
Pass. μετενδύομαι, with aor2 act. μετενέδῡν, to put on other clothes, Strab.

div1.head: μετεννέπω
div1.sense: to speak among, τινί Mosch.

div1.head: μετεντίθημι
div1.sense: to put into another place: Mid., μετεντίθεσθαι τὸν γόμον to shift a shipʼs cargo, Dem.

div1.head: μετεξαιρέομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to take out of and put elsewhere, Dem.

div1.head: μετεξανίσταμαι
div1.sense: Pass. to move from one place to another, Luc.

div1.head: μετεξέτεροι
div1.sense: some among many, certain persons, Hdt.

div1.head: μετέπειτα
div1.sense: afterwards, thereafter, Hom.

div1.head: μετέρχομαι
div1.etym: in Attic, the imperf. and fut. are borrowed from μέτειμι, q. v.
div1.sense: to come or go among others, c. dat. pl. or absol., Hom.; μετελθών having gone between the ranks, Il.
to go to another place, Il.: simply to come next, follow, Pind.
c. acc. to go after, to go to seek, go in quest of Il., Attic: generally, to seek for, aim at, Eur., Thuc.
in hostile sense, to pursue, Il., Hdt., Attic: c. acc. rei, to seek to avenge, Aesch., Eur.:—then c. dupl. acc. pers. et rei, μ. τι τινά to visit a crime upon a person, Eur.
of things, to go after, attend to, to pursue a business, Hom., Attic
to approach with prayers, Lat. adire, prosequi, τινα Hdt., Eur.: to court or woo, Pind.

div1.head: μετεύχομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to change oneʼs wish, to wish something else, Eur.

div1.head: μετέχω
div1.sense: to partake of, enjoy a share of, share in, take part in, c. gen. rei, Theogn., Aesch.; c. gen. pers. to partake of a personʼs friendship, Xen.; μ. τῶν πεντακισχιλίων to be members of the 5000 in turn, Thuc.:— with dat. pers. added, μετ. τινός τινι to partake of something in common with another, Pind., Eur.:— often the part or share is added, μ. τάφου μέρος Aesch., etc.
rarely with the acc. only, ἀκερδῆ χάριν μ. Soph.
absol., οἱ μετέχοντες the partners, Hdt.

div1.head: μετεωρίζω
div1.sense: to raise to a height, raise, Thuc.:—Mid., δελφῖνας μετεωρίζου heave up your dolphins (v. δελφίς II), Ar.:—Pass. to be raised up, to float in mid-air, Lat. suspendi, Ar., etc.: of ships, to keep out on the high sea, Thuc.
metaph. to lift up, buoy up with false hopes, Dem.:—Pass. to be elevated, excited, Ar.

div1.head: μετεωροκοπέω
div1.sense: to prate about high things, Ar.

div1.head: μετεωρολέσχης
div1.sense: one who prates on things above, a star-gazer, visionary, Plat.

div1.head: μετεωρολογέω
div1.sense: to talk of high things, Plat.

div1.head: μετεωρολογία
div1.sense: discussion of high things, Plat.

div1.head: μετεωρολόγος
div1.sense: one who talks of the heavenly bodies, an astronomer, Plat.

div1.head: μετεωροσκόπος
div1.sense: a star-gazer, Plat.

div1.head: μετεωροσοφιστής
div1.sense: an astrological sophist, Ar.

div1.head: μετέωρος
div1.sense: raised from the ground, hanging, Lat. suspensus, Hdt.;—of high ground, Thuc.

like μετάρσιος, in mid-air, high in air, Lat. sublimis, Hdt., Ar.; Ἀήρ, ὃς ἔχεις τὴν γῆν μ. poised on high, Ar.; τὰ μ. χωρία the regions of air, Ar.; τὰ μ. things in heaven above, astronomical phenomena, Ar., Plat.
on the high sea, out at sea, of ships, Thuc.
metaph. of the mind, lifted up, buoyed up, on the tiptoe of expectation, in suspense, Lat. spe erectus, Thuc.
wavering, uncertain, Dem.: —adv., μετεώρως ἔχειν to be in uncertainty, Plut.

div1.head: μετεωροφέναξ
div1.sense: an astrological quack, Ar.

div1.head: μετηνέμιος
div1.sense: swift as wind, Anth.

div1.head: μετήορος
div1.sense: lifted off the ground, hanging, Il.:—Doric πεδάορος Aesch.
metaph. wavering, thoughtless, Hhymn.

div1.head: μετοικεσία
div1.sense: = μετοικία 1, Anth.:—the Removal or Captivity of the Jews, NTest.

div1.head: μετοικέω
div1.sense: to change oneʼs abode, remove to a place, c. acc. loci, Eur.:—c. dat. loci, to settle in, Pind.
absol. to be a μέτοικος or settler, reside in a foreign city, Eur., Ar., etc.

div1.head: μετοικία
div1.sense: change of abode, removal, migration, Thuc.
a settling as μέτοικος, settlement or residence in a foreign city, Aesch., etc.

div1.head: μετοικίζω
div1.sense: to lead settlers to another abode, Plut.

div1.head: μετοικικός
div1.sense: in the condition of a μέτοικος, Plut.: — τὸ μ. the list of μέτοικοι, Luc.

div1.head: μετοίκιον
div1.sense: the tax paid by the μέτοικοι, Plat.
μετοίκια, ων, τά, the feast of migration, Plut.

div1.head: μετοικισμός
div1.sense: emigration, Plut.

div1.head: μετοικιστής
div1.sense: an emigrant, Plut.

div1.head: μετοικοδομέω
div1.sense: to build differently, Plut.

div1.head: μέτοικος
div1.sense: changing oneʼs abode, emigrating and settling elsewhere, Hdt.
as Subst. μέτοικος, ὁ, ἡ, an alien settled in a foreign city, a settler, emigrant, sojourner, Aesch., etc.; μ. γῆς one who has settled in a country, Aesch.
at Athens, a resident alien, who paid a tax (μετοίκιον) , but enjoyed no civic rights, Thuc., etc.

div1.head: μετοικοφύλαξ
div1.sense: guardian of the μέτοικοι, Xen.

div1.head: μετοίχομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to have gone after, to have gone in quest of, c. acc. pers., Hom.: c. acc. rei, to seek for, Eur.
with hostile intent, to pursue, Il.
to have gone among or through, Od.

div1.head: μετοκλάζω
div1.sense: to keep changing from one knee to another, said of a coward crouching in ambush, Il.

div1.head: μετονομάζω
div1.sense: to call by a new name, αἰγίδας μετωνόμασαν called them by a new name— αἰγίδες, Hdt.:—Pass. to take or receive a new name, Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: μετόπισθε
div1.sense: of Place, from behind, backwards, back, Hom., Hes.
of Time, after, afterwards, Hom.
prep. with gen. behind, Hom.

div1.head: μετοπωρινός
div1.sense: autumnal, Thuc., Xen.:—neut. as adv., Hes. [Cf. ὀπωρινός.

div1.head: μετόπωρον
div1.sense: late autumn, Thuc.

div1.head: μετόρχιον
div1.sense: the space between rows of vines, Ar.

div1.head: μετουσία
div1.sense: participation, partnership, communion, τινός, in a thing, Ar., Dem.

div1.head: μετοχή
div1.sense: participation, communion, Hdt.

div1.head: μετοχλίζω
div1.sense: to remove by a lever, hoist a heavy body out of the way, Od.
to push back the bar, Il.

div1.head: μέτοχος
div1.sense: sharing in, partaking of, c. gen., Hdt., Eur.
as Subst. a partner, accomplice in, τοῦ φόνου Eur.; absol., Thuc.

div1.head: μετρέω
div1.sense: to measure in any way:
of Space, to measure, i. e. pass over, traverse, πέλαγος μέγα μετρήσασαν Od.:—Mid., ἅλα μετρήσασθαι Mosch.

in the common sense, to measure, Lat. metiri, τὴν γῆν σταδίοισι Hdt.; τῆι γαστρὶ μ. τὴν εὐδαιμονίαν to measure happiness by sensual enjoyments, Dem.:—Mid., μετρεῖσθαι ἴχνη to measure his steps by the eye, Soph.:—Pass. to be measured, Hdt., Aesch.
to count, Theocr.
to measure out, dole out, Ar., Dem.:—Mid. to have measured out to one, εὖ μετρεῖσθαι to get good measure, Hes.; τὰ ἄλφιτα μετρούμενοι Dem.

div1.head: μέτρημα
div1.sense: a measured distance, Eur.
a measure, allowance, dole, Eur.

div1.head: μέτρησις
div1.sense: measuring, measurement, Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: μετρητέος
div1.sense: one must measure, Plat.

div1.head: μετρητής
div1.sense: a measurer, Plat.
= ἀμφορεύς, a liquid measure, holding 12 χόες or 144 κοτύλαι, about 9 gallons Engl., Dem.

div1.head: μετρητικός
div1.sense: of or for measuring, Plat.: ἡ -κή (sc. τέχνη) mensuration, Plat.

div1.head: μετρητός
div1.sense: measurable, Eur., Plat.

div1.head: μετριάζω
div1.sense: to be moderate, keep measure, Soph., Thuc., etc.
trans. to moderate, regulate, control, Lat. moderari, Plat., etc.

div1.head: μετρικός
div1.sense: of or for metre, metrical, Arist.: τὰ -κά and ἡ -κή (sc. τέχνη) , prosody, Arist.

div1.head: μετριοπαθέω
div1.sense: to bear reasonably with, τινί NTest.

div1.head: μετριοπαθής
div1.sense: moderating oneʼs passions, a Peripatetic word.

div1.head: μετριοπότης
div1.sense: a moderate drinker, Xen.

div1.head: μέτριος
div1.sense: within measure, and so,
of Size, of average height, Hdt.; μ. πῆχυς the common cubit, Hdt.; so of Time, moderate, Plat.
of Number, few, Xen.

of Degree, holding to the mean, moderate, Hes., Eur., etc.:—of a mean or middle state, opp. to a high or low estate, Trag., etc.; τὸ μέτριον the mean, Lat. aurea mediocritas, Soph.; so, τὰ μέτρια Eur., etc.; —so, μ. φιλία a friendship not too great, Eur.; μ. ἐσθῆτι χρῆσθαι common dress, Thuc.; μετρίᾳ φυλακῇ not in strict custody, Thuc.; οἱ μέτριοι common men, the common sort, Dem.:—also, ὅσον οἰόμεθα μέτριον εἶναι just sufficient, Plat.
moderate, tolerable, Hdt., Soph., etc.; τὰ μ. moderate terms, Thuc.
of Persons, moderate, temperate, virtuous, Theogn., Eur.; μετριώτεροι ἐς τὰ πολιτικά Thuc.; μέτρ. πρὸς δίαιταν Aeschin.
proportionate, fitting, Xen.
adv. μετρίως, moderately, within due limits, in due measure, fairly, Hdt., Thuc., etc.; μ. ἔχειν τοῦ βίου to be moderately well off, Hdt.:—comp. μετριώτερον, Sup. -ώτατα, Thuc.
enough, sufficiently, Ar., etc.
modestly, temperately, Eur., Xen.:— to fair terms, Thuc.
the neut. μέτριον and μέτρια are also used as adv., Plat.:—with Art., τὸ μέτριον Xen.; τὰ μέτρια Thuc.

div1.head: μετριότης
div1.sense: moderation, Thuc., Plat.; μ. τῶν σίτων moderation in food, Xen.
a middle condition, Lat. mediocritas, Arist.

div1.head: μέτρον
div1.sense: that by which anything is measured:
a measure or rule, Il.; ἄνδρα πάντων χρημάτων μ. εἶναι is a measure of all things, Plat.
a measure of content, whether solid or liquid, δῶκεν μέθυ, χίλια μέτρα Il.; εἴκοσι μέτρα ἀλφίτου Od.
measure, length, size, μέτρα κελεύθου the length of the way, Od.; μέτρον ἑξήκοντα σταδίους Thuc.; μέτρον ἥβης full measure, i. e. the prime, of youth, Il.; μέτρα μορφῆς oneʼs size and shape, Eur.
due measure or limit, proportion, μέτρα φυλάσσεσθαι Hes.; κατὰ μέτρον Hes. ὑπὲρ μέτρον Theogn.; πλέον μέτρου Plat.;— μέτρῷ μετρίως, Pind.
metre, opp. to μέλος (tune)and ῥυθμός (time), Ar., Plat.
a verse, Plat.

div1.head: μετωπηδόν
div1.sense: adv. with front-foremost; of ships, forming a close front, in line, Hdt.; opp. to ἐπὶ κέρως (in column), Thuc.

div1.head: μετωπίδιος
div1.sense: on the forehead, Anth.

div1.head: μετώπιον
div1.sense: the forehead, Il.

div1.head: μέτωπον
div1.sense: the space between the eyes, the brow, forehead, Hom., etc.
the front or face of a wall or building, Hdt.: the front of an army or fleet, Aesch., Xen.; ἐπὶ μετώπου or ἐν μετώπῳ in line, opp. to ἐπὶ κέρως or κέρας (in column), Xen.

div1.head: μέχρι
div1.sense: to a given point, even so far,
before a prep. μέχρι πρός, Lat. usque ad, Plat.:—so before Advs., μ. δεῦρο τοῦ λόγου Plat.; μ. τότε Thuc.
serving as a prep. c. gen. even to, as far as,
of Place, μέχρι θαλάσσης Il.; μ. τῆς πόλεως Thuc.
of Time, τέο μέχρις; i. e. τινός μέχρι χρόνου; Lat. quousque? how long? Il.; so, μέχρι οὗ; μέχρι ὅσου; Hdt.; with the Art., τὸ μ. ἐμεῦ up to my time, Hdt.
of Measure or Degree, μ. σοῦ δικαίου so far as consists with right, Thuc.; μ. τοῦ δυνατοῦ Plat.
with Numbers, up to, about, nearly, sometimes without altering the case of the Subst., μέχρι τριάκοντα ἔτη Aeschin.
in Ionic, μέχρι οὗ is sometimes used like the simple μέχρι, μέχρι οὗ ὀκτὼ πύργων Hdt.
as a Conjunct. so long as, until, μέχρι μὲν ὥρεον, with δέ in apodosi, Hdt.; μ. σκότος ἐγένετο Xen.
μέχρι ἄν foll. by the subj., Xen.; so without ἄν, μ. τοῦτο ἴδωμεν Hdt.

div1.head: μὴ ἀλλά
div1.sense: an elliptic phrase for μὴ γένοιτο, ἀλλά . . , in answers, nay but, not so but, σὲ δὲ ταῦτʼ ἀρέσκει; Answ. μἀλλὰ πλεῖν ἢ μαίνομαι Ar.

div1.head: μὴ γάρ
div1.sense: an elliptic phrase, used in emphatic denial, certainly not, where a Verb must be supplied from the foregoing passage, μὴ λεγέτω τὸ ὄνομα, Answ. μὴ γάρ (sc. λεγέτω) Plat.:—also in parenthesis, where it may be translated much less, like μὴ ὅτι, Aeschin.

div1.head: μηδαμῇ
div1.sense: in no wise, not at all, Hdt., Aesch., etc.

div1.head: μηδαμόθεν
div1.sense: from no place, Xen.; μ. ἄλλοθεν from no other place, Plat.

div1.head: μηδαμόθι
div1.sense: nowhere, Luc.

div1.head: μηδαμοῖ
div1.sense: nowhither, Soph.

div1.head: μηδαμόσε
div1.sense: nowhither, μ. ἄλλοσε Plat.

div1.head: μηδαμός
div1.sense: for μηδὲ ἀμός, only in pl. μηδαμοί (in Ionic writers), none, Hdt.

div1.head: μηδαμοῦ
div1.sense: nowhere, Aesch.; μ. ἄλλοθι Plat.:— metaph. μ. νομίζεται nullo in numero habetur, Aesch.

div1.head: μηδείς
div1.etym: i. e. μηδὲ εἷς, μηδὲ μία, μηδὲ ἕν
div1.sense: and not one, related to οὐδείς as μή to οὐ, Il., etc.; —rare in Pl., Xen.

μηδὲ εἷς, which (so written) is never elided even in Attic, retained the first emphatic sense not even one, and often had a Particle between, as μηδʼ ἂν εἷς, or a prep., μηδʼ ἐξ ἑνός, μηδὲ περὶ ἑνός etc., Plat.

nobody, naught, good for naught, ὁ μηδείς Soph.; pl., οὐ γὰρ ἠξίου τοὺς μηδένας Soph.:— so, μηδέν or τὸ μηδέν often as Subst., naught, nothing, Soph.; μηδὲν λέγειν to say what is naught, Xen.; τοῦ μηδενὸς ἄξιος Hdt.; ἐς τὸ μηδὲν ἥκειν Eur.;—and of persons, τὸ μηδέν a good for naught, τὸ μηδὲν εἶναι of an eunuch, Hdt.; τὸ μ. ὄντας Soph.
neut. μηδέν as adv. not at all, by no means, Aesch., etc.

div1.head: μηδέ
div1.sense: μή δέ, Negat. Particle, (related to οὐδέ as μή to οὐ) :
as Conjunct. but not or and not, nor, μή τι σὺ ταῦτα διείρεο μηδὲ μετάλλα Il.:—more rarely without a negative preceding, τεκνοῦσθαι, μηδʼ ἄπαιδα θνήσκειν Aesch.
doubled, μηδέ . . μηδέ . . , Opposing the two clauses of a sentence, Il.:— μηδέ also follows μήτε, Soph., Plat.
as adv., joined with a single word or phrase, not even, Lat. ne . . quidem, Hom., etc.

div1.head: μηδέποτε
div1.sense: never, Ar., Plat., etc.
μηδέ ποτε and never, Hes.

div1.head: μηδέπω
div1.sense: nor as yet, not as yet, Aesch., etc.

div1.head: μηδεπώποτε
div1.sense: never yet, Dem.

div1.head: Μηδεσικάστη
div1.sense: fem. prop. n., adorned-with-prudence, from μήδεσι (dat. pl. of μῆδος) and κέκασμαι, Il.

div1.head: μηδέτερος
div1.sense: or μηδʼ, ἕτερος, α ον, neither of the two, Thuc., Plat.: adv. -ρως, in neither of two ways, Arist.

div1.head: μηδετέρωσε
div1.sense: to neither side, Thuc.

div1.head: μηδίζω
div1.sense: to be a Mede in language or habits: to side with the Medes, to Medize, Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: Μηδικός
div1.sense: the war with the Medes, the name given to the great Persian war, Thuc.; ὁ Μ. πόλεμος Thuc.
Μηδικὴ πόα medick, a kind of clover, Ar.

div1.head: Μηδισμός
div1.sense: a leaning towards the Medes, being in their interest, Medism, Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: Μηδίς
div1.sense: sub. γυνή a Median woman, Hdt.

div1.head: Μηδοκτόνος
div1.sense: Mede-slaying, Anth.

div1.head: μήδομαι
div1.sense: to be minded, to intend, resolve, Il.; ἅσσʼ ἂν μηδοίμην what counsels I should take, Od.

c. acc. rei, to plan, plot, contrive, κακὰ μήδεσθαί τινι to scheme misery for him, Il.; μήσατό μοι ὄλεθρον Od.:—also c. acc. pers. et rei, κακὰ μήσατʼ Ἀχαιούς he wrought them mischief, Hom.; so ἐπʼ ἀνδρὶ τοῦτʼ ἐμήσατο στύγος Aesch.
to invent, τέχνας Aesch.; τί δὲ μήσωμαι; what shall I attempt? Aesch.

div1.head: μῆδος
div1.sense: counsels, plans, arts, schemes, Hom.; μάχης μ. plans of fight, Il.

div1.head: μῆδος2
div1.sense: the genitals, Od.

div1.head: Μῆδος
div1.sense: a Mede, Median, Hdt., etc.

div1.head: μηδοσύνη
div1.sense: counsel, prudence, Anth.

div1.head: μηκάομαι
div1.sense: Dep., to bleat, of sheep, Hom.; of a hunted fawn or hare, to scream, shriek, Il.; of a wounded horse, Il.

div1.head: μηκασμός
div1.sense: a bleating, Lat. balatus, Plut.

div1.head: μηκάς
div1.sense: the bleating one, of she-goats, Hom.: —later, μ. ἄρνες, βληχάδες, Eur.

div1.head: μηκεδανός
div1.sense: long, Anth.

div1.head: μηκέτι
div1.etym: formed from μή, ἔτι, with κ inserted
div1.sense: no more, no longer, no further, Hom., etc.

div1.head: μήκιστος
div1.etym: irr. Sup. of μακρός (formed from μῆκος, as αἴσχιστος from αἶσχος),
div1.sense: tallest, Hom.
greatest, Soph., Eur.
longest, in point of Time, Xen.:—neut. μήκιστον as adv., in the highest degree, Hhymn.; also, τί νύ μοι μήκιστα γένηται; what is to become of me in the long run, at last? Od.
farthest, ὅτι δύνᾳ μάκιστον as far as possible, Soph.; μήκιστον ἀπελαύνειν to drive as far off as possible, Xen.

div1.head: μῆκος
div1.sense: length, Od.; ἐν μήκει καὶ πλάτει καὶ βάθει Plat.; μ. ὁδοῦ Hdt.; πλοῦ Thuc.: —in pl., τὰ μέγαλα μ. great distances, Plat.
of persons, height, tallness, stature, Od.
of Time, Aesch., etc.:—also μ. λόγου, μ. τῶν λόγων a long speech, Aesch.; ἐν μήκει λόγων Thuc.
τὸ μῆκος or μῆκος absol. as adv. in length, Hdt., etc.:— at length, in full, οὐ μῆκος ἀλλὰ σύντομα Soph.
μῆκος in height, Od.

div1.head: μηκύνω
div1.sense: to lengthen, prolong, extend, Xen.:—of Time, μ. χρόνον, βίον Eur.
μ. λόγον, λόγους to spin out a speech, speak at length, Hdt., Soph., etc.:—also without λόγον, to be lengthy or tedious, Hdt:—c. acc., μ. τὰ περὶ τῆς πόλεως to talk at length about them, Thuc.
μ. βοήν to raise a loud cry, Soph.
Mid., ἐμακύναντο κολοσσόν reared a tall statue, Anth.

div1.head: μήκων
div1.sense: the poppy, Il., etc.

div1.head: μηλέα
div1.sense: an apple-tree, Lat. malus, Od.

div1.head: μήλειος
div1.sense: of a sheep, κρέα Hdt.; μ. φόνος slaughter of sheep, Eur.

div1.head: μήλη
div1.sense: a probe, etc., Lat. specillum, Hipp., etc.

div1.head: Μηλιάδες
div1.sense: nymphs of Malis in Trachis, Soph.

div1.head: Μηλιεύς
div1.sense: an inhabitant of Malis (Μῆλις) , a Malian, pl. Μηλιέες, Hdt.; in old Attic Μηλιῆς, Soph., Thuc.
as adj., Μηλιεὺς κόλπος the Sinus Maliacus, Hdt.;— Μηλιακός, ή, όν, Thuc.:—fem. Μηλὶς, λίμνη Μηλιεύς κόλπος, Soph.

div1.head: Μήλιος
div1.sense: from the island of Melos, Melian, Theogn., Thuc.; λιμὸς M., proverb. of famine, because of the sufferings during the siege of Melos, Ar.

div1.head: Μηλίς
div1.etym: Ionic for Μᾱλίς, with or without γῆ
div1.sense: Malis in Trachis, Hdt.; cf. Μηλιεύς.

div1.head: μηλοβοτήρ
div1.sense: a shepherd, Il.

div1.head: μηλόβοτος
div1.sense: grazed by sheep, epith. of pastoral districts, Pind.

div1.head: μηλοδόκος
div1.sense: sheep-receiving, in sacrifice, of Apollo, Pind.

div1.head: μηλοθύτης
div1.sense: one who sacrifices sheep, a priest, Eur.; βωμὸς μ. a sacrificial altar, Eur.

div1.head: μηλολόνθη
div1.sense: the cockchafer, Ar.

div1.head: μῆλον
div1.sense: a sheep or goat, Od.;in pl. sheep and goats, small cattle, Lat. pecudes, opp. to βόες, Il.; with an adj. added to distinguish the gender, ἄρσενα μ. rams, wethers, Od.

div1.head: μῆλον2
div1.sense: Lat. ma_lum, an apple or (generally) any tree-fruit, Hom., Hes., Hdt., Attic
pl., metaph. of a girlʼs breasts, Theocr.:—also the cheeks, Lat. malae, Anth., Luc.; cf. μηλοπάρειος:—but in Theocr., τὰ σὰ δάκρυα μᾶλα ῥέοντι thy tears run sweet or round as apples.

div1.head: μηλονόμης
div1.sense: a shepherd or goatherd, Eur.;—so μηλο-νομεύς, έως, Anth.

div1.head: μηλονόμος
div1.sense: tending sheep or goats, Eur.

div1.head: μηλοπάρειος
div1.sense: apple-cheeked, Theocr.

div1.head: μηλοσκόπος
div1.sense: μηλο-σκόπος, κορυφή, the top of a hill from which sheep or goats (μῆλα) are watched, Hhymn.

div1.head: μηλόσπορος
div1.sense: set with fruit-trees, Eur.

div1.head: μηλοσσόος
div1.sense: sheep-protecting, Anth.

div1.head: μηλοσφαγέω
div1.sense: to slay sheep, ἱερὰ μ. to offer sheep in sacrifice, Soph.; absol., Ar.

div1.head: μηλοτρόφος
div1.sense: sheep-feeding, Orac. ap. Hdt., Aesch.

div1.head: μηλοῦχος
div1.sense: a girdle that confines the breasts, Anth.

div1.head: μηλοφόνος
div1.sense: sheep-slaying, Aesch.

div1.head: μηλοφορέω
div1.sense: to carry apples, Theocr.

div1.head: μηλοφόρος
div1.sense: bearing apples, Eur.

div1.head: μηλοφύλαξ
div1.sense: a sheep-watcher, Anth.

div1.head: μῆλοψ
div1.sense: looking like an apple, yellow, ripe, Od.:—with the gen. cf. αἴθων, -ονος.

div1.head: μήν
div1.sense: in Doric and Epic μάν, a Particle used to strengthen asseverations, Lat. vero, verily, truly, Hom., etc.
after other Particles,
ἦ μήν, like ἦ μέν (μήν being only a stronger form), now verily, full surely, ἦ μὴν καὶ πόνος ἐστίν Il.;—so in Attic, to introduce an oath, c. inf., ὄμνυσι δʼ ἦ μὴν λαπάξειν Aesch., etc.

καὶ μήν, to introduce something new or special, καὶ μὴν Τάνταλον εἰσεῖδον Od.: in dramatic Poets to mark the entrance of a person on the stage, and see . . , here comes . . ; so of new facts or arguments, Trag., Dem.
ἀλλὰ μήν, yet truly, Lat. verum enimvero, Aesch., Ar.
οὐ μήν, of a truth not, Il., Attic

after interrogatives, it mostly takes somewhat of an objective force, τί μήν; quid vero? what then? i. e. of course, naturally so, Aesch., etc.; τί μὴν οὐ; well, why not? Eur.; πῶς μήν; well, but how . . ? Xen.
much like μέντοι, Lat. tamen, οὐ μὴν ἄτιμοι τεθνήξομεν Aesch.

div0.div1: μείς (Ion. or Aeol.), μήν (Att.), ὁ, μηνός, dat. pl. μησί: a month, Hom., etc. In early times the month was divided into two parts, the beginning and the waning (μὴν ἱστάμενος and μὴν φθίνων) , Od.: the Attic division was into three decads, μὴν ἱστάμενος (also ἀρχόμενος or εἰσιών) , μεσῶν, and φθίνων (or ἀπιών) : the last division was reckoned backwards, μηνὸς τετάρτῃ φθίνοντος on the fourth day from the end of the month, Thuc.; Μαιμακτηριῶνος δεκάτῃ ἀπιόντος, i. e. on the 21st, ap. Dem.; but sometimes forwards, as, τῇ τρίτῃ ἐπʼ εἰκάδι the three-and twentieth, etc.:— ἐκείνου τοῦ μηνός in the course of that month, Xen.:— κατὰ μῆνα monthly, Ar.; so τοῦ μηνὸς ἑκάστου Ar.; or τοῦ μηνός alone, by the month, id. = μηνίσκος, Ar.

div1.head: μηνάς
div1.sense: the moon, Eur.

div1.head: μήνη
div1.sense: the moon, Il., Aesch.

div1.head: μηνιαῖος
div1.sense: monthly, Strab.

div1.head: μηνιθμός
div1.sense: wrath, Il.

div1.head: μήνιμα
div1.sense: a cause of wrath, μή τοί τι θεῶν μήνιμα γένωμαι lest I be the cause of bringing wrath upon thee, Hom.
guilt, blood-guiltiness, Plat.

div1.head: μηνίσκος
div1.sense: a crescent, Lat. lunula: a covering to protect the head of statues (like the nimbus or glory of Christian Saints), Ar.

div1.head: μῆνις
div1.sense: wrath, anger, of the gods, Hom., Hdt., Attic

div1.head: μηνίω
div1.sense: to be wroth with another, vent oneʼs wrath on him, c. dat. pers., Il.; c. gen. rei, ἱρῶν μηνίσας wrathful because of sacred rites, Il.; πατρὶ μηνίσας φόνου Soph.; absol. to be wrathful, Hom.: so in Mid., Aesch.

div1.head: μηνοειδής
div1.sense: crescent-shaped, Lat. lunatus, Hdt., Thuc., etc.; μηνοειδὲς ποιήσαντες τῶν νεῶν having formed them in a crescent, Hdt.:—of the sun and moon when partially eclipsed, Thuc., Xen.

div1.head: μήνυμα
div1.sense: an information, Thuc.

div1.head: μηνυτήρ
div1.sense: an informer, guide, Aesch.

div1.head: μηνυτής
div1.sense: bringing to light, μ. χρόνος Eur.
Subst. an informer, Lat. delator, Thuc.; κατά τινος against a person, Dem.

div1.head: μήνυτρον
div1.sense: the price of information, reward, Hhymn.:—in Attic only pl. μήνυτρα, Thuc., etc.

div0.div1: μηνύω Dor. μανύω, to disclose what is secret, reveal, betray, generally, to make known, declare, indicate, Hhymn., Hdt., Attic:—with acc. and part., μ. τινὰ ἔχοντα to shew that he has, Hdt.; the part. is sometimes omitted, τόδʼ ἔργον σε μηνύει κακόν (sc. ὄντα) Eur. at Athens to inform, lay public information against another, κατά τινος Oratt.:—impers. in Pass., μηνύεται information is laid, μεμήνυται it has been laid, Thuc. in Pass. also of persons, to be informed against, to be denounced, Xen.:—also of things, μηνυθέντος τοῦ ἐπιβουλεύματος Thuc.

div1.head: μὴ ὅπως
div1.sense: an elliptic phrase, μὴ λέγε ὅπως, followed by ἀλλʼ οὐδέ, as μὴ ὅπως ὀρχεῖσθαι, ἀλλʼ οὐδʼ ὀρθοῦσθαι ἐδύνασθε not only could you not dance, but not even stand upright, Xen.

div1.head: μὴ ὅτι
div1.sense: = μὴ ὅπως, foll. by ἀλλά, Lat. ne dicam, as, μὴ ὅτι ἰδιώτην τινά, ἀλλὰ τὸν μέγαν βασιλέα not to say a private person, but the great king, Plat.; μὴ ὅτι θεός, ἀλλὰ καὶ ἄνθρωποι οὐ φιλοῦσιν Xen.
οὐδε or καὶ οὐ followed by μὴ ὅτι, as οὐδὲ ἀναπνεῖν, μὴ ὅτι λέγειν τι δυνησόμεθα we shall not be able to breathe, much less to speak, Xen.

div1.head: μὴ οὐ
div1.sense: after Verbs expressing fear or apprehension, = Lat. vereor ut, δέδοικα μὴ οὐ γένηταί τι I fear it will not be; whereas δέδοικα μὴ γένηται mean, I fear it will be. Here, μή and οὐ each retain their proper force.
with Inf.,

after Verbs of hindering, denying, avoiding, needing, when μὴ οὐ resembles Lat. quin or quominus, οὐδὲν κωλύει μὴ οὐκ ἀληθὲς εἶναι τοῦτο nihil impedit quin hoc verum sit; or with the Art., οὐδὲν ἐλλείψω τὸ μὴ οὐ πυθέσθαι nihil praetermittam quominus reperiam, Soph.
after Verbs signifying impossibility, impropriety, reluctance, μὴ οὐ has a negative translation, δεινὸν ἐδόκεε εἶναι μὴ οὐ λαβεῖν Hdt.; αἰσχύνη ἦν μὴ οὐ δυσπουδάζειν Xen.
μὴ οὐ with the Partic., only after a negat., expressed or implied, δυσάλγητος γὰρ ἂν εἤν μὴ οὐ κατοικτείρων I should be hard-hearted if I did not pity, Soph.
= εἰ μή, except πόλεις χαλεπαὶ λαβεῖν, μὴ οὐ πολιορκία Dem.

div1.head: μή
div1.sense: not, is the negative of thought, as οὐ of statement, i. e. μή says that one thinks a thing is not, οὐ that it is not. The same differences hold for all compds. of μή and οὐ.
μή in INDEPENDENT sentences,
with Imperat., μή μʼ ἐρέθιζε do not provoke me, Il.; μή τις ἀκουσάτω let not any one hear, Od.
with Subj. μὴ δή μʼ ἐάσῃς Il.; μὴ ἴομεν (Epic for ἴωμεν) Il.; μὴ πάθωμεν Xen.

with Opt. to express a wish that a thing may not happen, ἃ μὴ κραίνοι τύχη which may fortune not bring to pass, Aesch.:—also in wishes that refer to past time and therefore cannot be fulfilled, μή ποτʼ ὤφελον λιπεῖν Soph.

in vows and oaths, where οὐ might be expected, ἴστω Ζεὺς μὴ μὲν τοῖς ἵπποισιν ἀνὴρ ἐποχήσεται ἄλλος Zeus be my witness, not another man shall ride on these horses, Il.; μὰ τὴν Ἀφροδίτην, μὴ ἐγώ σʼ ἀφήσω Ar.
with Inf., used as Imperat., μὴ δή μοι ἀπόπροθεν ἰσχέμεν ἵππους Il.
In DEPENDENT clauses:
with Final Conjunctions, ἵνα μή, ὅπως μή, ὥς μή, ὄφρα, that not, Lat. ne, Il., Attic:— μή often stands alone = ἵνα μή, Hom., Attic
in the protasis of conditional sentences, after εἰ (Epic αἰ) , εἴ κε (αἴ κε) , εἰ ἄν, ἤν, ἐάν, ἄ_ν, Lat. nisi, Hom., etc.;—so, ὅτε μή εἰ μή; etc.
in relat. clauses, when they imply a condition or supposition, λέγονθʼ ἃ μὴ δεῖ such things as one ought not, Soph.; λόγοις τοιούτοις οἷς σὺ μὴ τέρψει κλύων Soph.
with Inf., always except when the Inf. represents Ind. or Opt., as in oratio obliqua.

with Participle, when it can be resolved into a conditional clause, μὴ ἀπενείκας εἰ μὴ ἀπήνεικε Hdt.; μὴ θέλων εἰ μὴ θέλεις, Aesch.; so in a general sense, δίδασκέ μʼ ὡς μὴ εἰδότα ut qui nihil sciam, Soph.
with abstract Nouns as with Partic., τὰ μὴ δίκαια ἃ ἂν μὴ ᾖ δίκαια, Aesch.; τὸ μὴ καλόν Soph.; ἡ μὴ ʼμπειρία τὸ μὴ ἔχειν ἐμπειρίαν, want of experience, Ar.
after Verbs expressing fear or apprehension (cf. μὴ οὐ) :
when the thing feared is fut., with pres. Subj., I fear he may persuade thee, Il.
with Opt. for Subj., according to the sequence of moods and tenses, Hom., etc.
when the action is present or past, the Ind. is used, φοβούμεθα μὴ ἡμαρτήκαμεν we fear we have made a mistake, Thuc.
without a Verb to express hesitation, perhaps, μὴ ἀγροικότερον ᾖ τὸ ἀληθὲς εἰπεῖν Plat.
In QUESTIONS:
Direct questions,

with Ind., implying a negat. answer, surely not, you donʼt mean to say that, Lat. num? whereas with οὐ an affirm. answer is expected, Lat. nonne? ἆρʼ οὐ τέθνηκε; surely he is dead, is he not? ἆρα μὴ τέθνηκε; surely he is not dead, is he?:—when οὐ and μή appear in consecutive clauses, each negat. retains its proper force, οὐ σῖγʼ ἀνέξει μηδὲ δειλίαν ἀρεῖς; will you not be silent, and will you be cowardly? i. e. be silent and be not cowardly, Soph.
with the Subj., when the answer is somewhat doubtful, μὴ οὕτω φῶμεν; can we say so? Plat.:—so also with Opt. and ἄν, πῶς ἄν τις μὴ λέγοι; how can a man help speaking? Plat.
indirect questions with μή belong in fact to μή with Verbs of fear and apprehension, περισκοπῶ μή πού τις ἐγχρίμπτῃ Soph.

div1.head: μὴ πολλάκις
div1.sense: lest perchance, Lat. ne forte, Plat.

div1.head: μήποτε
div1.sense: as adv. never, on no account, after ὡς, εἰ, etc., Aesch., etc.;—also with inf., in oaths, ὀμοῦμαι, μήποτε τῆς εὐνῆς ἐπιβήμεναι Il.
in prohibition or strong denial, with aor. subj., μήποτε καὶ σὺ ὀλέσσῃς Od.
perhaps, like nescio an, Arist.
as Conj. that at no time, lest ever, Lat. ne quando, Od.

div1.head: μή που
div1.sense: lest anywhere, that nowhere, Lat. necubi, Od.: lest perchance, Hom., etc.

div1.head: μήπω
div1.sense: or μή, πω,
as adv. not yet, Lat. nondum, Od., Attic
as Conj. that not yet, lest yet, Od., etc.

div1.head: μὴ πώποτε
div1.sense: of past time, never yet, Soph.

div1.head: μήπως
div1.sense: or μή, πως, lest in any way, lest any how, lest perchance, Hom.
in case of doubt, or in indirect questions, whether or no, Il.

div1.head: μηριαῖος
div1.sense: of or belonging to the thigh, Lat. femoralis, αἱ μ. the thighs, Xen.

div1.head: μηρία
div1.sense: slices cut from the thighs, Hom. It was the custom to cut out the μηρία (ἐκ μηρία τάμνον) , wrap them in two folds of fat (κνίσῃ ἐκάλυψαν, δίπτυχα ποιήσαντες) , and burn them upon the altar.
= μηροί, the thighs, Bion.

div1.head: μήρινθος
div1.sense: a cord, line, string, Il.: a fishing-line, Theocr.

div1.head: μηρός
div1.sense: the thigh, Lat. femur, in Hom.
in pl. = μηρία, Hom., Soph.
in pl. also, generally, the leg-bones, Hdt.

div1.head: μηροτραφής
div1.sense: thigh-bred, of Bacchus, Anth.

div1.head: μηροτυπής
div1.sense: striking the thigh, Anth.

div1.head: μηρύομαι
div1.sense: Dep.
to draw up, furl sails, Od.: to draw up cables, etc., Anth.:— κρόκα ἐν στήμονι μηρύσασθαι to weave the woof into the warp, Hes.
Pass., κισσὸς μαρύεται περὶ χείλη ivy winds round the edge, Theocr.

div1.head: μήστωρ
div1.sense: an adviser, counsellor, Hom.; Ἀθηναῖοι μήστωρες ἀϋτῆς authors of the battle-din, Il.; κρατερὸν μήστωρα φόβοιο, of Diomede, Il.

div1.head: μήτε
div1.sense: and not, mostly doubled, μήτε . . μήτε . . , neither . . nor, Hom., etc.

div1.head: μήτηρ
div1.sense: a mother, Hom., etc.; of animals, a dam, Hom.; ἀπό or ἐκ μητρός from oneʼs motherʼs womb, Pind., Aesch.
also of lands, μήτηρ μήλων, θηρῶν mother of flocks, of game, Il.; of Earth, γῆ πάντων μ. Hes.; γῆ μήτηρ Aesch.; ὦ γαῖα μῆτερ Eur.:—also ἡ Μάτηρ alone for Δημήτηρ, Hdt.
of oneʼs native land, μᾶτερ ἐμά, Θήβα Pind., etc.
poet. as the source of events, μ. ἀέθλων, of Olympia, Pind.; night is the mother of day, Aesch.; the grape of wine, Aesch.

div1.head: μητιάω
div1.sense: to meditate, deliberate, debate, Il.:—Mid., μητιάασθε consider among you, Il.
c. acc. rei, = μητίομαι, Hom.

div1.head: μητίετα
div1.sense: a counsellor, as epith. of Ζεύς, all-wise! Hom.

div1.head: μητιόεις
div1.sense: wise in counsel, all-wise, Hhymn., Hes.
φάρμακα μητιόεντα wise, i. e. well-chosen, helpful, remedies, Od.

div1.head: μητίομαι
div1.sense: Dep.:— to devise, contrive, plan, Hom.: c. dupl. acc. to plan evil against one, Od.

div1.head: μῆτις
div1.sense: the faculty of advising, wisdom, counsel, cunning, craft, Hom., Aesch.; μῆτιν ἀλώπηξ a fox for craft, Pind.:—of a poetʼs skill or craft, Pind.
advice, counsel, a plan, undertaking, μῆτιν ὑφαίνειν Hom.

div1.head: μήτις
div1.sense: μή-τις or μή, τις, lest any one, lest anything; that no one, that nothing, Lat. ne quis, ne quid, constructed like the adv. μή, Hom., etc.
μήτι or μή τι, adv. used imperatively, Il.;—with Opt. to express a wish, ὄλοιντο μή τι πάντες Soph.
after Verbs of fear or doubt, Hom., etc.
in questions, μή τί σοι δοκῶ ταρβεῖν; do I seem to thee to fear? (i. e. I do not), Aesch.
μή τί γε, let alone, much less, Lat. nedum, ne dicam, Dem.

div1.head: μήτοι
div1.sense: μή-τοι or μή, τοι, stronger form of μή, with Imperat.and Subj., μή τοι δοκεῖτε Aesch., etc.: in an oath, with inf., Aesch.
after Verbs implying negation, Soph.

div1.head: μητραγύρτης
div1.sense: a begging priest of Cybele, the mother of the gods:—Iphicrates gave this name to Callias, who was really her Δᾳδοῦχος, Arist.

div1.head: μητράδελφος
div1.sense: a motherʼs brother or sister, uncle or aunt:—in Pind., ματραδελφεός.,

div1.head: μητραλοίας
div1.sense: striking oneʼs mother, a matricide, Aesch., Plat., etc.

div1.head: μήτρα
div1.sense: Lat. matrix, the womb, Hdt., Plat., etc.

div1.head: μητρικός
div1.sense: of a mother, Lat. maternus, Arist.

div1.head: μητρίς
div1.sense: μητρίς, sc. γῆ, Cretan word in Plat.

div1.head: μητρόδοκος
div1.sense: received by the mother, Pind.

div1.head: μητροήθης
div1.sense: with a motherʼs mind, Anth.

div1.head: μητρόθεν
div1.sense: from the mother, by the motherʼs side, Hdt., Pind.
from oneʼs mother, from oneʼs motherʼs hand, Aesch., Ar.
from oneʼs motherʼs womb, Aesch.

div1.head: μητροκασιγνήτη
div1.sense: a sister by the same mother, Lat. soror uterina, Aesch.

div1.head: μητροκτονέω
div1.sense: to kill oneʼs mother, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: μητροκτόνος
div1.sense: killing oneʼs mother, matricidal, Aesch.; μ. μίασμα the stain of a motherʼs murder, Aesch.; so, μ. κηλίς, αἷμα Eur.
as Subst. a matricide, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: μητρομήτωρ
div1.sense: oneʼs motherʼs mother, Pind.

div1.head: μητροπάτωρ
div1.sense: oneʼs motherʼs father, Il., Hdt.

div1.head: μητρόπολις
