div1.sense: the mother-state, in relation to colonies, as of Athens to the Ionians, Hdt., Thuc.; of Doris to the Peloponn. Dorians, Hdt., Thuc.
oneʼs mother-city, mother-country, home, Pind., Soph.
a metropolis in our sense, capital city, Xen.

div1.head: μητροπόλος
div1.sense: tending mothers, epith. of Eileithyia, Pind.

div1.head: μητρόρριπτος
div1.sense: rejected by oneʼs mother, Anth.

div1.head: μητροφθόρος
div1.sense: mother-murdering, Anth.

div1.head: μητροφόνος
div1.sense: murdering oneʼs mother, matricidal, Aesch.
as Subst. a matricide, Aesch.

div1.head: μητρυιά
div1.note: μητρυιά, Doric ματρ-, ᾶς, Ionic μητρυιή, ῆς, ἡ,
div1.sense: a step-mother, Il., etc.: the unkindness of step-mothers was proverbial (cf. Lat. injusta noverca); hence metaph., μ. νεῶν, of a dangerous coast, Aesch.

div1.head: μητρῷος
div1.etym: contr. for μητρώιος (which occurs in Od.)
div1.sense: of a mother, a motherʼs, maternal, Od., Attic; μ. δέμας, periphr. for τὴν μητέρα, Aesch.: —τὰ μ. a motherʼs right. Hdt.
Μητρῷον (sc. ἱερόν) , the temple of Cybele at Athens, which was the depository of the state-archives, Dem., Aeschin.

div1.head: μήτρως
div1.etym: pl. always of the third decl., like πάτρως
div1.sense: a maternal uncle, Il., Hdt., etc.
any relation by the motherʼs side, Pind., Eur.
= μητροπάτωρ, Pind.

div1.head: μηχανάομαι
div1.sense: like Lat. machinari, to make by art, put together, construct, build, Il., Hdt., etc.; generally to prepare, make ready, Hdt., Aesch., etc.
to contrive, devise, by art or cunning, Hom., etc.;—also simply to cause, effect, Hdt., Attic:—absol. to form designs, Od.:—c. acc. et inf. to contrive to do or that a thing may be, Xen.
Mid. to procure for oneself, Soph., Xen.

the Act. μηχανάω is used by Hom. only in Epic part., ἀτάσθαλα μηχανόωντας contriving dire effects, Od., and by Soph. in inf. μηχανᾶν: but perf. μεμηχάνημαι is used in pass. sense by Hdt. and in Attic; but also in act. sense, Plat., Xen.

div1.head: μηχάνημα
div1.sense: an engine, used in sieges, Dem.
a subtle contrivance, cunning work, Trag.; of the robe in which Agamemnon was entangled, Aesch.

div1.head: μηχανή
div1.sense: = Lat. machina:
an instrument, machine for lifting weights and the like, Hdt.; μ. Ποσειδῶνος, of the trident, Aesch.; λαοπόροις μ., of Xerxesʼ bridge of boats, Aesch.
an engine of war, Thuc.
a theatrical machine, by which gods were made to appear in the air, Plat.: hence proverb. of any sudden appearance, ὥσπερ ἀπὸ μηχανῆς (cf. Lat. deus ex machina), Dem.

any contrivance, for doing a thing, Hdt., etc.: in pl. μηχαναί, shifts, devices, arts, wiles, Hes., Attic; μηχαναῖς Διός by the arts of Zeus, Aesch.; proverb., μηχαναὶ Σισύφου Ar.:—Phrases, μηχανήν or μηχανὰς προσφέρειν Eur.; εὑρίσκειν Aesch., etc.:—c. gen., μ. κακῶν a contrivance against ills, Eur.; but, μ. σωτηρίας a way of providing safety, Aesch.
οὐδεμία μηχανή ἐστι ὅπως οὐ, c. fut., Hdt.; also, μὴ οὐ, c. inf., Hdt.
in adverb, phrases, ἐκ μηχανῆς τινος in some way or other, Hdt.; μηδεμιῆι μηχανῆι by no means whatsoever, Hdt.

div1.head: μηχανητέος
div1.sense: one must contrive, Plat.

div1.head: μηχανικός
div1.sense: full of resources, inventive, ingenious, clever, Xen.
c. gen. rei, able to procure, Xen.
of or for machines, mechanical, Arist.:— ὁ μηχανικός an engineer, Plut.

div1.head: μηχανοδίφης
div1.sense: inventing artifices, Ar.

div1.head: μηχανόεις
div1.sense: ingenious, Soph.

div1.head: μηχανοποιός
div1.sense: an engineer, maker of war-engines, Plat., Xen.: a theatrical machinist, Ar.

div1.head: μηχανορραφέω
div1.sense: to form crafty plans, Aesch.

div1.head: μηχανορράφος
div1.sense: craftily-dealing, soph.: c. gen., μ. κακῶν crafty workers of ill, Eur.

div1.head: μηχανοφόρος
div1.sense: conveying military machines, Plut.

div1.head: μῆχος
div1.sense: a means, expedient, remedy, Il.; μῆχος κακοῦ a remedy for Ill, Od., Hdt.; κακῶν Eur.

div1.head: μιαίνω
div1.sense: properly, to stain, dye, ἐλέφαντα φοίνικι μιαίνειν (cf. Virgilʼs violaverit ostro si quis ebur), Il.
to stain, defile, sully, esp. with blood, μιάνθην (Epic 3rd dual for μιανθήτην) αἵματι μηροί Il.; αἵματι πεσεῖ μιανθείς Soph.; μ. τοὺς θεῶν βωμοὺς αἵματι Plat.; βορβόρωι ὕδωρ μιαίνων Aesch.

of moral stains, to taint, defile, Pind., Trag.; hence Soph. says, θεοὺς μιαίνειν οὔ τις ἀνθρώπων σθένει:— Pass. to incur such defilement, Aesch., etc.; μιαίνεσθαι τὴν ψυχήν Plat.; τῆς ἄλλης γῆς αὐτῶι μεμιασμένης Thuc.

div1.head: μιαιφονέω
div1.sense: to be or become blood-stained, Eur.
c. acc. to murder, Isocr., Plat.

div1.head: μιαιφονία
div1.sense: bloodguiltiness, Dem., Diod.
pollution from eating blood, Plut.

div1.head: μιαιφόνος
div1.sense: blood-stained, bloody, Il.: defiled with blood, blood-guilty, Trag.; c. gen., μ. τέκνων stained with thy childrenʼs blood, Eur.:—comp. -ώτερος Hdt., Eur.; Sup. -ώτατος, Eur.

div1.head: μιαρία
div1.sense: brutality, Xen., Dem.

div1.head: μιαρόγλωσσος
div1.sense: foul-tongued, Anth.

div1.head: μιαρός
div1.sense: stained with blood, Il.: defiled with blood, Eur.
generally, defiled, polluted, unclean, Hdt.: in moral sense, Soph.; as a term of foul reproach, brutal, coarse, disgusting, Ar.; μ. φωνή a coarse, brutal voice, Ar.:—adv. μιαρῶς, Ar.

div1.head: μίασμα
div1.sense: stain, defilement, the taint of guilt, Lat. piaculum, Trag., etc.
of persons, a defilement, pollution, Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: μιάστωρ
div1.sense: a wretch stained with crime, a guilty wretch, a pollution, Lat. homo piacularis, Trag.
= ἀλάστωρ, an avenger, Trag.

div1.head: μιγάζομαι
div1.sense: to have intercourse, Od.

div1.head: μίγα
div1.sense: mixed with, c. dat., Pind.

div1.head: μιγάς
div1.sense: mixed pell-mell, Eur.

div1.head: μίγδα
div1.sense: promiscuously, confusedly, Od.; c. dat., μίγδα θεοῖς among the gods, Il.

div1.head: μῖγμα
div1.sense: a mixture: μίγματα mixtures, medicines, NTest.

div1.head: μείγνυμι
div1.sense: like Lat. misceo, to mix, mix up, mingle, properly of liquids, οἶνον καὶ ὕδωρ Hom.; μ. τί τινι to mix one thing with another, Hom., etc.
generally, to join, bring together.
in hostile sense, μῖξαι χεῖράς τε μένος τε to join battle hand to hand, Il.; Ἄρη μίξουσιν Soph.
to bring into connexion with, make acquainted with, ἄνδρας μισγέμεναι κακότητι to bring men to misery, Od.; reversely, πότμον μῖξαί τινι to bring death upon him, Pind.

Pass. to be mixed up with, mingled among, προμάχοισιν ἐμίχθη Il.; ἐώλπει μίξεσθαι ξενίηι hoped to be bound by hospitable ties, Od.:—also, to mingle with, hold intercourse with, live with, Il., Aesch.: absol. in pl., of several persons, to hold intercourse, Od.

to be brought into contact with, κάρη κονίηισιν ἐμίχθη his head was rolled in the dust, Hom.; ἐν κονίηισι μιγῆναι Il.; κλισίηισι μιγῆναι to reach, get at them, Il.; μίσγεσθαι ἐς Ἀχαιούς to go to join them, Il.; μίσγεσθαι ὑπὲρ ποταμοῖο to cross the river, Il.; μίσγεσθαι φύλλοις, στεφάνοις to come to, i. e. win, the crown of victory, Pind.
in hostile sense, to mix in fight, Il.
to have intercourse with, to be united to, of men and women, Hom.; φιλότητι and ἐν φιλότητι μιγῆναι Hom.; εὐνῆι ἔμικτο Od.

div1.head: Μίδας
div1.sense: Midas, a king of Phrygia proverbial for his wealth, Tyrtae., Plat.

div1.head: Μίθρας
div1.sense: Mithras, the Persian Sun-god, Xen.

div1.head: μικραδικητής
div1.sense: doing petty wrongs, Arist.

div1.head: μικραίτιος
div1.sense: complaining of trifles, Luc.

div1.head: μικραῦλαξ
div1.sense: with small furrows: χῶρος μ. a little field, Anth.

div1.head: μικρέμπορος
div1.sense: a pedlar, huckster, Babr.

div1.head: μικροκίνδυνος
div1.sense: exposing oneself to danger for trifles, Arist.

div1.head: μικρολογέομαι
div1.sense: fut. ήσομαι, Dep. to examine minutely, treat or tell with painful minuteness, Xen.
to deal meanly or shabbily, Luc.

div1.head: μικρολογία
div1.sense: the character of a μικρολόγος, frivolity: pettiness, meanness, Plat., etc.

div1.head: μικρολόγος
div1.sense: reckoning trifles; and so,
caring about petty expenses, penurious, Dem.
cavilling about trifles, captious, Plat.

div1.head: μικροπολίτης
div1.sense: a citizen of a petty town, German Kleinstadter, Ar., Xen.

div1.head: μικροπόνηρος
div1.sense: wicked in small things, Arist.

div1.head: μικροπρέπεια
div1.sense: the character of a μικροπρεπής, meanness, shabbiness, Arist.

div1.head: μικροπρεπής
div1.sense: petty in oneʼs notions, mean, shabby, Arist.

div1.head: μικρός
div1.sense: small, little, in point of Size, Hom., etc.; also in point of Quantity, Hes., Ar., etc.
in Amount or Importance, little, petty, trivial, slight, Theogn., Soph., etc.; σμ. τίθησι με makes me of small account. Soph.; οὐ σμικρὸν φρονεῖ Soph.
of Time, little, short, Pind., Ar., etc.; ἐν σμικρῷ (sc. χρόνῳ) shortly, Xen.
Adverbial usages,
regul. adv., σμικρῶς, but little, Sup. σμικρότατα, Xen.
σμικροῦ or μικροῦ within a little, almost, Xen., Dem.; in full, μικροῦ δεῖ or δεῖν, v. δεῖ II:—but μικροῦ πρίασθαι to buy for a little, cheap, Xen.
μικρῷ by a little, with the comp., Plat.
μικρόν and μικρά, a little, Xen., Plat.
with Preps.,
ἐπὶ σμικρόν but a little, Soph.
κατὰ μικρόν into small pieces, Xen.; so, κατὰ μικρὰ γενόμενοι Xen.:— also little by little, κατὰ μικρὸν ἀεί Ar.
παρὰ μικρόν within a little, παρὰ μ. ἐλθεῖν, c. inf., to be within an ace of doing, Eur.
μετὰ μικρόν a little after, NTest.
besides the regul. comp. and Sup. μικρότερος, -ότατος, there are the irreg. ἐλάσσων, ἐλάχιστος, from ἐλαχύς, and μείων or μειότερος, μειότατος.

div1.head: μικρότης
div1.sense: smallness: littleness, meanness, pettiness, Arist.

div1.head: μικροφιλοτιμία
div1.sense: petty ambition, Theophr.

div1.head: μικροφιλότιμος
div1.sense: seeking petty distinctions, Theophr.

div1.head: μικρόχωρος
div1.sense: with little land or soil, Strab.

div1.head: μικροψυχία
div1.sense: littleness of soul, meanness of spirit, Dem., Arist.

div1.head: μικρόψυχος
div1.sense: little of soul, mean-spirited, Dem., Arist.

div1.head: μικτός
div1.sense: mixed, blended, compound, Plat., etc.

div1.head: Μιλήσιος
div1.sense: Milesian, Μιλήσιοι, οἱ, the Milesians, Hdt.; Μιλησίη (sc. χώρα) , Hdt.

div1.head: Μίλητος
div1.sense: Miletus, a Greek city in Caria, Il.

div1.head: μιλιάριον
div1.sense: = Lat. milliarium, a mile-stone.
a copper vessel, pointed at the top and furnished with winding tubes, to boil water in, Anth. [where μῐλῐᾱριον].

div1.head: μιλιασμός
div1.sense: a marking by milestones, Strab.

div1.head: μίλιον
div1.sense: a Roman mile, milliarium, = 1000 paces,= 8 stades, = 1680 yards, i. e. 80 yards less than our mile, Polyb., etc.

div1.head: μιλτεῖον
div1.sense: a vessel for keeping μίλτος in, Anth.

div1.head: μίλτειος
div1.sense: red, μ. στάγμα the red mark made by the carpenterʼs line, Anth.

div1.head: μιλτηλιφής
div1.sense: painted with μίλτος, painted red, of ships, Hdt.

div1.head: μιλτοπάρηος
div1.sense: red-cheeked, of ships which had their bows painted red, Hom.

div1.head: μίλτος
div1.sense: red chalk, ruddle, Lat. rubrica, Hdt.

div1.head: μιλτοφυρής
div1.sense: daubed with red, Anth.

div1.head: μιλτόω
div1.sense: to paint red:—Pass. to paint oneself red or be painted red, Hdt.; σχοινίον μεμιλτωμένον the rope covered with red chalk with which they swept loiterers out of the Agora to the Pnyx, Ar.

div1.head: μίμαρκυς
div1.sense: hare-soup or jugged hare, with the blood of the animal in it, Ar.

div1.head: μιμέομαι
div1.sense: to mimic, imitate, represent, portray, Hhymn., Aesch., etc.; μ. τινά τι one in a thing, Hdt.; τινα κατά τι Hdt.; perf. part. in act. sense στύλοισι φοίνικας μεμιμημένοισι pillars made to represent palms, Hdt.; but also in pass. made exactly like, portrayed, Hdt., Plat.
of the fine arts, to represent, express by means of imitation, of an actor, Ar., Plat.; of painting and music, Plat.; of sculpture and poetry, Arist.

div1.head: μιμηλός
div1.sense: imitative, c. gen., Luc., Anth.
pass. imitated, copied, Plut.

div1.head: μίμημα
div1.sense: anything imitated, a counterfeit, copy, Eur., Plat.

div1.head: μίμησις
div1.sense: imitation, Thuc., Plat., etc.; κατὰ σὴν μ. to imitate you, Ar.
representation by means of art, Plat.: a representation, portrait, Hdt.

div1.head: μιμητέος
div1.sense: to be imitated, Xen.
μιμητέον, one must imitate, Eur., Xen.

div1.head: μιμητής
div1.sense: an imitator, copyist, Plat., etc.
one who represents characters, Arist.
a mere actor, an impostor (cf. ὑποκριτής) , Plat.

div1.head: μιμητικός
div1.sense: good at imitating, imitative, of the fine arts, Plat., etc.:— ἡ -κή (with or without τέχνη) the power of imitating, Plat.

div1.head: μιμητός
div1.sense: to be imitated or copied, Xen.

div1.head: μιμνάζω
div1.sense: to wait, stay, Il.
to await, expect, c. acc., Hhymn.

div1.head: μιμνήσκω
div1.etym: μέμνημαι is used in pres. sense like Lat. memini
div1.sense: In active, Causal of μνάομαι to remind, put one in mind, Od.; τινός of a thing, Hom., etc.
to recall to memory, make famous, Pind.
Mid. and Pass., to remind oneself of a thing, call to mind, remember, c. acc., Hom., etc.:— c. gen., ἀλκῆς μνήσασθαι to bethink one of oneʼs strength, Hom., etc.; also, περὶ πομπῆς μνησόμεθα Od.
c. inf. to remember or be minded to do a thing, Il., Ar., etc.
c. part., μέμνημαι κλύων I remember hearing, Aesch.; μ. ἐλθών I remember having come, i. e. to have come, Eur.
absol., μεμνήσομαι I will bear in mind, not forget, Hom.; perf. part. ὧδέ τις μεμνημένος μαχέσθω let him fight with good heed, let him remember to fight, Il.
to remember a thing aloud, i. e. to mention, make mention of c. gen., Hom; περί τινος Hdt., etc; ὑπέρ τινος Dem.

div1.head: μίμνω
div1.etym: formed by redupl. from μένω ( i. e. μι-μένω, cf. γί-γνομαι, πί-πτω), and used for μένω when the first syll.was to be long; μιμνόντεσσι, Ep. dat. pl. part. for μίμνουσι.
div1.sense: to stay, stand fast, in battle Il.
to stay, tarry, Il.
of things, to remain, Od.: also to be left for one, Aesch.
c. acc. to await, wait for, Il., etc.:—impers., μίμνει παθεῖν τὸν ἔρξαντα it awaits the doer to suffer, Aesch.

div1.head: μιμολογέομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be recited like mimes, Strab.

div1.head: μιμολόγος
div1.sense: composing or reciting μῖμοι, Anth.

div1.head: μῖμος
div1.sense: an imitator, mimic: an actor, mime, Dem., Plut.
a mime, a kind of prose drama, such as Sophron wrote, Arist.

div1.head: μιμῳδός
div1.sense: a singer of μῖμοι, Plut.

div1.head: μινθόω
div1.sense: to besmear with dung, befoul, Ar.

div1.head: μιν
div1.etym: Ionic acc. sg. of the pron. of the 3rd pers. (v. ἵ) through all genders, for αὐτόν, αὐτήν, αὐτο
always enclitic, Hom., Hdt.; Doric and Attic νιν
div1.sense: Hom. joins μὶν αὐτόν himself, as a stronger form; but αὐτόν μιν is reflexive, oneself, for ἑαυτόν, Od.
rarely as 3 pers. pl. for αὐτούς, αὐτάς, αὐτά.

div1.head: Μινύαι
div1.sense: the Minyans, a race of nobles in Orchomenos, Hdt., etc

div1.head: Μινύειος
div1.sense: Minyan, Il.; Epic also Μινυήϊος, Hom.

div1.head: μινύθω
div1.etym: only used in pres. and Ionic imperf. μινύθεσκον
div1.sense: to make smaller or less, lessen, curtail, Il., Hes.
to diminish in number, Od.
intr. to become smaller or less, decrease, decay, come to naught, perish, Hom., Hes.

div1.head: μινυνθάδιος
div1.sense: shortlived, Hom.:—comp. μινυνθαδιώτερος Il.

div1.head: μίνυνθα
div1.sense: a little, very little, Hom.; of Time, a short time, Hom.; μίνυνθα δέ οἱ γένεθʼ ὁρμή but shortlived was his effort, Hom.

div1.head: μινυρίζω
div1.sense: to complain in a low tone, to whimper, whine, Hom.: generally, to sing in a low soft tone, to warble, hum, Ar., Plat.

div1.head: μινύρισμα
div1.sense: a warbling, Theocr.

div1.head: μινύρομαι
div1.sense: Dep., = μινυρίζω, of the nightingale, to warble, Soph.: to hum a tune, Aesch.

div1.head: μινυρός
div1.sense: complaining in a low tone, whining, whimpering, Theocr.; μινυρὰ θρέεσθαι μινυρίζειν, Aesch.

div1.head: μινυώριος
div1.sense: shortlived, Anth.

div1.head: Μινώϊος
div1.sense: of Minos, Hhymn.

div1.head: Μίνως
div1.sense: Minos, son of Zeus and Europa, king of Crete, Hom., Hes., etc.:—gen. Μίνωος Od.; acc. Μίνωα Hom.;—also gen. Μίνω Hdt.; acc. Μίνων Il., or Μίνω Hdt., etc.; dat. Μίνῳ Plat.

div1.head: μίξις
div1.sense: a mixing, mingling, Plat.; v. κρᾶσις,
intercourse with others, esp. sexual intercourse, Hdt.

div1.head: μιξοβάρβαρος
div1.sense: half barbarian half Greek, Eur., Xen.

div1.head: μιξόθηρ
div1.sense: half-beast, Eur.

div1.head: μιξόθροος
div1.sense: with mingled cries, Aesch.

div1.head: μιξόλευκος
div1.sense: mixed with white, Luc.

div1.head: μιξολύδιος
div1.sense: half-Lydian, Strab.

div1.head: μιξολυδιστί
div1.sense: in the mixed-Lydian measure, Plat.

div1.head: μιξοπάρθενος
div1.sense: half-woman, Hdt., Eur.

div1.head: μιξοφρύγιος
div1.sense: half-Phrygian, Strab.

div1.head: μισαγαθία
div1.sense: a hatred of good or goodness, Plut.

div1.head: μισαθήναιος
div1.sense: hating the Athenians: Sup. μισαθηναιότατος Dem.

div1.head: μισαλάζων
div1.sense: hating boasters, Luc.

div1.head: μισαλέξανδρος
div1.sense: hating Alexander, Aeschin.

div1.head: μισάμπελος
div1.sense: hating the vine, Anth.

div1.head: μισανθρωπία
div1.sense: hatred of mankind, Plat., Dem.

div1.head: μισάνθρωπος
div1.sense: hating mankind, misanthropic, Plat.

div1.head: μισγάγκεια
div1.sense: a place where mountain glens and their streams meet, a meeting of glens, Il.

div1.head: μισέλλην
div1.sense: a hater of the Greeks, Xen.

div1.head: μισέω
div1.sense: to hate, Pind., Attic:—c. acc. et inf., μίσησεν δʼ ἄρα μιν κυσὶ κύρμα γενέσθαι, Zeus hated (would not suffer) that he should become a prey to dogs, Il.; οὐ μισοῦντα τὴν πόλιν, τὸ μὴ οὐ μεγάλην εἶναι not grudging that the city should be great, Ar.:—Pass. to be hated, Hdt., Attic

div1.head: μίσημα
div1.sense: an object of hate, of persons, μ. ἀνδρῶν καὶ θεῶν Aesch.; c. dat., μ. πᾶσιν Eur.

div1.head: μισητέος
div1.sense: to be hated, Xen.
μισητέον, one must hate, Luc.

div1.head: μισητία
div1.sense: hateful lust, lewdness, Ar.
generally, greediness, greed, Ar.

div1.head: μισητός
div1.sense: hateful, Aesch., Xen.

div1.head: μισθαποδοσία
div1.sense: payment of wages, recompense, NTest.

div1.head: μισθαποδότης
div1.sense: one who pays wages, a rewarder, NTest.

div1.head: μισθάριον
div1.sense: a little fee, Ar.

div1.head: μισθαρνέω
div1.sense: to work or serve for hire, Plat., Dem.; μισθαρνῶν ἀνύειν τι to do a thing for pay, Soph.

div1.head: μισθάρνης
div1.sense: a hired workman, Plut.

div1.head: μισθαρνητικός
div1.sense: of or for hired work, mercenary: ἡ -κή (sc. τέχνη) the trade of one who takes wages or pay, Plat.

div1.head: μισθαρνία
div1.sense: an earning of wages, Dem.

div1.head: μισθαρνικός
div1.sense: of or for hired work, mercenary, Arist.

div1.head: μισθαρχίδης
div1.sense: Comic Patron., son of a placeman, Ar.

div1.head: μίσθιος
div1.sense: salaried, hired, Plut., NTest.

div1.head: μισθοδοσία
div1.sense: payment of wages, Thuc., Xen.

div1.head: μισθοδοτέω
div1.sense: to pay wages, absol., Xen., Dem.: —c. acc. to furnish with pay, Decret. ap. Dem.

div1.head: μισθοδότης
div1.sense: one who pays wages, a paymaster, Plat., Xen.

div1.head: μισθός
div1.sense: wages, pay, hire, Hom., etc.; μισθῷ ἐπὶ ῥητῷ for fixed wages, Il.; μισθοῖο τέλος the end of our hired service, Il.; θητεύειν ἐπὶ μισθῷ Hdt.; μισθοῦ ἕνεκα for pay or wages, Xen.; so in gen., μισθοῦ Soph., Xen.; μηνὸς μισθόν as a monthʼs pay, Thuc.

at Athens, the pay of the soldiers and sailors, Thuc., etc.:—also, μ. βουλευτικός the pay of the council of 500, a drachma to each for each day of sitting; μ. δικαστικός or ἡλιαστικός the pay of a dicast (at first one obol, but from the time of Cleon three) for each day he sat on a jury; μ. συνηγορικός the fee of a public advocate, one drachma for each court-day; μ. ἐκκλησιαστικός the fee for attending the popular assembly.
a physicianʼs fee, Arist.
generally, recompense, reward, Hom., etc.
in bad sense, payment, requital, Trag.

div1.head: μισθοφορά
div1.sense: = ἡ τοῦ μισθοῦ φορά, receipt of wages or wages received, hire, pay, Ar., Thuc., etc.

div1.head: μισθοφορέω
div1.sense: to be a μισθοφόρος, to receive wages or pay in the public service, to serve for hire, Ar., Xen., etc.;—also c. acc. rei, to receive as pay, τρεῖς δραχμάς Ar.
of mercenary soldiers, Ar., Thuc.; μισθ. τινί Xen.; μ. ἐν τοῖς ἀδυνάτοις, as if he were a pauper, Aeschin.
to bring in rent or profit, μισθοφοροῦσα οἰκία Isae.; ζεῦγος ἢ ἀνδράποδον μισθοφοροῦν Xen.:— Pass. to be let for hire, Xen.

div1.head: μισθοφορητέος
div1.sense: one must receive pay, Thuc.

div1.head: μισθοφορία
div1.sense: service as a mercenary, Dem.

div1.head: μισθοφόρος
div1.sense: receiving wages or pay, serving for hire, mercenary, Plat., Dem.
as Subst., μισθοφόροι, οἱ, mercenaries, Thuc., Xen., etc.; —also, μ. τριήρεις galleys manned with mercenaries, Ar.

div1.head: μισθόω
div1.sense: to let out for hire, farm out, let, Lat. locare, τί τινι Ar.: in pres. and imperf. to offer to let, μισθοῖ αὑτὸν Ὀλυνθίοις offers his services for pay to them, Dem.:—c. inf., μ. τὸν νηὸν τριηκοσίων ταλάντων ἐξεργάσασθαι to let out the building of it for 300 talents, Lat. locare aedem exstruendam, Hdt.

Mid., fut. μισθώσομαι: aor1 ἐμισθωσάμην: perf. μεμίσθωμαι:— to have let to one, to hire, Lat. conducere, Hdt., Attic; μ. τινα ταλάντου to engage his services at a talent a year, Hdt.; c. inf., μ. νηὸν ἐξοικοδομῆσαι to contract for the building of the temple, Lat. conducere aedem aedificandam, Hdt.
Pass., aor1 ἐμισθώθην: perf. μεμίσθωμαι (v. supr. II):— to be hired for pay, Hdt.; ἐκ τοῦ μισθωθῆναι from the hire, Dem.: of a house, to be let on contract, Dem.

div1.head: μίσθωμα
div1.sense: the price agreed on in hiring, the contract-price, Hdt., Dem.
that which is let for hire, a hired house, NTest.

div1.head: μίσθωσις
div1.sense: a letting for hire, δίκη μισθώσεως or δ. μισθώσεως οἴκου an action against a guardian who neglected to let his wardʼs house.
rent, Dem.

div1.head: μισθωτής
div1.sense: one who pays rent, a tenant, Dem.

div1.head: μισθωτικός
div1.sense: of or for letting out:— ἡ μισθωτική, = μισθαρνική, a mercenary trade, Plat.

div1.head: μισθωτός
div1.sense: hired, Hdt., Plat.
as Subst. an hireling, hired servant, Ar.: of soldiers, in pl., mercenaries, Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: μισογόης
div1.sense: hating fraud or jugglery, Luc.

div1.head: μισογύνης
div1.sense: woman-hater, Strab.

div1.head: μισοδημία
div1.sense: hatred of democracy, Oratt.

div1.head: μισόδημος
div1.sense: hating the commons, Ar., Xen.

div1.head: μισόθεος
div1.sense: hating the gods, godless, Aesch.

div1.head: μισόθηρος
div1.sense: hating the hunt, Xen.

div1.head: μισοκαῖσαρ
div1.sense: hating Caesar, Plut.

div1.head: μισολάκων
div1.sense: a Laconian-hater, Ar.

div1.head: μισολάμαχος
div1.sense: hating Lamachus, Ar.

div1.head: μισολογία
div1.sense: hatred of argument, Plat.

div1.head: μισόλογος
div1.sense: hating argument or dialectic, Plat.

div1.head: μισόνοθος
div1.sense: hating bastards, Anth.

div1.head: μισόπαις
div1.sense: hating boys or children, Luc.

div1.head: μισοπέρσης
div1.sense: an enemy to the Persians, Xen.

div1.head: μισόπολις
div1.sense: hating the commonwealth, Ar.

div1.head: μισοπονέω
div1.sense: to hate work, Plat.

div1.head: μισοπόνηρος
div1.sense: hating knaves, Dem., Aeschin.

div1.head: μισοπονία
div1.sense: hatred of work, Luc.

div1.head: μισοπόρπαξ
div1.sense: hating the shield-handle (πόρπαξ) , i. e. hating war, Ar., in Com. Sup. μῑσοπορπᾱκίστατος.

div1.head: μισόπτωχος
div1.sense: hating the poor, of the gout, Anth.

div1.head: μισορώμαιος
div1.sense: a Roman-hater, Plut.

div1.head: μισόσοφος
div1.sense: hating philosophy, Plat.

div1.head: μῖσος
div1.sense: hate, hatred: and so,
pass. hate borne one, a being hated, Trag., Plat.
act. hate felt against another, a grudge, Soph., etc.; μ. τινός τινι felt by one against another, Eur.
of persons, a hateful object, = μίσημα, Trag.

div1.head: μισοσύλλας
div1.sense: an enemy of Sulla, Plut.

div1.head: μισότεκνος
div1.sense: hating children, Aeschin.

div1.head: μισοτύραννος
div1.sense: a tyrant-hater, Hdt., Aeschin.

div1.head: μισότυφος
div1.sense: hating arrogance, Luc.

div1.head: μισοφίλιππος
div1.sense: hating Philip, Aeschin.

div1.head: μισόχρηστος
div1.sense: hating the better sort, Xen.

div1.head: μισοψευδής
div1.sense: hating lies, Luc.

div1.head: μιστύλλω
div1.sense: to cut up meat, Hom.

div1.head: μιτοεργός
div1.sense: working the thread, Anth.

div1.head: μιτόομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to ply the woof, Anth.:— φθόγγον μιτώσασθαι to let oneʼs voice sound like a string, Anth.

div1.head: μιτορραφής
div1.sense: composed of threads, Anth.

div1.head: μίτος
div1.sense: a thread of the warp, Lat. tela, Il.;— κατὰ μίτον thread by thread, i. e. in an unbroken series, Polyb.
the string of a lyre, Anth.

div1.head: μίτρα
div1.note: μίτρα, Epic and Ionic μίτρη, ἡ,
div1.sense: a belt or girdle, worn round the waist beneath the cuirass (whereas the ζωστήρ went over it), Il.
= ζώνη, the maiden-zone, Theocr., Mosch., etc.
a girdle worn by wrestlers, Anth.
a head-band worn by Greek women to tie up their hair, a snood, Eur.
the victorʼs chaplet at the games, Pind.; Λυδία μίτρα a Lydian garland (i. e. an ode in Lydian measure), Pind.
a Persian head-dress, turban, Hdt.

div1.head: Μίτρα
div1.sense: the Persian Aphrodite, Hdt.

div1.head: μιτρηφόρος
div1.sense: wearing a μίτρα or turban, Hdt.

div1.head: μιτρόδετος
div1.sense: bound with a μίτρα, Anth.

div1.head: μίτυλος
div1.sense: Lat. mutilus, curtailed, esp. hornless, Theocr.

div1.head: μιτώδης
div1.sense: like threads of threads, βρόχος μ. σινδόνος a halter of threads or linen, Soph.

div1.head: μνααῖος
div1.sense: of the weight of a μνᾶ, Xen., etc.

div1.head: μνάομαι
div1.sense: like μιμνήσκομαι, to be mindful of a person or thing, c. gen., Il.:— to turn oneʼs mind to a thing, φύγαδε μνώοντο Il.
to woo for oneʼs bride, to court, c. acc. pers., Od.
to sue for, solicit a favour or office, Lat. ambire, Hdt.

div1.head: μνᾶ
div1.sense: the Lat. mina,
as a weight, = 100 drachmae, = about 15.2 oz. troy.
as a sum of money, also = 100 drachmae, i. e. 4 l. s. 3 d.:—60 μναῖ made a talent.

div1.head: μνεία
div1.sense: remembrance, memory, Soph., Eur.
mention, μνείαν ποιεῖσθαί τινος or περί τινος Plat., Aeschin.

div1.head: μνῆμα
div1.sense: Lat. monimentum:
a memorial, remembrance, record of a person or thing, Od., Soph., etc.
a mound or building in honour of the dead, a monument, Il., Hdt., Attic
a memorial dedicated to a god, Simon. ap. Thuc.
= μνήμη, memory, Theogn.

div1.head: μνημεῖον
div1.note: μνημεῖον, Doric μνᾱμεῖον, Ionic μνημήιον, ου, τό,
div1.sense: Lat. monimentum, any memorial, remembrance, record of a person or thing, Hdt., Attic
of one dead, a monument, Soph., etc.

div1.head: μνήμενος
div1.sense: remembering, Od., as cited by Arist.

div1.head: μνήμη
div1.sense: a remembrance, memory, record of a person or thing, Theogn., Hdt., etc.; πρὸς ἃ ἔπασχον τὴν μνήμην ἐποιοῦντο made their recollection suit their sufferings, Thuc.
memory as a power of the mind, Attic:— εἰπεῖν τι μνήμης ὕπο (or ἄπο) from memory, Soph.
= μνημεῖον a monument, Plat.; an epitaph, Arist.
mention of a thing, Hdt.

div1.head: μνημόνευμα
div1.sense: a record of the past, Arist.

div1.head: μνημονευτέος
div1.sense: one must remember, Plat.

div1.head: μνημονευτικός
div1.sense: of or for reminding, Plotin.

div1.head: μνημονευτός
div1.sense: that can be or ought to be remembered, Arist.

div1.head: μνημονεύω
div1.sense: to call to mind, remember, c. acc., Hdt., Trag.; c. gen., Plat.
to call to anotherʼs mind, mention, Lat. memorare, c. acc., Plat.
Pass. to be remembered, had in memory, μνημονεύσεται χάρις Eur.; μνημονευθήσεται Dem.

div1.head: μνημονικός
div1.sense: of or for remembrance or memory, τὸ μνημονικόν μνήμη, memory, Xen.; but, also, memoria technica, Plat.
of persons, having a good memory, Ar.; μνημονικώτατος Dem.
adv. -κῶς, from or by memory, Aeschin.

div1.head: μνημοσύνη
div1.sense: remembrance, memory, μνημοσύνη πυρὸς γενέσθω let us be mindful of the fire, Il.
as prop. n. Mnemosyne, mother of the Muses, Hhymn., Hes., etc.

div1.head: μνημόσυνον
div1.sense: a remembrance, memorial, record of a person or thing, Hdt.
a memorandum, reminder, μνημόσυνα γράψομαι Ar.

div1.head: μνήμων
div1.note: μνήμων, Doric μνάμων, ονος, ὁ, ἡ,
div1.sense: mindful, καὶ γὰρ μνήμων εἰμί I remember it well, Od.; μνήμοσιν δέλτοις φρενῶν Aesch.: c. gen. mindful of, giving heed to, Od.
ever-mindful, unforgetting, Aesch.
having a good memory, Ar., Plat.
as Subst. μνήμονες, οἱ, municpal officers, Recorders, Arist.

div1.head: μνησιδωρέω
div1.sense: to offer public thanksgiving, Orac. ap. Dem.

div1.head: μνησικακέω
div1.sense: to remember wrongs done one, remember past injuries, Hdt., Dem.; οὐ μν. to bear no malice, pass an act of amnesty, Ar., Thuc., etc.: c. dat. pers. et gen. rei, μ. τινί τινος to bear one a grudge for a thing, Xen.
c. acc. rei, τὴν ἡλικίαν μν. to remind one of the ills of age, Ar.

div1.head: μνησίκακος
div1.sense: bearing malice, Arist.

div1.head: μνησιπήμων
div1.sense: reminding of misery, μν. πόνος the painful memory of woe, Aesch.

div1.head: μνηστεία
div1.sense: a wooing, courting, Plat.

div1.head: μνήστειρα
div1.sense: mindful of, c. gen., Pind.

div1.head: μνήστευμα
div1.sense: courtship, wooing, in pl., espousals, Eur.

div1.head: μνηστεύω
div1.sense: to woo, court, seek in marriage, Od., Eur.: to woo and win, espouse, Theogn., Theocr.:—Pass., μναστευθεῖσʼ ἐξ Ἐλλάνων Eur.
to promise in marriage, betroth, τὴν θυγατέρα τινί Eur.:—Pass., τῇ μεμνηστευμένῃ αὐτῷ γυναικί to his betrothed wife, NTest.
to sue or canvass for a thing, Plut.

div1.head: μνηστήρ
div1.sense: a wooer, suitor, Od.; c. gen., παιδὸς ἐμῆς μν. Hdt.; γάμων μν. Aesch.
calling to mind, mindful of, c. gen., Pind.

div1.head: μνῆστις
div1.sense: remembrance, heed, οὐδέ τις ἡμῖν δόρπου μνῆστις ἔην Od.; ἴσχε κἀμοῦ μνῆστω Soph.:— οὕτω δὴ Γέλωνος μνῆστις γέγονεν then you bethought yourselves of Gelon, Hdt.

div1.head: μνηστός
div1.sense: wooed and won, wedded, ἄλοχος μνηστή a wedded wife, Hom.

div1.head: μνήστωρ
div1.sense: mindful of, τινός Aesch.

div1.head: μνιαρός
div1.sense: mossy, soft as moss, Anth.

div1.head: μογερός
div1.sense: of persons, toiling, wretched, Trag.
of things, toilsome, grievous, Eur.

div1.head: μογέω
div1.sense: to toil, suffer, Hom.; ἐξ ἔργων μογέοντες tired after work, Od.: the part. is nearly = μόγις, with pain or trouble, hardly, μογέων ἀποκινήσασκε Il.
in Trag. to suffer pain, be distressed, Aesch.
trans. to labour at, τι Anth.

div1.head: μογιλάλος
div1.sense: hardly-speaking, dumb, NTest.

div1.head: μόγις
div1.sense: with toil and pain, i. e. hardly, scarcely, Hom., Hdt., Attic:—cf. the post-Hom. μόλις.

div1.head: μόγος
div1.sense: toil, trouble, Il.
trouble, distress, Lat. labor, Soph.

div1.head: μογοστόκος
div1.sense: helping women in hard childbirth, of Eileithyia, Il.; of Artemis, Theocr.

div1.head: μόδιος
div1.sense: a dry measure, Lat. modius, = the sixth of a medimnus, about 2 gallons, NTest.

div1.head: μόθος
div1.sense: battle, battle-din, Il.

div1.head: μοθωνικός
div1.sense: like a μόθων, Ionic ap. Plut.

div1.head: μόθων
div1.sense: at Lacedaemon, the child of an Helot, brought up as foster-brother of a young Spartan:— since such young Helots were likely to presume, μόθων came to mean an impudent fellow, Ar.
a rude, licentious dance, Eur., Ar.

div1.head: μοῖρα
div1.sense: a part, portion, Hom.
a division of a people, Hdt.
a political party, Lat. partes, Hdt., Eur.
the part, portion, share which falls to one, in the distribution of booty, Hom.; or of a meal, Od.; ἡ τοῦ πατρὸς μοῖρα oneʼs patrimony, ap. Dem.
in various phrases, οὐδʼ αἰδοῦς μοῖραν ἔχουσιν has no part in shame, Od.; τέσσαρας μοίρας ἔχον ἐμοί filling the place of four relations to me, Aesch.

oneʼs portion in life, lot, fate, destiny, Hom., etc.; ἡ πεπρωμένη μ. Hdt.; μοῖρʼ ἐστι, c. inf., ʼtis oneʼs fate, Hom.; ἔσχε μοῖρʼ Ἀχιλλέα θανεῖν ʼtwas his fate to die, Soph.;— μ. βιότοιο oneʼs portion or measure of life, Il.; ὑπὲρ μοῖραν (v. μόρος) Il.; ἀγαθῇ μοίρᾳ by good luck, Eur.; θείᾳ μοίρᾳ by divine providence, Xen.
like μόρος, manʼs appointed doom, i. e. death, Hom., Aesch.:— also the cause of death, Od.
that which is oneʼs due, Lat. quod fas est, κατὰ μοῖραν as is meet, rightly, Hom.; opp. to παρὰ μοῖραν, Od.; μοῖραν νέμειν τινί to give one his due, Soph.
respect, esteem, ἐν οὐδεμίᾳ μοίρῃ μεγάλῃ ἄγειν τινά to hold one in no great respect, Hdt.; ἐν μείζονι μ. εἶναι Plat.
with a gen. almost periphr., μ. φρενῶν, for φρένες, Aesch.; ἀνδρὸς μοίρᾳ προσετέθη it was accounted manly, Thuc.; ἐν πολεμίου μοίρᾳ as if he were an enemy, Dem.
Μοῖρα, as prop. n., the goddess of fate, the Roman Parca, Hom.; later, there were three, Clotho, Lachesis, Atropos, Hes.
Μοῖραι, of the Furies, Aesch.

div1.head: μοιράω
div1.sense: to share, divide, distribute, Luc.; Mid. to divide among themselves, Aesch.:—Pass. to be allotted, Luc.

div1.head: μοιρηγενής
div1.sense: child of destiny, Il.

div1.head: μοιρίδιος
div1.sense: allotted by destiny, destined, doomed, Lat. fatalis, μ. ἆμαρ etc., the day of doom, Pind.; μοιριδία τίσις Soph.; ἁ μοιριδία δύνασις the power of fate, Soph.

div1.head: μοιρόκραντος
div1.sense: ordained by destiny, Aesch.

div1.head: μοιχάγρια
div1.sense: a fine imposed on one taken in adultery, Od.

div1.head: μοιχαλίς
div1.sense: an adulteress, NTest.:as adj. adulterous, NTest.
as Subst. = μοιχεία, NTest.

div1.head: μοιχάω
div1.sense: trans., = μοιχεύω: metaph., μοιχᾶν τὴν θάλατταν to have dalliance with the sea, Xen.:—Pass., like μοιχεύομαι, to commit adultery, NTest.

div1.head: μοιχεία
div1.sense: adultery, Plat.

div1.head: μοιχεύτρια
div1.sense: an adulteress, Plat.

div1.head: μοιχεύω
div1.sense: to commit adultery with a woman, to debauch her, c. acc., Ar., Plat.:—Pass., of the woman, Ar.
intr. to commit adultery, Lat. moechari, Ar., Xen.

div1.head: μοιχίδιος
div1.sense: born in adultery, Luc.

div1.head: μοιχικός
div1.sense: adulterous, μ. διαβολαί accusations of adultery, Luc.

div1.head: μοιχός
div1.sense: an adulterer, paramour, debaucher, Lat. moechus, Ar., Plat.:— κεκάρθαι μοιχόν to have the head shaven, as was done to adulterers, Ar.

div1.head: μολιβαχθής
div1.sense: heavy with lead, leaded, Anth.

div1.head: μόλιβος
div1.sense: lead, Hom.; fem. in Anth.

div1.head: μόλις
div1.etym: later form for μόγις, Trag., Thuc., etc.
div1.sense: with a negat., οὐ μόλις not scarcely, i. e. quite, utterly, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: μολοβρός
div1.sense: a greedy fellow, applied to a beggar, Od.

div1.head: Μολοσσός
div1.sense: Molossian, Hdt., Aesch., etc.:—fem. Μολοσσία, ( sc. γῆ ) Pind.

div1.head: μολπάζω
div1.sense: to sing of, Lat. canere, Ar.

div1.head: μολπαστής
div1.sense: a minstrel or dancer, Anth.

div1.head: μολπηδόν
div1.sense: like a song, Aesch.

div1.head: μολπή
div1.sense: the song and dance, a chant or song accompanied by measured movements, in honour of a god, or as an amusement, Hom.:—then, generally, play, sport, of a game at ball, Od.
singing, song, as opp. to dancing Hom., Trag.

div1.head: μολπῆτις
div1.sense: she who sings and dances, Anth.

div1.head: μολύβδαινα
div1.sense: XXXno:molubdain h_hs fem Epic
a piece of lead, used as the sink of a fishing-line, Il.

div1.head: μολύβδινος
div1.sense: leaden, of lead, μ. κανών, a flexible rule that could be moulded to curves, Arist.

div1.head: μολυβδίς
div1.sense: a leaden weight on a net, Plat.
a leaden ball, Xen.

div1.head: μόλυβδος
div1.sense: lead, Hdt., Eur.
plumbago, vulgarly called black lead, used as a test of gold, Theogn.:— a black-lead pencil, Anth.

div1.head: μολυνοπραγμονέομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to get into dirty quarrels, Ar.

div1.head: μολυσμός
div1.sense: defilement, NTest.

div1.head: μολύνω
div1.sense: to stain, sully, defile, Ar.; μ. τινά to make a beast of him, Ar.; also to defile a woman, Theocr.:—Pass. to become vile, ἐν ἀμαθίᾳ μολύνεσθαι to wallow in ignorance, Plat.

div1.head: μομφή
div1.sense: blame, censure, Pind., Aesch.:— cause or ground of complaint, μομφὴν ἔχειν τινί Pind.; ἕν σοι μομφὴν ἔχω in one thing I blame thee, Eur.; μ. ξυνοῦ δορός blame as to helping spear, Soph.

div1.head: μοναδικός
div1.sense: consisting of units, μ. ἀριθμός abstract number, Arist.

div1.head: μονάμπυξ
div1.sense: of horses, having one frontlet, μονάμπυκες πῶλοι horses that run single, race-horses, opp. to chariots Eur.; so, μονάμπυκες alone, Eur.; of a bull, having no yoke-fellow, Eur.

div1.head: μοναρχέω
div1.sense: to be sovereign, Pind., Plat.; ἐπὶ τούτου μουναρχέοντος in this monarchʼs time, Hdt.; c. gen., ἑκόντων μ. Arist.

div1.head: μοναρχία
div1.sense: the rule of one, monarchy, sovereignty, Hdt., Trag., etc.:—of a general in chief, Xen.; of the Roman Dictator, Plut.

div1.head: μοναρχικός
div1.sense: monarchical, Plat.
of persons, inclined to monarchy:—adv. -κῶς, Plut.

div1.head: μόναρχος
div1.sense: one who rules alone, a monarch, sovereign, Theogn., Aesch., etc.
as adj., σκᾶπτον μ. the sovereign sceptre, Pind.
for the Roman Dictator, Plut.

div1.head: μονάς
div1.sense: alone, solitary, Eur.; as masc. of a man, Aesch.
as Subst., μονάς, άδος, a unit, Plat.

div1.head: μοναυλέω
div1.sense: to play a solo on the flute, Plut.

div1.head: μοναυλία
div1.sense: a living alone, celibacy, Plat.

div1.head: μόναυλος
div1.sense: a player on the single flute, Ath.

div1.head: μοναχῆ
div1.sense: in one way only, Plat.; ᾗπερ μοναχῇ in which way only, Xen.

div1.head: μοναχός
div1.sense: single, solitary: as Subst. a monk, Anth.

div1.head: μοναχοῦ
div1.sense: alone, only, μ. ἐνταῦθα Plat.

div1.head: μοναχῶς
div1.sense: in one way only, Arist.

div1.head: μονερέτης
div1.sense: one who rows singly, Anth.

div1.head: μονή
div1.sense: a staying, abiding, tarrying, stay, Hdt., Eur., etc.; μονὴν ποιεῖσθαι to make delay, tarry, Thuc.: a stopping place, station, mansion, NTest.

div1.head: μονήρης
div1.sense: single, solitary, Luc.

div1.head: μόνιμος
div1.sense: staying in oneʼs place, stable, steadfast, Soph., Plat.; of soldiers, Lat. statarius, Xen.
of things, conditions and the like, abiding, lasting, stable, Lat. stabilis, Eur., Thuc., etc.

div1.head: μόνιππος
div1.sense: one who uses a single horse, a horseman, rider, Xen., etc.

div1.head: μονοβάμων
div1.sense: walking alone: μέτρον μ. metre of but one foot, Anth.

div1.head: μονογενής
div1.note: μονο-γενής, Epic and Ionic μουνο-γενής, ές
div1.sense: only-begotten, single, Hes., Hdt., etc.; μ. αἷμα one and the same blood, Eur.

div1.head: μονόγληνος
div1.sense: one-eyed, Anth.

div1.head: μονοδάκτυλος
div1.sense: one-fingered, Luc.

div1.head: μονοδέρκτης
div1.sense: one-eyed, Eur.

div1.head: μονόδουπος
div1.sense: uniform in sound, Anth.

div1.head: μονόδους
div1.sense: one-toothed, Aesch.

div1.head: μονόδροπος
div1.sense: plucked from one stem, cut from one block, of a statue, Pind.

div1.head: μονοειδής
div1.sense: of one form or kind, uniform, Plat.

div1.head: μονόζυξ
div1.sense: yoked alone, i. e. single, solitary, Aesch.:—so μονοζυγής, ές, Anth.

div1.head: μονοήμερος
div1.sense: lasting one day only, Batr.

div1.head: μονόθεν
div1.sense: alone, singly, Hdt.

div1.head: μονοκέλης
div1.sense: a single horse, Anth.

div1.head: μονόκερως
div1.sense: with but one horn, Plut.

div1.head: μονόκλαυτος
div1.sense: μονό-κλαυτος, θρῆνος, ὁ, a lament by one only, Aesch.

div1.head: μονόκλινον
div1.sense: a bed for one only, i. e. a coffin, Anth.

div1.head: μονοκρήπις
div1.sense: with but one sandal, Pind.

div1.head: μονόκροτος
div1.sense: with one bank of oars, Xen.

div1.head: μονόκωλος
div1.sense: with but one leg: of buildings, of one story, Hdt.:—of sentences, consisting of one clause, Arist.:—generally, of one kind, one-sided. Arist.

div1.head: μονόκωπος
div1.sense: with one oar or one ship, Eur.

div1.head: μονολέων
div1.sense: a singularly huge lion, Anth.

div1.head: μονόλιθος
div1.sense: made out of one stone, Hdt.

div1.head: μονόλυκος
div1.sense: a singularly huge wolf, Plut.

div1.head: μονομαχέω
div1.sense: to fight in single combat, Eur.; τινι with one, Hdt.; of the Athenians at Marathon, μοῦνοι μουνομαχήσαντες τῷ Πέρσῃ having fought single-handed with the Persians, Hdt.

div1.head: μονομαχία
div1.sense: single combat, Hdt.

div1.head: μονομαχικός
div1.sense: of or in single combat, Polyb.

div1.head: μονομάχος
div1.sense: fighting in single combat, Aesch., Eur.
μονομάχος, a gladiator, Luc.

div1.head: μονομερής
div1.sense: consisting of one part, Luc.

div1.head: μονομήτωρ
div1.sense: reft of mother, Eur.

div1.head: μονονυχί
div1.sense: in a single night, Anth.

div1.head: μονόξυλος
div1.sense: made from a solid trunk, Xen.
made of wood only, Plat.

div1.head: μονόπαις
div1.sense: an only child, Eur.

div1.head: μονόπελμος
div1.sense: with but one sole, Anth.

div1.head: μονόπεπλος
div1.sense: wearing the tunic only, Eur.

div1.head: μονόπους
div1.sense: one-footed, Anth.

div1.head: μονοπραγματέω
div1.sense: to be engaged in one thing, Arist.

div1.head: μονοπωλία
div1.sense: exclusive sale, monopoly, Arist.

div1.head: μονόπωλος
div1.sense: with one horse, Eur.

div1.head: μονορύχης
div1.sense: digging with one point, Anth.

div1.head: μονοσιτέω
div1.sense: to eat once in the day, Xen.

div1.head: μόνος
div1.note: .μόνος, Epic and Ionic μοῦνος, η, ον
div1.sense: alone, left alone, forsaken solitary, Lat. solus, Hom., etc.; μοῦνος ἐών Hom.; μούνω ἄνευθʼ ἄλλων Od.
c. gen., μόνος σοῦ without thee, Soph.; also, μοῦνος ἀπό τινος Hhymn., Soph.
alone, only, μοῦνος παῖς υἱός an only son. Hom.; εἷς μόνος, μόνος εἷς Hdt., Soph.
c. gen., μοῦνος πάντων ἀνθρώπων alone of all men, Hdt.; μόνος ἀνδρῶν Soph., etc.
Sup. μονώτατος, the one only person, one above all others, Ar., Theocr.
adv. μόνως, only, Thuc., Xen.
the common adv. is μόνον, alone, only, Lat. solum, Hdt., Attic; οὐχ ἅπαξ μ. Aesch.
only, Lat. modo, with an imperat., ἀποκρίνου μ. Plat.; μή με καταπίῃς μ. Eur.
the adj. often stands as an adv., χοίνικος μόνης ἁλῶν for a gallon of salt only, Ar.
οὐ μόνον . . , ἀλλὰ καὶ . . , Ar., etc.:— μόνον, like Lat. solum, is sometimes omitted in these phrases, μὴ τοὺς ἐγγύς, ἀλλὰ καὶ τοὺς ἀπόθεν Thuc.
μόνον οὐ, Like Lat. tantum non, all but, Ar., Dem.; μονονουχί Dem.
κατὰ μόνας, as adv. alone, Thuc.

div1.head: μονοστιβής
div1.sense: walking alone, Aesch.

div1.head: μονόστιχος
div1.sense: consisting of one verse, Anth.; τὰ μ. single verses, Plut.

div1.head: μονόστολος
div1.sense: going alone, alone, single, Eur.

div1.head: μονοστόρθυγξ
div1.sense: carved out of a single block, Anth.

div1.head: μονοσύλλαβος
div1.sense: of one syllable, dealing in monosyllables, of grammarians, Anth.

div1.head: μονότεκνος
div1.sense: with but one child, Eur.

div1.head: μονοτράπεζος
div1.sense: at a solitary table, Eur.

div1.head: μονότροπος
div1.sense: living alone, solitary, Eur.

div1.head: μονοτροφέω
div1.sense: to eat but one kind of food, Strab.

div1.head: μονοτροφία
div1.sense: a rearing singly, Plat.

div1.head: μονόφθαλμος
div1.sense: one-eyed, Hdt.

div1.head: μονόφρουρος
div1.sense: watching alone, sole guardian, Aesch.

div1.head: μονόφρων
div1.sense: single in oneʼs opinion, Aesch.

div1.head: μονοφυής
div1.sense: of single nature, single, Hdt.

div1.head: μονόχηλος
div1.sense: solid-hoofed, Eur.

div1.head: μονοχίτων
div1.sense: wearing only the tunic, Luc.

div1.head: μονόψηφος
div1.sense: voting alone, μονόψαφον κατασχοῖσα ξίφος keeping her sword solitary of purpose, of Hypermnestra, Pind.

div1.head: μονόω
div1.sense: to make single or solitary, ἡμετέρην γενεὴν μούνωσε isolated our house, i. e. allowed but one son in each generation, Od.
Pass. to be left alone or forsaken, Hom.; ἐμουνοῦντο they were left each man by himself, Hdt.; μουνωθέντα taken apart, without witnesses, Hdt.
c. gen., μεμουνωμένοι συμμάχων deserted by allies, Hdt.; μονωθεὶς δάμαρτος Eur.; μονωθεῖσα ἀπὸ πατρός Eur.

div1.head: μονῳδέω
div1.sense: to sing a monody or solo, Ar.

div1.head: μονῳδία
div1.sense: a monody or solo, opp. to the song of the chorus, Ar.

div1.head: μόνωσις
div1.sense: separation from, τινος, Plut.

div1.head: μονώτης
div1.sense: solitary, Arist.

div1.head: μονώψ
div1.note: μον-ώψ, Ionic μουνώψ, ῶπος, ὁ, ἡ,
div1.sense: one-eyed, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: μόρα
div1.sense: a mora, one of the six regiments in which all spartans of military age were enrolled, Xen.

div1.head: μορέω
div1.sense: to make with pain and toil, Anth.

div1.head: μορία
div1.sense: (sc. ἐλαῖαι), αἱ, , the sacred olives in the Academy, prob. so called, because parted (μειρόμεναι) from the original olive-stock in the Acropolis, Ar.:— Ζεὺς Μόριος, was the guardian of these sacred olives, Soph.

div1.head: μόριον
div1.sense: a piece, portion, section, Hdt., Plat., etc.; of quarters of the glove, Hdt.; of parts of a country, Thuc.; of an army, Thuc.
a member of a council, Arist.

div1.head: μόριος
div1.sense: = μόρσιμος, anth.
v. μορίαι.

div1.head: μορμολύττομαι
div1.sense: Dep.:
to frighten, scare, Ar., Plat.
to be afraid of, τι Plat.

div1.head: μορμορωπός
div1.sense: hideous to behold, Ar.

div1.head: μορμύρω
div1.etym: Formed from the sound, like Lat. murmur.
div1.sense: of water, to roar and boil, Il.

div1.head: Μορμώ
div1.sense: a hideous she-monster, used by nurses to frighten children with, Luc.: generally, a bugbear, Ar., Xen.
as an exclamation to frighten children with, boh! μορμώ, δάκνει ἵππος Theocr.; μορμὼ τοῦ θράσους a fig for his courage! Ar.

div1.head: μορόεις
div1.sense: of earrings, wrought with much pains, skilfully wrought, Hom.

div1.head: μόρος
div1.sense: = μοῖρα III, manʼs appointed doom, fate, destiny, μόρος ἐστὶν ὀλέσθαι ʼtis oneʼs doom to die, Il.; ὑπὲρ μόρον beyond oneʼs destiny, Hom.
doom, death, Lat. fatum, Il., Hdt., Trag.
= νεκρός, a corpse, Anth.
the son of Night, Hes.

div1.head: μόρσιμος
div1.sense: appointed by fate, destined, Lat. fatalis, Hom., Hdt., Aesch.; τὸ μόρσιμον destiny, doom, Pind., Trag.; τὰ μόρσιμα Solon.
fore-doomed to die, Hom.

div1.head: μορύσσω
div1.sense: to soil, stain, defile: perf. pass. part. μεμορυγμένα καπνῷ Od.

div1.head: μορφάζω
div1.sense: to use gesticulations, Xen.

div1.head: μορφάω
div1.sense: to shape, fashion, mould, Anth.

div1.head: Μορφεύς
div1.sense: Morpheus, god of dreams, because of the forms he calls up before the sleeper, Ovid.

div1.head: μορφήεις
div1.sense: formed, λίθου of stone, Anth.: esp. well-formed, shapely, Lat. formosus, Pind.

div1.head: μορφή
div1.sense: form, shape, Lat. forma, σοὶ δʼ ἐπὶ μὲν μορφὴ ἐπέων thou hast power to give shape to words, i. e. to give a colour of truth to lies, Od.; θεὸς μορφὴν ἔπεσι στέφει God adds a crown of shapeliness to his words, Od.
form, shape, figure, esp. like Lat. forma, a fine or beautiful form, Pind., Trag.
generally, form, fashion, appearance, Soph., Xen.
a form, kind, sort, Eur., Plat.

div1.head: μόρφνος
div1.sense: epith. of an eagle, prob. dusky, dark, Lat. furvus, Il., Hes.

div1.head: μορφόω
div1.sense: to give form or shape to, Anth.

div1.head: μόρφωμα
div1.sense: form, shape, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: μόρφωσις
div1.sense: form, semblance, NTest.

div1.head: μορφώτρια
div1.sense: συῶν μ. changing men into swine, Eur.

div1.head: Μοσσύνοικοι
div1.sense: dwellers-in-wooden-houses, a people on the Black Sea, near Colchis, Xen., etc.

div1.head: μόσσυν
div1.sense: a wooden house or tower, Xen.

div1.head: μόσχειος
div1.sense: of a calf, κρέα μόσχεια veal, Xen.; μόσχεια alone, anth.; μ. αἷμα Xen.; μ. κυνοῦχος a calf-skin leash, Xen.; μόσχειον (sc. δέρμα) , a calf skin, Xen.

div1.head: μοσχεύω
div1.sense: to plant a sucker: metaph. to plant or propagate men, Dem.

div1.head: μοσχίδιον
div1.sense: a young shoot, συκίδων from fig-trees, Ar.

div1.head: μοσχίον
div1.sense: a young calf, Theocr.

div1.head: μόσχος
div1.sense: a young shoot or twig, Il.: cf. ὄσχος, ὄζος.

div1.head: μόσχος2
div1.sense: a calf, Eur.: a young bull, which form the god Apis was believed to assume, Hdt.: and as fem. a heifer, young cow, Eur.:—a calf was the prize of Lyric Poets, ᾄδειν ἐπὶ μόσχῳ Ar.
metaph. a boy, or as fem. a girl, maid, Lat. juvenca, Eur.
any young animal, Eur.

div1.head: μοτός
div1.sense: shredded linen, lint, cf. ἔμμοτος.

div1.head: μουνάξ
div1.sense: singly, in single combat, Od.

div1.head: Μουνυχία
div1.sense: Munychia, a harbour at Athens between Phalerum and Peiraeeus, Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: Μουνυχίασι
div1.sense: at Munychia, Thuc.

div1.head: Μουνυχιών
div1.sense: the 10th Attic month, in which was held the festival of Munychian Artemis, = the latter part of April and beginning of May, Ar., Aeschin.

div1.head: Μουσαγέτης
div1.sense: leader of the Muses, Lat. Musagetes, of Apollo, Plat.

div1.head: Μοῦσα
div1.sense: the Muse, in pl. the Muses, goddesses of song, music, poetry, dancing, the drama, and all fine arts, Hom.: the names of the nine were Clio, Euterpe, Thalia, Melpomene, Terpsichore, Erato, Polymnia or Polyhymnia, Urania, and Calliope, Hes.,
μοῦσα, as appellat., music, song, Pind., Trag.:—also eloquence, Eur.:—in pl. arts, accomplishments, Ar., Plat.

div1.head: Μουσεῖον
div1.sense: a temple of the Muses, seat or haunt of the Muses, Aeschin.

generally, a school of art and poetry, Aeschin.: metaph., μουσεῖα θρηνήμασι ξυνῳδά choirs chiming in with dirges, Eur.; χελιδόνων μουσεῖα choirs of swallows (whose twittering was a type of barbarous tongues), Ar.

div1.head: Μούσειος
div1.sense: of or belonging to the Muses, Eur.; ἅρμα Μοισαῖον the car of poesy, Pind.; λίθος M. a monument of song, Pind.
musical, Anth.

div1.head: μουσίζω
div1.sense: to sing of, chant, Theocr.:—Mid. in act. sense, Eur.

div1.head: μουσική
div1.sense: any art over which the Muses presided, esp. music or lyric poetry, Hdt., Attic
generally, art, letters, accomplishment, Hdt., Plat.; young Athenians were taught μουσική, γράμματα, γυμναστική, Plat., Arist.

div1.head: μουσικός
div1.sense: of or for music, musical, Ar., Thuc., etc.; τὰ μουσικά music, Xen.; v. μουσική.
of persons, skilled in music, musical, Xen., Plat.
generally, a votary of the Muses, a man of letters and accomplishment, a scholar, Ar., Plat.:—c. inf., μουσικώτεροι λέγειν more accomplished in speaking, Eur.
adv. -κῶς, harmoniously, suitably, Plat.: Sup. μουσικώτατα Ar.

div1.head: μουσόδομος
div1.sense: built by song, of the walls of Thebes, Anth.

div1.head: μουσόληπτος
div1.sense: Muse-inspired, Plut.

div1.head: μουσομανέω
div1.sense: to be Muse-mad, Luc.

div1.head: μουσομανής
div1.sense: devoted to the Muses, Anth.

div1.head: μουσομήτωρ
div1.sense: the mother of Muses and all arts, of Memory, Aesch.

div1.head: μουσόω
div1.sense: Pass. to be trained in the ways of the Muses, to be educated or accomplished, Ar., Pericl.

div1.head: μουσοποιέω
div1.sense: to write poetry: to sing of, τινά Ar.

div1.head: μουσοποιός
div1.sense: making poetry, a poet, poetess, Hdt.
singing or playing, Eur.

div1.head: μουσοπόλος
div1.sense: serving the Muses; μ. στοναχά a tuneful lament, Eur.
as Subst. a bard, minstrel, poet, Eur.

div1.head: μουσοπρόσωπος
div1.sense: musical-looking, Anth.

div1.head: μουσουργία
div1.sense: a singing, making poetry, Luc.

div1.head: μουσουργός
div1.sense: cultivating music: as Subst. a singing girl, Xen.

div1.head: μουσοφιλής
div1.sense: loving the Muses, Anth.

div1.head: μουσοχαρής
div1.sense: delighting in the Muses, Anth.

div1.head: μοχθέω
div1.sense: to be weary with toil, to be sore distressed, Il., Soph.:— to work hard, labour, Eur., etc.; c. acc. cogn., μ. μόχθους, πόνους to undergo hardships, or to execute painful tasks, Eur.; μ. μαθήματα to toil at learning, Eur.
c. acc. objecti, τέκνα ἁμόχθησα the children whom I toiled for, Eur.; μ. τινά θεραπεύμασιν θεραπεύειν, Eur.; cf. μόχθος.

div1.head: μόχθημα
div1.sense: always in pl. toils, hardships, Trag.

div1.head: μοχθηρία
div1.sense: bad condition, badness, Plat.
in moral sense, badness, wickedness, depravity, Ar., Plat.; τὰ πρῶτα τῆς ἐκεῖ μ. chief of the rascaldom down there (in Hades), Ar.

div1.head: μοχθηρός
div1.sense: suffering hardship, in sore distress, miserable, wretched, Aesch., Ar., etc.; μοχθηρὰ τλῆναι to suffer hardships, Aesch.
in a bad state, in sorry plight, worthless, Ar., Plat., etc.:—adv., μοχθηρῶς διακεῖσθαι to be in a sorry plight, Plat.; so in comp., μοχθηροτέρως ἔχειν Plat.; -ότερον Xen.:—Sup. -ότατα Plat.
in moral sense, wicked, knavish, rascally, Lat. pravus, Thuc., Ar., etc.

div1.head: μοχθητέος
div1.sense: one must labour, Eur.

div1.head: μοχθίζω
div1.sense: to suffer, ἕλκει μοχθίζοντα ὕδρου suffering by its sting, Il.; μ. δαίμονι φαύλῳ Theogn.

div1.head: μόχθος
div1.sense: toil, hard work hardship, distress, trouble, Hes., Trag.: pl. toils, troubles, hardships, Trag.; τέκνων for children, Eur. -μόχθος and πόνος are both used in the sense of hardship, distress; yet this notion belongs properly to μόχθος, while πόνος is properly work, Lat. labor (from πένομαι, πένης, the poor manʼs lot).

div1.head: μοχλευτής
div1.sense: one who heaves by a lever, γῆς καὶ θαλάσσης μ. he who makes earth and sea to heave, Ar.; καινῶν ἐπῶν μ. one who heaves up new words, Ar.

div1.head: μοχλεύω
div1.sense: to prise up, heave up by a lever, Hdt., Eur.

div1.head: μοχλέω
div1.sense: στήλας ἐμόχλεον they strove to heave them up with levers, Il.

div1.head: μοχλός
div1.sense: a bar used as a lever, a crowbar, handspike, Lat, vectis, used for moving ships, Od.; for forcing doors and gates, Eur.
the stake which Ulysses ran into the Cyclopsʼ eye, Od.
a wooden bar, placed across gates on the inside and secured by the βάλανος, Aesch., Thuc.

div1.head: μʼ
div1.sense: apostr. for με.
rarely for μοι, Hom.

div1.head: μυάγρα
div1.sense: a mouse-trap, Anth.

div1.head: μυγαλῆ
div1.sense: the shrew-mouse, field-mouse, Lat. mus araneus, Hdt.

div1.head: μυγμός
div1.sense: a moaning, muttering, Aesch.

div1.head: μυδαλέος
div1.sense: wet, dripping, Il., Hes., Soph.

div1.head: μυδάω
div1.sense: to ooze with damp, be clammy from decay, of a corpse, Soph.; μυδῶσα κηκίς clammy moisture, Soph.; μυδῶσαι σταγόνες oozing drops, Soph.

div1.head: μυδροκτυπέω
div1.sense: to forge red-hot iron, Aesch.

div1.head: μυδροκτύπος
div1.sense: forging red-hot iron, μ. μίμημα the manner of a smith smiting iron, Eur.

div1.head: μύδρος
div1.sense: a mass of red-hot metal, Hdt.; μύδρους αἴρειν χεροῖν to hold red-hot iron in the hands, as an ordeal, Soph.

div1.head: μυέλινος
div1.sense: of marrow; = μυελόεις, Anth.

div1.head: μυελόεις
div1.sense: full of marrow, Od.

div1.head: μυελός
div1.sense: marrow, Lat. medulla, Il., Hom., etc.:— the brain, Soph.: metaph. of strengthening food, οἶνον καὶ ἄλφιτα, μυελὸν ἀνδρῶν Od.; πρὸς ἄκρον μ. ψυχῆς the marrow or inmost part, Eur.; Τρινακρίας μ., of Syracuse, Theocr.

div1.head: μυέω
div1.sense: to initiate into the mysteries, μυῆσαι Dem.:—in Pass. to be initiated, Hdt., Ar.; οἱ μεμυημένοι the initiated, Ar.; c. acc. cogn. to be initiated in a thing, τὰ Καβείρων ὄργια μεμύηται in the mysteries of the Cabiri, Hdt.; τὰ μέγαλα (sc. μυστήρια) μεμύησαι Plat.
generally to teach, instruct, c. inf., ἐμύησάς τινα ἰδεῖν Anth.

div1.head: μύζω
div1.sense: to murmur with closed lips, to mutter, moan, Aesch.; οἰκτισμὸν μ. to make a piteous moaning, Aesch.
to drink with closed lips, to suck in, Xen.

div1.head: μυθέομαι
div1.sense: to say, speak, absol., Il.:—c. acc. et inf. to say that, Il.: c. inf. only, to order, Aesch.:—c. acc. to tell, recount, Hom.; also, to tell of, Il.:—c. acc. cogn. to say, speak, utter, Hom.; πόλιν μ. πολύχρυσον to speak of the city as rich in gold, Il.
to say over to oneself, con over, consider, Hom.

div1.head: μύθευμα
div1.sense: a story told, tale, Arist., Plut.

div1.head: μυθεύω
div1.sense: later form of μυθέομαι, Eur.:—Pass. to be spoken of, Eur.; ὡς μεμύθευται βροτοῖς as is related by mortals, Eur.

div1.head: μυθιάζομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to recount fables, Babr.

div1.head: μυθίαμβοι
div1.sense: a collection of Fables, like those of Babr.

div1.head: μυθικός
div1.sense: mythic, legendary, Plat.

div1.head: μυθογραφέω
div1.sense: to write fabulous accounts, Strab.

div1.head: μυθογραφία
div1.sense: a writing of fables, Strab.

div1.head: μυθογράφος
div1.sense: a writer of legends, Polyb., Plut.

div1.head: μυθολογεύω
div1.sense: to tell word for word, Od.

div1.head: μυθολογέω
div1.sense: to tell mythic tales or legends, Plat., Xen.
c. acc. to tell as a legend or mythic tale, Plat.:—Pass., οἷαι μυθολογοῦνται παλαιαὶ γενέσθαι φύσεις such as they are fabled to have been, Plat.: impers., μυθολογεῖται the legend goes, Arist.
to invent like a mythical tale, μ. πολιτείαν to frame an imaginary constitution, Plat.
to tell stories, converse, Lat. confabulari, Plat.

div1.head: μυθολόγημα
div1.sense: a mythical narrative, Plat., Plut.

div1.head: μυθολογητέος
div1.etym: verb. adj. of μυθολογέω I, Plat.

div1.head: μυθολογία
div1.sense: a telling of mythic legends, legendary lore, mythology, Plat.
a legend, story, tale, Plat.

div1.head: μυθολογικός
div1.sense: versed in legendary lore, Plat.

div1.head: μυθολόγος
div1.sense: a teller of legends, romancer, Plat.

div1.head: μυθοποιός
div1.sense: making mythic legends, Plat.

div1.head: μῦθος
div1.sense: anything, delivered by word of mouth, word, speech, opp. to ἔργον, Hom., etc.
a speech in the public assembly, Od., Ar.
talk, conversation, mostly in pl., Od.
counsel, advice, a command, order, also a promise, Il.
the subject of speech, the thing or matter itself, Od., Eur.
a resolve, purpose, design, plan, Hom.
a saying, saw, proverb, Aesch.
the talk of men, rumour, Soph., Eur.

a tale, story, narrative, Hom.; μ. παιδός of or about him, Od.:—after Hom., μῦθος, like Lat. fabula, is a tale, legend, myth, opp. to λόγος the historic tale, Hdt., Plat., etc.: a fable, such as those of Aesop, Plat.

div1.head: μυθώδης
div1.sense: legendary, fabulous, Plat.: τὸ μ. the domain of fable, Thuc.; τὸ μὴ μ. αὐτῶν such part of them as is not fabulous, Thuc.

div1.head: μυῖα
div1.sense: a fly, Lat. musca, Il.:—proverb., μυίης θάρσος, of excessive boldness, Il.

div1.head: μυιοσόβη
div1.sense: a fly-flap, of a long beard, Anth.

div1.head: μυιοσόβος
div1.sense: flapping away flies, Anth.

div1.head: μυκάομαι
div1.etym: Formed from the sound, cf. βληχάομαι, μηκάομαι, βρυχάομαι, βρωμάομαι.
div1.sense: Lat. mugire, to low, bellow, roar, of oxen, Il.; of calves, Od; of Hercules in agony, Eur., etc.
of things, as of heavy gates, to grate, creak, Il.; of a shield, to ring, Il.; of meat roasting, to hiss upon the spits, Od.; of thunder, Ar.

div1.head: μυκηθμός
div1.sense: a lowing, bellowing, of oxen, Hom.

div1.head: μύκημα
div1.sense: a lowing, bellowing, roaring, of oxen, Eur.; of a lioness, Theocr.; the roar of thunder, Aesch.

div1.head: Μυκηναῖος
div1.sense: Mycenaean, Hom., etc.: fem. Μυκηνίς, ίδος, Eur.

div1.head: Μυκήνηθεν
div1.sense: from Mycene, Il.

div1.head: Μυκήνη
div1.sense: Mycene, Mycenae, an ancient Pelasgic or Achaean city, superseded by the Dorian Argos, Hom., etc.

div1.head: μύκης
div1.sense: a mushroom, Lat. fungus.
any thing shaped like a mushroom,
the chape or cap at the end of a scabbard, Hdt.
the snuff of a lamp-wick, supposed to forbode rain, Ar.

div1.head: μυκητής
div1.sense: a bellower, of oxen, Theocr.

div1.head: μυκήτινος
div1.sense: made of mushrooms, Luc.

div1.head: μυκτηρίζω
div1.sense: to turn up the nose or sneer at:—Pass. to be mocked, NTest.

div1.head: μυκτηρόθεν
div1.sense: out of the nose, Anth.

div1.head: μυκτηρόκομπος
div1.sense: sounding from the nostril, Aesch.

div1.head: μυκτήρ
div1.sense: the nose, snout, Ar.: in pl. the nostrils, Hdt., Ar.
from the use of the nose to express ridicule, a sneerer, Anth.

div1.head: μυλαῖος
div1.sense: of or working in a mill, Anth.

div1.head: μύλαξ
div1.sense: a millstone, a large round stone, Il.

div1.head: μυλεργάτης
div1.sense: a miller, Anth.

div1.head: μύλη
div1.sense: Lat. mola, a mill, a handmill turned by women, Od.
the nether millstone, Ar.; the upper being ὄνος, Ar.

div1.head: μυλήφατος
div1.sense: bruised in a mill, Od.

div1.head: μυλιάω
div1.sense: to grind the teeth, Hes., in Epic part. μυλιόωντες.

div1.head: μυλίας
div1.sense: masc. adj. of or for a mill, λίθος μ. a mill stone, Plat.
rock for millstones, Strab.

div1.head: μυλικός
div1.sense: of or for a mill, λίθος NTest.

div1.head: μυλοειδής
div1.sense: like a millstone, Lat. molaris, Il.

div1.head: μύλος
div1.sense: a millstone, Strab.

div1.head: μυλωθρός
div1.sense: a miller who keeps slaves to work his mill, Dem.

div1.head: μυλών
div1.sense: a mill-house, Thuc.; εἰς μ. καταβαλεῖν, Lat. detrudere in pistrinum, to condemn [a slave] to work the mill, Eur.

div1.head: μύνη
div1.sense: an excuse, pretence, Od.

div1.head: μύξα
div1.sense: the discharge from the nose, Lat. pituita, Hes., etc.

div1.head: μυξωτῆρες
div1.sense: the nostrils, Lat. nares, Hdt.

div1.head: μυοθηρέω
div1.sense: to catch mice, Strab.

div1.head: μυοκτόνος
div1.sense: mouse-killing, Batr.

div1.head: μυομαχία
div1.sense: a battle of mice, Plut.

div1.head: μυοπάρων
div1.sense: a light vessel, chiefly used by pirates, Plut.

div1.head: μύουρος
div1.sense: mouse-tailed: curtailed, Arist.

div1.head: μύ
div1.sense: a muttering sound made with the lips, μῦ λαλεῖν to mutter, Hippon.:—to imitate the sound of sobbing, μὺ μῦ, μὺ μῦ, or rather μυμῦ, μυμῦ, Ar.

div1.head: μῦ
div1.sense: Μ, μ, μῦ, τό:—indecl., twelfth letter in the Gr. alphabet: as numerals, μ 40, but Μ 40,000.
μ is the labial liquid, corresponding to β:
changes:
Aeolic and Lacon. into π, as πεδά for μετά.
Attic and Doric into ν, as νιν for μιν; so Lat. ne, num = μή, μῶν.
μ is doubled,
poet. in compds., as ἄμμορος, φιλομμειδής; and after the augm., as ἔλλαβον.
Aeolic, as ἄμμες ὔμμες ἐμμί, for ἡμεῖς ὑμεῖς εἰμί.
μ is added,
at the beginning of a word, as ἴα μία, ὄσχος μόσχος.
in the middle of a word to facilitate pronunciation, as ὄμβριμος ὄβριμος, τύμπανον τύπανον, etc., esp. after redupl., as πίμπλημι for πίπλημι; after α- privat., as ἄμβροτος, ἄβροτος.

div1.head: μύραινα
div1.sense: Lat. muraena, a sea-eel, lamprey, Ar.; a sea-serpent, Aesch.

div1.head: μυρεψέω
div1.sense: to prepare unguents, Aesop.

trans.i: one who prepares unguents. a perfumer.

div1.head: μυριάκις
div1.sense: ten thousand times, Ar.

div1.head: μυριάμφορος
div1.sense: holding 10, 000 measures: metaph. of prodigious size, Ar.

div1.head: μυρίανδρος
div1.sense: containing 10, 000 inhabitants, Arist.

div1.head: μυριάρχης
div1.sense: commander of 10, 000 men, Hdt.: so μῡρί-αρχος, ου, Xen.

div1.head: μυριάς
div1.sense: a number of 10, 000, a myriad, Hdt., etc.; indefinitely of countless numbers, Eur.:—when μυριάς, μυριάδες are used absol. of money, δραχμῶν must be supplied, Ar.; when of corn, μεδίμνων, Dem.
adj. consisting of 10, 000, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: μυριετής
div1.sense: of 10, 000 years: of countless years, Aesch.

div1.head: μυρίζω
div1.sense: to rub with ointment or unguent, anoint, Ar.:—Pass., μεμυρισμένοι τὸ σῶμα having the body anointed, Hdt.

div1.head: μυρίκη
div1.sense: Lat. myrica, a shrub esp. thriving in marshy ground and near the sea, the tamarisk, Il.

div1.head: μυρικίνεος
div1.sense: a tamarisk bush, Anth.

div1.head: μυρίκινος
div1.sense: a tamarisk bough, Il.

div1.head: μυριόβοιος
div1.sense: with ten thousand oxen, Anth.

div1.head: μυριόδους
div1.sense: with immense teeth, Anth.

div1.head: μυριόκαρπος
div1.sense: with countless fruit, Soph.

div1.head: μυριόκρανος
div1.sense: many-headed, Eur.

div1.head: μυριόλεκτος
div1.sense: said ten thousand times, Xen.

div1.head: μυριόμορφος
div1.sense: of countless shapes, Anth.

div1.head: μυριόμοχθος
div1.sense: of countless labours, Anth.

div1.head: μυριόναυς
div1.sense: with countless ships, Anth.

div1.head: μυριόνεκρος
div1.sense: where tens of thousands die, Plut.

div1.head: μυριοπλάσιος
div1.sense: 0, 000 times as many as, c. gen., Xen., Arist.

div1.head: μυριοπληθής
div1.sense: infinite in number, Eur.

div1.head: μυρίος
div1.sense: numberless, countless, infinite, properly of Number, and commonly in pl., Hom.; in sg. with collective Nouns, μυρίον χέραδος Il.; χαλκός Pind.
of Size, measureless, immense, infinite, πένθος, ἄχος Il.; μ. κέλευθος an endless journey, Pind.; μ. χρόνος id.; μυρίη ὄψις all kinds of sights, Hdt., etc.
neut. pl. μυρία as adv., much, immensely, incessantly, κλαίειν Anth.
dat. as adv., μυρίῳ σοφώτερος infinitely wiser, Eur.; μυρίῳ βέλτιον, μ. κάλλιον Plat.

as a definite numeral, in pl. μύριοι, αι, α, ten thousand, the greatest number in Greek expressed by one word, Hes., etc.:—in sg. with collective nouns, ἵππος μυρίη 10, 000 horse, Hdt.; ἀσπὶς μυρία Xen.

div1.head: μυριοστός
div1.sense: the 10, 000 th, Ar.; μ. ἔτος 10, 000 years hence, Plat.

div1.head: μυριοστύς
div1.sense: a body of ten thousand, Xen.

div1.head: μυριοτευχής
div1.sense: with ten thousand armed men, Eur.

div1.head: μυριοφόρος
div1.sense: carrying 10, 000 measures, to designate a merchant-ship of large tonnage, Thuc.

div1.head: μυριόφωνος
div1.sense: with ten thousand voices, Anth.

div1.head: μυριωπός
div1.sense: with countless eyes, Aesch.

div1.head: μύρμηξ
div1.sense: Lat. formica, the ant, Hes., etc.
a beast of prey in India, Hdt.

div1.head: Μυρμιδόνες
div1.sense: the Myrmidons, a warlike people of Thessaly, subjects of Achilles, Hom.

div1.head: μυρόεις
div1.sense: anointed, Anth.

div1.head: μύρον
div1.sense: sweet juice extracted form plants, sweet-oil, unguent, balsam, Hdt., etc.
a place where unguents were sold, the perfume-market, Ar.

div1.head: μυρόπνοος
div1.sense: breathing sweet unguents, Anth.

div1.head: μυροπώλης
div1.sense: a dealer in unguents or scented oils, a perfumer, Xen.

div1.head: μυροπώλιον
div1.sense: a perfumerʼs shop, Dem.

div1.head: μυροφεγγής
div1.sense: shining with unguent, Anth.

div1.head: μυρόχριστος
div1.sense: anointed with unguent, Eur.

div1.head: μυρόχροος
div1.sense: with anointed skin, Anth.

div1.head: μυρσίνη
div1.sense: = μύρτος, Pind., Eur.
a branch or wreath of myrtle, Hdt., Ar.

div1.head: μυρσινοειδής
div1.sense: myrtle-like, Hhymn.

div1.head: μυρσινών
div1.sense: a myrtle-grove, Lat. myrtetum, Ar.

div1.head: μύρτον
div1.sense: a myrtle-berry, Lat. myrtum, Ar.

div1.head: μύρτος
div1.sense: the myrtle, Lat. myrtus, Simon., etc.
a twig or spray of myrtle, Pind., Ar.

div1.head: μύρω
div1.sense: Epic Verb, to flow, run, trickle, δάκρυσι μῦρον (Epic imperf.) were melting into tears, Hes.
Mid. to melt into tears, to shed tears, weep, Hom., Hes.
c. acc. to weep for, bewail, Bion., Mosch.

div1.head: μυσαρός
div1.sense: foul, dirty: hence, loathsome, abominable, Eur.; τὸ μ. an abomination, Hdt.
of persons, defiled, polluted, Eur.

div1.head: μυσάττομαι
div1.sense: Dep.: to feel disgust at anything loathsome, to loathe, abominate, c. acc., Eur., Xen.

div1.head: Μύσιος
div1.sense: a Mysian dirge, Aesch.; cf. Κίσσιος.

div1.head: μύσος
div1.sense: uncleanness of body or mind: metaph. an abomination, defilement, Lat. piaculum, Trag.

div1.head: Μυσός
div1.sense: a Mysian, Aesch.:—from their effeminate character, Μυσῶν λεία came to mean a prey to all, of anything that can be plundered with impunity, Dem.

div1.head: μῦς
div1.sense: Lat. mus, a mouse, Batr.; μ. ἀρουραῖος the field-mouse, or the hamster, Hdt.; μῦς πίσσας γεύεται, proverb. of one who is tempted to eat and finds himself caught, Theocr.
a muscle of the body, Lat. musculus, Theocr.

div1.head: μυσπολέω
div1.sense: to run about like a mouse, Ar.

div1.head: μυσταγωγία
div1.sense: initiation into the mysteries, Plut.

div1.head: μυσταγωγός
div1.sense: one who initiates into mysteries, a mystagogue, Plut.

div1.head: μύσταξ
div1.sense: Doric and Lacon. word, the upper lip, the moustache, Theocr.: cf. μάσταξ.

div1.head: μυστηρικός
div1.sense: of or for mysteries, mystic, Ar.

div1.head: μυστήριον
div1.sense: a mystery or secret doctrine; in pl., τὰ μ. the mysteries of the Cabiri in Samothrace, Hdt.; of Demeter at Eleusis, Aesch., etc.
any mystery or secret, Plat.
mystic implements, Eur., Ar.
in NTest. a mystery, a divine secret, something above human intelligence.

div1.head: μυστηριῶτις
div1.sense: of or for the mysteries: μ. σπονδή an armistice during the Eleusinian mysteries, Aeschin.

div1.head: μύστης
div1.sense: one initiated, Eur.
as adj. mystic, Ar., Anth.

div1.head: μυστικός
div1.sense: mystic, connected with the mysteries, μ. Ἴακχος the mystic chant Iacchus, Hdt.; τὰ μ. the mysteries, Thuc.:— χοιρία μ., in Ar., are prob. wretched lean pigs, such as the μύσται were wont to offer.

div1.head: μυστιλάομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to sop bread in soup or gravy and eat it, Ar.: metaph., μυστιλᾶται τῶν δημοσίων he ladles out public money, Ar.:—perf. part. in pass. sense, scooped out, Ar.

div1.head: μυστίλη
div1.sense: a piece of bread used to sup up soup or gravy with, Ar.

div1.head: μυστιπόλος
div1.sense: solemnising mysteries, performing mystic rites, Anth.

div1.head: μύστις
div1.sense: as adj. mystic, Anth.
a mystagogue, Anacreont.

div1.head: μυστοδόκος
div1.sense: receiving the initiated, δόμος μ., i. e. Eleusis, Ar.

div1.head: Μυτιλήνη
div1.sense: Mytilene, the chief city of Lesbos, Thuc.

div1.head: μυττωτεύω
div1.sense: to hash up, make mince-meat of, τινά Ar.

div1.head: μυττωτός
div1.sense: a savoury dish of cheese, honey, garlic, mashed up into a sort of paste, Lat. moretum, Ar.

div1.head: μυχθίζω
div1.sense: to snort, jeer, Theocr.

div1.head: μυχθισμός
div1.sense: a snorting, moaning, Eur.

div1.head: μύχιος
div1.sense: inward, inmost, retired, embayed, Aesch., Luc.

div1.head: μυχμός
div1.sense: = μυγμός moaning, groaning, Od.

div1.head: μυχόθεν
div1.sense: adv. from the inmost part of the house, from the womenʼs chambers, Aesch.

div1.head: μυχοίτατος
div1.sense: in the farthest corner, Od.

div1.head: μυχόνδε
div1.sense: adv. to the far corner, Od.

div1.head: μυχός
div1.sense: the innermost place, inmost nook or corner, Lat. sinus, recessus, Hom., etc.
the inmost part of a house, the womenʼs apartments, Lat. penetralia, Od., Trag.
a bay or creek running far inland, Hdt.; πόντιος μ., i. e. the Adriatic, Aesch.

div1.head: μυχώδης
div1.sense: full of recesses, cavernous, Eur.

div1.head: μυών
div1.sense: a cluster of muscles, a muscle, Il.

div1.head: μυωπάζω
div1.sense: to be shortsighted, see dimly, NTest.

div1.head: μύω
div1.sense: intr. to close, be shut, of the eyes, Il., Eur.; so, χείλεα μεμυκώς having the lips closed, Anth.
of persons, μύσας with oneʼs eyes shut, Soph., Ar.
metaph. to be lulled to rest, to abate, of pain, Soph.; of storms, Anth.
trans. to close, shut, Anth.

div1.head: μυωπίζω
div1.sense: to spur, prick with a spur, Xen.
Pass. (μύωψ II. 1) to be teased by flies, of a horse, Xen.

div1.head: μύωψ
div1.sense: contracting the eyes, as shortsighted people do, shortsighted, Arist.
as Subst., the horsefly or gadfly, Lat. tabanus, Aesch., Plat.
a good, spur, Xen., Theophr.:—metaph. a stimulant, Luc., Anth.

div1.head: μῶλος
div1.sense: the toil and moil of war, Il.; ξείνου καὶ Ἴρου μ. the struggle between Irus and the stranger, Od.

div1.head: μῶλυ
div1.sense: moly, mandrake, a fabulous herb of magic power, having a black root and white blossom, given by Hermes to Ulysses, as a counter-charm to the charms of Circe, Od.

div1.head: μωμάομαι
div1.sense: Dep.: to find, fault with, blame, c. acc., Il., Aesch.:—an aor1 inf. μωμηθῆναι in pass. sense, NTest.

div1.head: μωμητός
div1.sense: to be blamed, Aesch.

div1.head: μῶμος
div1.sense: blame, ridicule, disgrace, μῶμον ἀνάψαι to set a brand upon one, Od.
personified Momus, the critic God, Hes.

div1.head: μῶν
div1.sense: contr. for μὴ οὖν, used like μή, in questions to which a negative answer is expected, but surely not? is it so? Lat. num? μῶν ἐστι . . ; Answ. οὐ δῆτα, Eur.: sometimes it asks doubtingly like Lat. num forte? and answered in the affirm., Eur.: — μῶν οὐ . . ; requires an affirm. answer, Lat. nonne ? Trag.

div1.head: μῶνυξ
div1.sense: with a single, i. e. uncloven, hoof, Lat. solipes, of the horse, Hom., Eur.

div1.head: μωραίνω
div1.sense: to be silly, foolish, Eur., Xen., etc.:—c. acc. rei, πεῖραν μωραίνειν to make a mad attempt, Aesch.
Causal, to make foolish, convict of folly, NTest.:—Pass., of salt, to become insipid, lose its savour, NTest.

div1.head: μωρία
div1.sense: silliness, folly, μωρίην ἐπιφέρειν τινι to impute folly to him, Hdt.; μωρίαν ὀφλισκάνειν to be charged with it, Soph.; ἐδόκει μωρία εἶναι ταῦτα Thuc.; τῆς μωρίας! what folly! Ar.

div1.head: μωρολογία
div1.sense: silly talking, NTest.

div1.head: μωρολόγος
div1.sense: speaking foolishly, Arist.

div1.head: μωρόσοφος
div1.sense: foolishly wise, a sapient fool, Luc.

div1.head: μωρός
div1.sense: dull, sluggish, stupid, Soph., etc.; τὸ- μ. folly, Eur.; μῶρα φρονεῖν, δρᾶν, λέγειν Soph., Eur.:—adv. -ρως, Xen.
